$p_1=d_1$ is a pet belonging to $p_2$ of species $d_2$.
$c_1$ is pet food for pet $c_2=d_1=p_1$.
$s_1$ is zoology concerned with animals of type $d_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
$x_{1}$ fights/combats/struggles with $x_{2}$ over issue $x_{3}$ (abstract); $x_{1}$ is a fighter/combatant.
valsi.notes: Use $x_3$ tu'a for fight over an object/objective. See also {bradi}, {gunta}, {talsa}, {darlu}, {fapro}, {jamna}, {sonci}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a drum/cymbal/gong [percussion musical instrument] with beater/actuator $x_{2}$.
$t_1$ is a chimney made of of material $t_2$ for emitting/expelling smoke/gas/steam/magma $t_3=d_1$ from source $d_2$.
$t_1$ is a chimney made of of material $t_2$ for emitting/expelling smoke/gas/steam/magma $t_3=d_1$ from source $d_2$.
$v_1$ smokes/inhales $v_2$. $v_1$ is a smoker.
valsi.notes: not necessarily tobacco. Cf. {danmo}, {vasxu}. See also {tankyva'u}, {sigva'u}, {marnyva'u}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ hangs/dangles/is suspended from $x_{2}$ by/at/with joint $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Pendant (= {dadja'i}); also dependent (original meaning). See also {lasna}, {jorne}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is the answer/response/solution/[reply] to question/problem $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: (cf. ciksi, frati, preti, nabmi, spuda for agentive response/reply, cpedu)

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is an animal/creature of species $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is biologically animate.
$p_1$ is a trajectory of ballistic projectile $d_1$ fired by gun/launcher $d_2$, to destination $p_2$ from $p_3$ via $p_4$.
Denmark.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of smoke/smog/air pollution from source $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ may be a fire. See also {pulce}, {gapci}, {sigja}, {bumru}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (force) puts pressure on/presses/applies force to $x_{2}$.
$x1$ pertains to Denmark/Danish culture/nationality/language is aspect $x2$
$s_1$ is ballistics with methodology $s_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances reel to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances rumba to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) house dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) balboa dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances ballet to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
valsi.notes: Ballet dance works/ballets (={dansrbaleto zei selfi'i} / {dansrbaleto zei draci}).

valsi.definition: $d_1$ (individual, mass) is breaking/b-boying/b-girling/breakdances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) bugg dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
valsi.notes: Bugg is a common dance style in Sweden and is very popular on the dancefloors, when dansbands play. Dansband (=lo se dansrbuga {zgibe'e}). Dansband music (=lo se dansrbuga zgike).

valsi.definition: $d_1$ (individual, mass) boogie-woogie dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) cha-cha-cha dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances charleston to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) oriental/belly dances/dances raqs sharqi to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
valsi.notes: Raqs sharqi (Arabic: رقص شرقي‎ [ˈɾˤɑʔsˤe ˈʃæɾʔi]; literally "eastern/oriental dancing") is the style of "Oriental Dance, Egyptian Dance, Arabic" dance more familiar to Westerners, performed in restaurants and cabarets around the world.

valsi.definition: $d_1$ (individual, mass) dances shim sham to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) disco dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances jazz dance to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
valsi.notes: Not to be confused with swing dance. See also jazz music (={zgirdja'aza}).

valsi.definition: $d_1$ (individual, mass) dances fandango to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances flamenco to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances foxtrot to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances the Duck/Chicken/Bird Dance to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
valsi.notes: The name of the original Swiss song was "Der Ententanz" (The Duck Dance).

valsi.definition: $d_1$ (individual, mass) dances to hip-hop music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances jive to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) can-can dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) calypso dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances gangnam style to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances lambada to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances limbo to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$ under bar $x_3$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances lindy hop to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances locking to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$; $d_1$ is a locker.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances mazurka to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
valsi.notes: In Polish, this musical form is called "mazurek"—a word derived from "mazur," which up to the nineteenth century denoted an inhabitant of Poland's Mazovia region.

valsi.definition: $d_1$ (individual, mass) dances merengue to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances minuet to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) is/are banghra dancing to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances polka to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances polska to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
valsi.notes: The polska is a family of music and dance forms shared by the Nordic countries. Not to be confused with polka (={dansrpolka}).

valsi.definition: $d_1$ (individual, mass) dances popping to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$; $d_1$ is a popper.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances salsa to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances samba to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) tango dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances twist to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances waltz to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
valsi.notes: Viennese Waltz (=lo nu me la vin. dansrvalze).

valsi.definition: $d_1$ (individual, mass) dances vogue to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances hambo to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
valsi.notes: The hambo is a traditional dance that originated in Sweden in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.

valsi.definition: $d_1$ (individual, mass) dances hopak/gopak/cossack dance to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances schottisce to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$x_{1}$ (individual, mass) dances to accompaniment/music/rhythm $x_{2}$.
$c_1$ is a dance/ball involving participants $c_2=d_1$, to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a ballistic projectile [e.g. bullet/missile] for firing by [gun/propelling launcher] $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also cannonball, catapult stone, shot pellet(s). See also {cecla}, {renro}, {jakne}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a quiver/magazine for arrows/bullets $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is an island/atoll/key of [material/properties] $x_{2}$ in surroundings/body $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is insular.
$x_{1}$ curses/damns/condemns $x_{2}$ to fate (event) $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Curse with a specific expression (= {dapsku}). See also {mabla}, {dimna}, {cnemu}, {sfasa}, {dunda}, {cusku}, {cirko}, {jdima}, {di'ai}.

valsi.definition: $c_1=d_1$ (agent) curses/damns/condemns by expressing text $c_2$ $c_3=d_2$ via expressive medium $c_4$ to fate $d_3$ (event).
$x_1$ is an armadillo of species/breed $x_2$.
$t_1=d_2$ is a hell/cursed territory cursed by $t_2=d_1$.
$b_1$ carries/hauls/bears/transports cargo $b_2$ far away to $b_3=d_1$ from $b_4=d_2$ over path $b_5$.
$b_1$ carries/hauls/bears/transports cargo $b_2$ far away to $b_3=d_1$ from $b_4=d_2$ over path $b_5$.
$t_1$ is a telescope for examining $c_2=d_1$ which is far from $d_2$.
$du_1=da_1$ is too far/distant from $da_2$ in property $da_3$ (ka) by the standard of $du_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a road/highway to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ with route $x_{4}$ ($x_{2}$/$x_{3}$ may be unordered).
valsi.notes: A regularly used, improved-for-use surface for travelling. See also {naxle}, {tcana}, {pluta}, {klaji}.

valsi.definition: $j_1=d_1$ is the end of $j_2$ at $j_3$ far from $d_2$
$x_{1}$ argues for stand $x_{2}$ against stand $x_{3}$; [an opponent is not necessary].
$z_1=d_1$ is farther from $z_2=d_2$ in property $z_3=d_3$ by amount $z_4$.
$x_{1}$ is far/distant from $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
$p_1$ long jumps to $p_2$ from $p_3$ reaching height $p_4$.
$j_1=p_1$ long jumps with opponent(s) $j_2$ in contest/competition $j_3$ (event) for gain $j_4$.
$x_{1}$ shows audacity/chutzpah in behavior $x_{2}$ (event/activity); $x_{1}$ dares to do/be $x_{2}$ (event/ka).
$s_1=d_1$ stays/keeps back with $s_2$, distant from $d_2$.
$x_1$ encourages $x_2$ to do/be $x_3$.
$z_1=d_1$ becomes bolder/more audacious in behaviour $d_2$ (event/activity) by amount $z_3$.
Darussalam.
$t_1$ is a telescope for seeing $v_2=d_1$ which is far from $d_2$.
$x_{1}$ hits/strikes/[beats] $x_{2}$ with instrument [or body-part] $x_{3}$ at locus $x_{4}$.
$x_1=t_1=s_1$ acts like/similarly to fictional/imaginary character $x_2=t_2=s_2=xa_1$ imaginary to $x_3=xa_2$ in that they wear similar clothes, under conditions $x_4=t_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a pocket/pouch of/in garment/item $x_{2}$.
$b_1$ is a handkerchief of type/material $b_2$ in pocket $x_3=d_1$.
valsi.notes: For example worn in suit front pockets. Cf. {zbibu'u}.

valsi.definition: $c1=da1$ is a Pokémon/Pocket Monster of species $da2$
$x_1=c_1$ is a koala (Phascolarctos cinereus) of breed $x_2=c_2$
$m_1$ is a marsupial mammal of species $m_2$.
$x_{1}$ wears/is robed/garbed in $x_{2}$ as a garment of type $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ need not be intended for use as a garment (unlike taxfu). See also {taxfu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (event) destroys/ruins/wrecks/despoils $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is destructive.
$x_{1}$ is a ribbon/tape/strip/band/stripe of material $x_{2}$.
$x_1=t_2$ is a cross-dresser/transvestite wearing dress/garment/clothing $x_2=t_1$ serving purpose $t_3$.
$c_1=d_1$ is an alias/nickname of $c_2$ used by $c_3$ instead of name $d_2$, differing from it by standard $d_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a duck/[drake] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x1=c1=d1$ quacks $x2=c2$ expressing $x3=c3$
$p_1$ is eiderdown/feather/plume of duck species/breed $d_2$.
Duckburg
$z_1=d_1$ is a plurality of/more than all other subgroups of $z_2$ as seperated/classified by property $z_3=d_3$ by amount $z_4$.
valsi.notes: Made from {drata} + {zmadu}. Seems like both this and {xabmau} should have {klesi} in them, but it can be argued that the combination imports the idea of classification. See also {xabmau}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (du'u) [fact/measurement] is data/information/statistic(s) about $x_{2}$ gathered by method $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Evidence (= velji'i datni or just {velji'i}, {sidydatni}). See also {fatci}, {saske}, {vreji}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a makefile designed to produce output files / data / event $x_2$ from rules $x_3$.
valsi.notes: Doesn't refer only the makefiles for GNU make, but also to any such similar files intended to automate the building process. Technically and usually, makefiles just run commands which in turn are what create the output, but the x2 allows us to skip the extra verbosity by specifying the output data directly. If output data is irrelevant, i.e. the makefile runs commands which have no real output, then an event can be used to specify the result of the makefile. See also {zbaplrjavni} for how to fill the x3.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a pipe carrying data $x_2$ to $x_3$ from $x_4$.
$n_1=d_1$ is a report about $n_2=d_2$ from reporter $n_3$ to intended audience $n_4$.
$x_1=das_1$ is a signal recording and playback tape-type medium (cassette/DAT/tape drive) containing data/sound/image $x_2=dat_1$ with data storage mechanism/method $x_3$ (analog/digital)
$v_1$ is a computer variable/register/memory cell with contents $v_2=d_1$.
$g_1$ is computer memory, consisting of parts $x_2=g_2=v_1$.
$x_1=v_1$ is a file consisting of information $x_2=d_1=v_2$ about $x_3=d_2=v_3$ in medium $x_4=v_4$.
$l_1=v_1$ is a directory of files $l_2$ in order $l_3$ in medium $l_4=v_4$.
$n_1$ is a socket connecting $n_3$ to $n_2$ along route $n_4$ carrying data $x_5=d_1$.
valsi.notes: $x_1$ is the end opened with listen(); Cf. {datnyfle}.

valsi.definition: $pr_1$ is (a) heterosexual.
$x_1$ (event) is dated/pertaining to day/occurring on day $x_2$ of month $x_3$ of year $x_4$ in calendar $x_5$
valsi.notes: We felt that {detri} just didn't work as a culturally-independent date system. The use of {pi'e} or {joi} as date mechanisms was insufficient and having the date components built into the place structure seems far more elegant. (Cf. {masti}, {djedi}, {nanca}, {nu}, {fasnu}, {purci}, {balvi}, {jeftu})

valsi.definition: $v_1$ is a tourist/foreign visitor, visiting $v_2$ at place/event $v_3$ from country $x_4=g_1$.
digit/number: hex digit A (decimal 10) [ten].
attitudinal: equal intensity attitudinal relativizer
valsi.notes: Specifies an equal intensity - relative to any previously specified intensity of the same UI/cmavo. See also {mau'i}, {me'ai}, {cu'i}

valsi.definition: $c_1$ debate on topic/subject $c_2$.
$f_1=d_1$ fails to hit $d_2$ with instrument $d_3$ at locus $d_4$.
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 2 (usually restricted).
event contour for a temporary halt and ensuing pause in a process.
pro-sumti: a near future utterance.
$x_1$ is denim of material $x_2$.
detri modal, 1st place (for letters) dated ... ; attaches date stamp.
binary mathematical operator: logarithm; [log/ln a to base b]; default base 10 or e.
pro-sumti: a recent utterance.
$g_1$ is a pod/legume fruit with bean/pea/leguminous seed $d_1$, from plant [legume] $d_2$.
$d_1$ is a peanut/earthnut/ground nut/goober pea/monkey nut/pygmy nut/pig nut from plant [legume] $d_2$ (genus Arachis; default A. hypogaea).
valsi.notes: Despite its name and appearance, the peanut is not a nut, but rather a legume.

valsi.definition: $d_1$ is a locust bean from plant [legume] $d_2$ (Ceratonia siliqua).
valsi.notes: Locust beans, are used as animal feed, and are the source of locust bean gum (={vikrceratonia}).

valsi.definition: $d_1$ is a chickpea/garbanzo bean/ceci bean/sanagalu/chana/hummus/Bengal gram from plant [legume] $d_2$ (Cicer arietinum).
$d_1$ is a broad/fava/faba/field/bell/tic bean from plant [legume] $d_2$ (Vicia fabia).
valsi.notes: x2 = Vicia fabia. This plant is sometimes separated in a monotypic genus Faba.

valsi.definition: $d_1$ is a pigeon pea/Gandule bean/tropical green pea/kadios/Congo pea/gungo pea/fio-fio/mgbụmgbụ/no-eye pea from plant [legume] $d_2$ (genus Cajanus).
$d_1$ is a hyacinth/Egyptian bean from plant [legume] $d_2$ (Lablab purpureus).
$d_1$ is a lentil from plant [legume] of species Lens culinaris of type $d_2$.
valsi.notes: x2 could be LePuy green lentil (="la lypuin"), masoor lentil(="la masor"), green (="lo crino"), red (="lo xunre"), etc.

valsi.definition: $d_1$ is a lupin/lupini bean from plant [legume] $d_2$ (genus Lupinus).
$d_1$ is a lima/butter bean from plant [legume] $d_2$ (Phaseolus lunatus).
valsi.notes: The Moche Culture (1-800 AD) cultivated all of the lima beans and often depicted them in their art.

valsi.definition: $d_1$ is a nuña bean from from plant [legume] $d_2$ (Phaseolus vulgaris subsp. nunas).
$s_1$ is a yam bean/jícama/goiteño/ahipa bean (genus Pachyrhizus) of species/variety $s_2$.
valsi.notes: Pachyrizus erosus produces seeds that are comparable to lima beans (={debrmoce}).

valsi.definition: $d_1$ is a pea from plant [legume] of species Pisum sativum of variation/variety/cultivar $d_2$.
valsi.notes: Yellow/Green split pea (="pelxu/crino je xadba debrpisu"). x2 could be snow pea (="la'o ly saccharatum ly"), snap pea (="la'o ly macrocarpon ly"). See also {rutrpisu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a jicama of species/variety $x_2$.
$s_1=d_2$ is a legume/plant in the family Fabaceae (or Leguminosae) with bean(s)/pea(s)/leguminous seed(s) $d_1$, of species/strain/cultivar $s_2$.
$x_1$ is December in year $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$
$x_{1}$ is a tenth [1/10; $1*10^{-1}$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
valsi.notes: (cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

valsi.definition: $du_1$ tithes $de_2$ to $du_3$
$j_1$ is a ring on finger $j_2=d_1$.
$j_1=d_3$ points at / points to / shows the direction of $j_2$ (object/jevent) to audience $j_3$ with finger $d_1$
$x_{1}$ is a/the finger/digit/toe [body-part] on limb/body site $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$; [metaphor: peninsula].
$n_1$ (agent) finger knits $n_2$ [cloth/object] from yarn/thread $n_3$ with toes/fingers $d_1$.
$g_1=c_1=d_2$ is a mitten of material $g_2$.
$c_1$ is a knuckle on limb $d_2$ of body $c_3=d_3$.
$l_1=d_3$ plucks $l_2$ at locus $l_3$.
$g_1$ is a thimble.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ inch/inches (length unit).
$p_1$ is a fingerprint on surface $p_2$ made by finger/toe $p_3=d_1$
pro-sumti: this utterance.
pro-sumti: this word
pro-sumti: the previous word
$x_{1}$ owes $x_{2}$ in debt/obligation to creditor $x_{3}$ in return for $x_{4}$ [service, loan]; $x_{1}$ is a debtor.
$n_1$ is an invoice/bill to debtor $d_1=n_4$ for amount owed $d_2$ to creditor $d_3=n_3$ for goods/services $d_4$.
$s_1=d_1$ wagers $d_2$ to creditor $d_3$ on $s_2$ (du'u).
$z_3$ is the interest on debt $z_1=d_2$ of debtor $d_1$ to creditor $d_3$.
$x_1=m_1=n_1$ is $x_2=m_2=n_2$ ångström(s) (Å) [length unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction $x_3=m_3=n_3$ by standard $x_4=m_3$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ (default 1) local volume unit(s) [non-metric; e.g. bushel], standard $x_{3}$, $x_{4}$ subunits.
valsi.notes: Gallon (= {likydekpu}), quart (= {likseldekpu}), barrel (wet = likybradekpu, dry = sudbradekpu), bushel (= {sudydekpu}), peck (= {sudyseldekpu}), cupful (= {kabrydekpu}), tablespoon (= {mucydekpu}); teaspoon (= {mucyxeldekpu}); (all of these lujvo may need gic- to distinguish the English measurement system in contrasting with some local system; the English system is otherwise presumed to be the default non-metric system). (additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {canlu}, {litce}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is ten [10; $1*10^1$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$d_1=k_1=g_1$ is $d_2=k_2=g_2$ (default 1) myriagram(s) (default 1) in mass by standard $g_3$.

$d_1=k^2_1=p_1=k^1_1=m_1$ is $d_2=k^2_2=k^1_2=m_2$ (default 1) myriads [tens of thousands of square kilometres] (area unit) measured in perpendicular directions (set)/defined by set of points (set) $p_2=m_3$ by standard $m_4$.
valsi.notes: The term has a particular use in connection with the British Ordnance Survey national grid and the US Military grid reference system.

valsi.definition: $x_1=t_1$ is the exponential result of base 10000 (myriad) multiplied by $x_2=d_2=k_2$ of -yllion(s) (default 1), to power/exponent $x_3=t_2$ (default 2).
valsi.notes: -yllion is a proposal from Donald Knuth for the terminology and symbols of an alternate decimal superbase system. Myllion(s)(x3=2), byllion (x3=4), tryllion (x3=8), quadryllion (x3=16) and so on. See also: myriad (={suzdekyki'o}).

valsi.definition: $d_1=k_1=m_1$ is $d_2=k_2=m_2$ (default 1) myriametre(s)/Scandinavian miles/tens of thousands of metre(s) [non-standard unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction $m_3$ by standard $m_4$.
valsi.notes: See also: mile (in sense: long local distance unit (={minli}).

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a dolphin of species/breed $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ candela [metric unit] in luminosity (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a bean/pea/leguminous seed from plant [legume] $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a garbanzo/chickpea of species/variety $x_2$.
$c_1=d_1$ pours to $c_2$ from $c_3$. $c_1=d_1$ is torrential rainfall.
$r_1$ (event/state) compacts/compresses/concentrates/packs/condenses $x_2=d_1$ in property $x_3=d_2$ (ka) at location/locus $x_4=d_3$.
$x1=d1=s1$ is velvet/[dense silk] produced by $x2=s2$
$d_1=s_1$ is a bush of species/strain/cultivar $s_2$.
$z_1$ crouches/cowers/squats on surface $z_2$.
$b_1$ is a toothbrush with bristles $b_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the tooth [body-part] of $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is dental.
$c_1=d_2$ has a toothache in tooth $d_1=c_2$.
$g_1$ (agent) brushes/cleans the teeth of $d_2$.
$x_{1}$ is dense/concentrated/packed/intense in property $x_{2}$ (ka) at location/locus $x_{3}$.
$m_1$ is a dentist treating patient $m_2$ with dentistry $m_4$.
$x_{1}$ awaits/waits/pauses for/until $x_{2}$ at state $x_{3}$ before starting/continuing $x_{4}$ (activity/process).
valsi.notes: ($x_2$ is an event, usually a point event); also: resuming $x_4$. See also {dicra}, {fanmo}, {sisti}, {fliba}, {pandi}.

valsi.definition: letteral: Lojban "." character.
$p_1$ is a quantity of tooth-paste, of composition $p_2$.
$x_1$ is the gum/cementum of animal $x_2$.
$m_1$ is a periodontist treating patient(s) $m_2$ for ailment $m_3$ involving cure $m_4$.
$s_1=d_2$ is a zip fastener for sealing $s_2$ by mechanism $d_1$.
$c_1$ feels patience about $c_3$.
$k_1$ is a waiting room/break room in structure $x_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $x_3$ (mass/jo'u).
$x_1$ causes $x_2$ to wait for $x_3$ at $x_4$ before continuing $x_5$.
$s_1$ is a hesitation sound produced by $s_2=d_1$ while for/until $d_2$ at state $d_3$ before starting/continuing $d_4$ (activity/process).
$s_1$ is a waiting room/place where $d_1$ waits for $d_2$.
$x_1$ is the Lojban dot character
$j_1=d_1$ is patient, unyielding to force $j_2=d_2$ under condition $j_3=d_3$.
$p_1$ is a waiting queue ordered by rules $p_2$ on unordered set $p_3$ waiting for $x_4=d_2$.
$b_1$ initially grows $b_2$ beyond the soil; $b_1$ sprouts $b_2$ from the ground.
$x_1$ is a peanut of variety $x_2$.
$j_1$ sprouts from $x_2=d_1$.
$x_1$ is geosmin.
$d_1=p_1$ is a quantity of mud of composition $d_3=p_2$, made from dirt from source $d_2$
valsi.notes: Water soaked soil, soft wet earth. See also {dertu}, {pesxu}

valsi.definition: $s_1$ buries/sinks/embeds $s_2$ in ground $s_3=d_1$.
$s_1$=$d_1$ is soil science [science about earth/soil] based on methodology $s_3$.
valsi.notes: dertu2, dertu3 and saske2 subsumed. Soil science studies the soil that occupies the pedosphere, one of Earth's spheres. This is not the same as geology (the lujvo for this should mean planetary+composition+science). The two main branches of soil science are pedology (={terderske}; the study of soil in its natural setting) and edaphology (the study of soil in relation to soil-dependent uses). See also {tedske}, {rokske} and {kunske}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of dirt/soil/earth/ground from source $x_{2}$ of composition $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is earthen; $x_3$: composition including $x_3$, which need not be exhaustive of composition. See also {kliti}, {terdi}, {loldi}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a heap/pile/stack/mound/hill of materials $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ shakes/quakes/trembles/quivers/shudders/wobbles/vibrates from force $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also (expressible either with desku or slilu): side to side, to and fro, back and forth, reciprocal motion. See also {slilu}, {janbe}.

valsi.definition: $m_1$ is a vibrator/vibrating device for use/function $m_2$.
valsi.notes: not necessarily sex toy; could for example also be a "Jumping Jack" compactor; Cf. {runpinji}, {gletci}. See {xremi'i} for shaking machines with the purpose of mixing.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ (person/agent) shakes $x_2=d_1$.
$z_1$ shakes.
$x_1$ is a calendar showing dates $x_2$ and events $x_3$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ is normally a time interval; see {detci'e}

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a calendar with rules $x_2$, days/weeks/months/years $x_3$, and properties $x_4$.
valsi.notes: e.g. Gregorian calendar, Hebrew calendar; see {detcartu}

valsi.definition: $x_1$ allows copying/has copyright of $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$ dated $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ is the date [day,{week},{month},year] of event/state $x_{2}$, at location $x_{3}$, by the Gregorian calendar.
$x_{1}$ is the date [day,{week},{month},year] of event/state $x_{2}$, at location $x_{3}$, by calendar $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: (time units in $x_1$ are specified as numbers separated by pi'e or are unit values massified with joi); See also cmavo list {de'i}, {djedi}, {jeftu}, {masti}, {nanca}, {tcika}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ schedules time $t_1$[hours, {minutes}, {seconds}] and date $d_1$[day,{week},{month},year] for event $t_2=d_2$ at location $d_3$.
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 3 (usually restricted).
event contour for resumption of a paused process.
vocative: well-wish - curse
valsi.notes: Used to express well-wishes/curses. See also {dimna}, {dapma}, {ki'e}, {doi}

valsi.definition: pro-sumti: the next utterance.
tense interval modifier: regularly; subjective tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
tense interval modifier: irregularly/aperiodically; tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
diklo modal, 1st place in the location of ...
pro-sumti: the last utterance.
$z_1$ is/are the foundation(s) of building/edifice/structure $d_1$ of/for type/purpose $d_2$, made of/with materials/properties $z_3$.
$t_1=d_1$ is dearest/most precious to $d_2$ among set/range $x_3=t_4$.
$f_1=d_1$ is an electrical current / flow in / on / through $f_2 = d_2$ flowing in direction to / towards $f_3$ from direction/source $f_4$.

$c_1$ is a transistor / electrical regulator which allows electric current $c_2 = df_1$ to flow under conditions $c_3$ in / on / through $df_2$ flowing in direction to / towards $df_3$ from direction/source $df_4$.
$x_{1}$ is an electron.
$x_{1}$ (event) interrupts/stops/halts/[disrupts] $x_{2}$ (object/event/process) due to quality $x_{3}$.
$g_3=d_2$ is an electric lamp illuminating $g_2$ with light $g_1$.
$d_1=c_1$ is electrically uncharged.
$s_2$ is a loudspeaker emitting sound $s_1$.
$s_1$ is a battery in containment $s_3$.
$x_1$ deduces/reasons by deduction/establishes by deduction that $x_2$ is true about $x_3$ from general rule $x_4$

$ca_1$ is a drip coffeemaker [default: electric] for producing coffee $ca_2=cu_2=ck_1=d_1=f_1$ by dripping coffee to pot $f_2$ from mechanism $f_3$ in gravity well/frame of reference $f_4$, controlled/[triggered] by $ca_3$ (agent).
$k_1$ is a dropstone/stalagmite/stalactite/icicle/rusticle of material $k_2=s_2=d_2$.
$b_1$ is outdoors.
$d_1$ is a basilica [building;architectural shape] for purpose $d_2$.
valsi.notes: See also basilica [special kind of church] (={masrbasilika}).

valsi.definition: $p_1$ is a plaza managed by community/polity/company $p_2$ for purpose $p_3$.
$s_1$ is a story/level/floor of building $x_2=s_3=d_1$.
$s_2$ is architecture.
$x_{1}$ is electricity [electric charge or current] in/on $x_{2}$ of polarity/quantity $x_{3}$ (def. negative).
valsi.notes: ($x_3$, a quantifier, can be expressed as a simple polarity using the numerals for positive and negative ma'u and ni'u); (explicitly) negative (= {dutydikca}), positive (= {mardikca}); current (= (sel)muvdikca; again default negative/electron current), charge (= {klodikca}, {stadikca}). See also {lindi}, {xampo}, {flecu}, {maksi}, {tcana}.

valsi.definition: $c_1$ consumes $c_2$ as part of their staple diet.
$p_1$ regularly pays salary $p_2$ to $p_3$ for goods/services $p_4$.
$x_{1}$ is local to $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is confined to locus $x_{2}$ within range $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is regional
valsi.notes: Indicates a specific location/value within a range; e.g. a hits b. What is the locality on b that a hits? Thus $x_1$ is associated with a specific narrow region/interval $x_2$ of wider space/range $x_3$. See also cmavo list {di'o}, {jibni}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {nenri}, {lamji}, {stuzi}, {tcila}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is regular/cyclical/periodic in property (ka)/activity $x_{2}$ with period/interval $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quotient of '$x_{2}$/$x_{3}$' [dividend $x_{2}$ divided by divisor $x_{3}$], leaving remainder $x_{4}$.
Dilli.
$x_{1}$ is a cloud/mass of clouds of material $x_{2}$ in air mass $x_{3}$ at floor/base elevation $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is a fate/destiny of $x_{2}$; [doom, curse are mabla-forms]; $x_{2}$ is fated/predestined/doomed to $x_{1}$.
$c_1$ is a monetary affair involving $c_2$
$jb_1$ borrows money $jb_2=jd_1$ from $jb_3$ for interval $jb_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a building/edifice for purpose $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a nail/tack [pointed driven/frictional fastener] of type/size $x_{2}$ (ka), made of material $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: ($x_2$ also can be ni abstraction); See also {pijne}, {lasna}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a rivet of type $x_2$ made of $x_3$
$x_1$ is a dinosaur of type $x_2$ living in era $x_3$.
$g_1$ is a/the industry sector in which $s_1$ provides financial services $g_2=s_3$ to $s_2$ by process $g_3$
$s_1$ is a treasury of money $d_1=s_2$.
$c_1$ is a/the financial management function/activities involving persons $c_2=ji_1$, of money/currency issued by $jd_2$; $c_1$ is finance.
$c_1$ is an/the accounting function/activities involving persons $c_2$, using currency issued by $j_2$, recording $v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $v_3$ (object/event); $c_1$ is accounting.
$x_{1}$ is dear/precious/darling to $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is emotionally valued by $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: $x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydirba} for unambiguous semantics). See also {tcika}, {kargu}, {vamji}, {vajni}, {pleji}, {jadni}, {jemna}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ radiates/emits $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is radium.
$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of radon (Rn).
$x_{1}$ is a drop [small, cohesive shape] of material [liquid/vapor] $x_{2}$ in surrounding material $x_{3}$.
$t_1$ is an interrupt causing $d_1$ to happen, interrupting $d_2$ due to quality $d_3$, hooked onto conditions $t_3$.
$v_1$ chokes on/because of $d_3$.
$x_1$ takes a short time/has a short duration by standard $x_2$
$x_1$ is the time-duration/interval/period/[elapsed time] of event $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ = $k_{1}$ is able/can do $x_{2}$ = $k_{2}$ = $d_{2}$ (state/event) under conditions $x_{3}$ = $k_{3}$ (state/event) in time $x_{4}$ = $d_{1}$.
valsi.notes: x4 defaults to the natural duration of the event x2 ({ca'o}) so that it also means "x1 has enough time to do x2". See {ditcu}, {kakne}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ takes a long time/has a long duration by standard $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is low/down/downward in frame of reference $x_{2}$ as compared with baseline/standard height $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also lower; $x_3$ is generally some defined distance above a zero point/baseline, or is that baseline itself. See also {cnita}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {farna}, {loldi}.

valsi.definition: $d_1$ is jazz music performed at/by $z_2$ (event) with characteristics $z_3$.
Algeria.
$b_1$ is a waiter, carrying food $c_1=b_2$ to $b_3$ from $b_4$ over path $b_5$.
$p_1=b_1$ is a waitress/waiter serving food $b_2=c_1$ to $x_3=c_2=b_3$.
$m_1=c_2$ starves to death from lack of food/nutrition $c_1$
$cip_1=cid_1$ is an edible bird of species $cip_2$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity/expanse of water; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is aqueous/[aquatic].
$g_1=c_1$ is grain from plant/species $g_2$, edible/giving nutrition to $x_3=c_2$.
Jakarta
$x_1$ is a quantity of spaghetti (long, thin cylindrical pasta).

valsi.notes: Allium cepa is the common onion. x2 could be (lo ka) red (xunre)/yellow (pelxu)/white (blabi)/young (citno)/small (cmalu).

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is a morsel/piece of food $s_1=c_1$ for $x_3=c_2$.
$c_1=k_1$ is a (Italian) stone pine/umbrella pine/parasol pine (Pinus Pinea) of strain $c_2$ with cones $c_3$.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ joule(s) of energy (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ full days in duration (default is 1 day) by standard $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is diurnal.
Jacob
Jane
$k_1$ is a daily newspaper with content $k_2$ published by $k_3$ for audience $k_4$.
$x_1$ is a quoll of species $x_2$
$x_{1}$ desires/wants/wishes $x_{2}$ (event/state) for purpose $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: If desire is for an object, this is sumti-raising; use tu'a in $x_2$ (or use lujvo = {po'edji}). See also {taske}, {xagji}, {mukti}, {nitcu}, {nelci}, {pacna}, {prami}, {rigni}, {trina}, {xebni}, {xlura}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=d_1=c_1$ intensely desires/craves/[needs] $x_2=d_2$ for purpose $x_3=d_3$ as seen/observed/measured by $x_4=c_3$.
valsi.notes: Composed of {djica}, {carmi}. Purely jvajvo, as opposed to (an old definition of) {caidji}, which is not. The use of {carmi} instead of {mutce} makes the intensity subjective, rather than objective.

valsi.definition: $c_1=d_1$ is/feels eager for $d_2 =c_3$ (event/state) for purpose $d_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a ring/annulus/torus/circle [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, inside diam. $x_{3}$, outside diam. $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also ellipse, oval (= {jincla}); (usage has been for near-circles, such as tight spirals, even if not closed loops). Also band, belt, encircle (= {jinsru}). See also {clupa}, {cukla}, {dasri}, {karli}, {sovda}, {sruri}, {konju}.

valsi.definition: Jyoti.
$x_1$ happens as often as $x_2$ desires/wants/wishes in interval $x_3$
$x_1$ expresses/says that they desire $x_2$ (nu/ka) to audience $x_3$ in medium $x_4$, desired for purpose $x_5$
valsi.notes: Note that in the past djisku was used for what {skudji} is more commonly used to mean nowadays. The latter is a more regular lujvo and has mostly supplanted the old djisku in usage.

valsi.definition: $m_1=b_1$ is the Saudi Arabic language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$x_1$ is a quantity of yogurt made from $x_2$ milk by process $x_3$.
George
$x_1=g_1=s_1$ is happy/merry/gay about helping/assisting/aiding object/person $x_2=s_2$ to do/achieve/maintain event/activity $x_3=s_3$
China.
$x_{1}$ knows fact(s) $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$ by epistemology $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place; know how to - implying knowledge of method but not necessarily having the ability to practice (= {tadjyju'o}). (cf. know/familiar with: se slabu, na'e cnino, na'e fange). See also cmavo list {du'o}, {krici}, {jinvi}, {cilre}, {certu}, {facki}, {jijnu}, {jimpe}, {senpi}, {smadi}, {kakne}, {birti}, {mipri}, {morji}, {saske}, {viska}.

valsi.definition: $n_1$ is an instruction/advice from $x_2=n_3$ to help/assist/aid $x_3=s_2=n_4$ do/achieve/maintain event/activity $x_4=s_3$.
$c_1=s_1$ gives advice $c_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) to $c_3=s_2$ about doing/achieving/maintaining $s_3$, on medium $c_4$.
pro-sumti: you listener(s); identified by vocative.
discursive: generously - parsimoniously.
discursive: generously - parsimoniously.
elliptical/unspecified modal.
pro-sumti: elliptical/unspecified utterance variable.
pro-sumti: you the listener & others unspecified.
elidable terminator: end vocative (often elidable).
generic vocative marker; identifies intended listener; elidable after COI.
generic vocative address to intended listener;.
$c_1$ is a second person pronoun in language $c_4$.
$x_{1}$ is the daytime of day $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is diurnal (vs. nocturnal).
$x_1$ is a gazelle of species $x_2$.
$m_1$ is the noon (midday) of day $d_2$ at location $d_3$.
$b_1$ is later than noon of day $d_2$ at location $d_3$.
$s_1$ (mass) is a lunch composed of dishes including $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ reflects German/Germanic culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$s_1$ is a Grüne Soße/german green sauce for use with $s_2$, containing ingredient(s) including $s_3$.
valsi.notes: Green Sauce is a specialty of the German state of Hesse.

valsi.definition: $d_1=b_1$ is the German used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$g_1$ is Germany.
$x_{1}$ is a drama/play about $x_{2}$ [plot/theme/subject] by dramatist $x_{3}$ for audience $x_{4}$ with actors $x_{5}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ may also be a convention. See also {finti}, {cukta}, {lisri}, {cfika}.

valsi.definition: $di_1$ is a theater for performing plays with theme $di_2=dr_2$ for audience $x_3=dr_4$ with actors $x_4=dr_5$.
$x1=k1=d5$ plays $x2=k2$ in play $x3=d1$
$x_1=d_1=k_1$ is a role-player / player of role playing game / RPG / LARP or dramatic / acting game $x_2=d_5=k_2$ about $x_3=d_2$ created by author/ company $x_4=d_3$ for audience $x_5=d_4$.
valsi.notes: Audience defaults to the players themselves. See also {draci}, {kelci}, {dracyselkei}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=d_1=sk_1$ is a role-playing game/ RPG/ LARP or dramatic/ acting game played by performer(s)/ player(s) $x_2=d_5=sk_2$ about $x_3=d_2$ created by author/ company $x_4=d_3$ for audience $x_5=d_4$ .
valsi.notes: Audience defaults to the players themselves. See also {draci}, {kelci}, {dracykei}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ (event) corrects $g_2$ into $g_3=d_1$, correct in property/aspect $x_4=d_2$ (ka) in situation $x_5=d_3$ by standard $x_6=d_4$.
$g_1$ (person/agent) corrects $d_1$.
$x_1$ is a dragon of species $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is correct/proper/right/perfect in property/aspect $x_{2}$ (ka) in situation $x_{3}$ by standard $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ isn't the-same-thing-as/is different-from/other-than $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is something else.
Dresden.
$x_1=d_1=c_1$ is extremely/intensely sad/depressed about $x_2=d_2$ as measured/seen/observed by $x_2=c_3$.
valsi.notes: Composed of {badri}, {carmi}. The advantage of using "carmi" instead of {mutce} here is that {carmi} is subjectively determined by the carmi3, whereas {mutce} implies some kind of real, objective standards for measurements. {dritce} (based on {mutce}) is more appropriate for objectively determined states of depression.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ comforts $j_1=b_1$ about $b_2$
$x_1$ is an albatross [member of the family Diomedeidae] of species/breed $x_2$
$x_1$ is an emu/Dromaius of species/subspecies $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is a roof/top/ceiling/lid of $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: (cf. bitmu, stedu, galtu, gapru, loldi, marbi, gacri, mapku; a drudi is (designed to be) over/above something and shelters it from other things above the drudi, mapku)

valsi.definition: identity selbri; = sign; $x_{1}$ identically equals $x_{2}$, $x_{3}$, etc.; attached sumti refer to same thing.
location tense relation/direction; east of.
Text to bridi conversion
valsi.notes: Roughly equivalent to just la'e, but precise about the type of the result. Inverse of {lu'au}.

valsi.definition: digit/number: too many; subjective.
quantifier selbri: convert too many to cardinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is a set with too many members $x_{2}$.
tense interval modifier: too many times objective tense, defaults as time tense.
dunli modal, 1st place (equalled by) equally; as much as ...
djuno modal, 1st place (info source) authoritatively; according to ...; known by ...
abstractor: predication/bridi abstractor; $x_{1}$ is predication [bridi] expressed in sentence $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is greater than or equal to $x_2$.
$x_1$ is less than or equal to $x_2$
$x_1$ recognizes/knows identity of $x_2$ by epistemology $x_3$
$x_{1}$ is the logarithm of $x_{2}$ with base $x_{3}$.
$m_1$ is a freezer/freezing machine for freezing $x_2=d_1$ at temperature $x_3$.
$k_1$ is a cooling room for cooling $x_2=d_1$ at temperature $x_3=d_2$.
$r_1$ (event/state) anguishes/causes distress to $x_2=d_1$.
$x_{1}$ is an excess of/too much of $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is polar opposite from/contrary to $x_{2}$ in property/on scale $x_{3}$ (property/si'o).
$j_1$ is a quantity of crème caramel/caramel custard [jelly] of material/composition including x2.
Danube.
$x_{1}$ [donor] gives/donates gift/present $x_{2}$ to recipient/beneficiary $x_{3}$ [without payment/exchange].
valsi.notes: Also grants; $x_3$ is a receiver (= {terdu'a} for reordered places); the Lojban doesn't distinguish between or imply possession transfer or sharing; $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydu'a}, {posyseldu'a} for unambiguous semantics). See also {benji}, {muvdu}, {canja}, {pleji}, {vecnu}, {friti}, {sfasa}, {dapma}, {cnemu}, {prali}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ freezes/jells/solidifies at temperature $x_{2}$ and pressure $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is anguished/distressed/emotionally wrought/stressed by $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is an equivalence class within $x_2$ defined by equivalence relation $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is equal/congruent to/as much as $x_{2}$ in property/dimension/quantity $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Same in quantity/quality (not necessarily in identity); 'analogy' may be expressed as the equivalence of two properties of similarity (ka $x_1$ simsa $x_2$) and (ka $x_3$ simsa $x_4$). See also cmavo list {du'i}, {satci}, {frica}, {simsa}, {mintu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is winter/wintertime [cold season] of year $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.

unconditional end of text; outside regular grammar; used for computer input.

non-logical connective: respectively; unmixed ordered distributed association.

Fido.

$c_1$ is/are a/the function/activities involving persons $c_2 $ distributing $f_1$ among/to $f_2$; $c_1$ is distribution
valsi.notes: C.f. {fatri}, {cuntu}, {selvensro}, {terzbasro}, {vencu'u}, {zbacu'u}, {dintrocu'u}, {dinveicu'u}. In a company, this may be referred to as logistics or channel management.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ = $g_1$ [person/agent] distributes/allots/allocates/shares $x_2$ =$f_1$ among $x_3$ = $f_2$ with shares/portions $x_4$ =$f_3$.
$s_1$ is a socialist ideology as applied by $t_1$ in/among people/territory/domain $t_2=f_2$ based on the works of thinker $s_3$

$x_1=l_1=f_1$ explores fact $x_3=f_2$ about $x_2=l_2=f_3$ using instrument $x_4=l_3$
$b_1$ is a parachute of type/material $b_2$.
$c_1$ (agent) lets $f_1$ fall to $f_2$ from $f_3$ in gravity well/frame of reference $f_4$; under conditions $c_3$.
$g_1$ makes $f_1$ fall.
$x_1$ is a falcon (genus 'falco').

$x_{1}$ is a sail for gathering propelling material $x_{2}$ on vehicle/motor $x_{3}$.
$f_1=p_1$ is a meteor which falls to planet $p_2$ from area/planet $f_3$ with composition $p_3$
$r_1$ (event/state) is the cause of that $f_1$ falls/drops to $f_2$ from $f_3$ in gravity well/frame of reference $f_4$; under conditions $r_3$.
$x_1$ is the factorial of $x_2$.
$c_1$ (agent) concludes by expressing/saying $c_2=f_1$ for/to audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$ concluding $f_2$.
$x_{1}$ is an aunt/uncle of $x_{2}$ by bond/tie $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is an associated member of $x_{2}$'s parent's generation.
$c_1$ is a terminator of class/part-of-speech $c_2$ in language $c_3$.
$b_1$ is canvas of material $b_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a function/single-valued mapping from domain $x_{2}$ to range $x_{3}$ defined by expression/rule $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is alien/foreign/[exotic]/unfamiliar to $x_{2}$ in property $x_{3}$ (ka).
$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of xenon (Xe).
$t_1$=$d_1$=$f_1$ is a windsurfingboard of material/property $t_2$.

valsi.definition: $k_1$ sails to destination $k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$ on sailing vehicle $k_5=f_3$.
$x_{1}$ is an end/finish/termination of thing/process $x_{2}$; [not necessarily implying completeness].
valsi.notes: $x_1$ is final/last/at the last; $x_1$ is a terminal/terminus of $x_2$; $x_1$ is the final/terminated state of terminated process $x_2$; $x_2$ terminates/ceases/stops/halts at $x_1$ (= selfa'o for reordered places). See also {krasi}, {cfari}, {mulno}, {sisti}, {denpa}, {jipno}, {kojna}, {traji}, {krasi}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a factory/foundry/industrial plant/mill producing $x_{2}$ from materials $x_{3}$.
$g_1$ is a/the manufacturing industry/sector, manufacturing/processing $g_2=f_2$ at factories/plants $f_1$ from materials $f_3$ using process $g_3$
$p_1$ is an industrial park managed by community/polity/company $p_2$ for factories/plants producing $f_2$.
$x_{1}$ prevents/keeps/stops/restrains/constrains event $x_{2}$ from occurring.
$x_{1}$ translates text/utterance $x_{2}$ to language $x_{3}$ from language $x_{4}$ with translation result $x_{5}$.
$c_1$ is a translation of version that $c_2=f_2$(original/sourcetext) is translated by $c_3=f_1$(translator) from $f_3$(original language) into $f_4$(translation language)
$x_{1}$ (event) annoys/irritates/bothers/distracts $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also: is disruptive to. See also {fengu}, {raktu}, {dicra}, {tunta}, {zunti}, {jicla}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ opposes/balances/contends against opponent(s) $x_{2}$ (person/force ind./mass) about $x_{3}$ (abstract).
$c_1$ gets lost on the way to $f_2$ (object/event) in/near $f_3=c_3$
$x_1$=$d_1$ is the opposite direction from $x_3$=$f_3$ that $x_2$=$f_2$ is.
$g_1=f_3$ aims at $f_1$ with $f_2$ (object/event).
valsi.notes: $x_3$ can be $x_1$ itself or an extra object/event such as "weapon", "effort", etc. Cf. {farna}.

valsi.definition: $j_1$ shows the direction of $f_2$ (object/event) to audience $j_3$, that direction being $f_1$
valsi.notes: $f_3$ defaults to the $x_1$, in other words the direction (i.e. $x_4$) is relative to the $x_1$ place. Cf. {farsni}, {degja'o}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ falls/drops to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ in gravity well/frame of reference $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Note: things can fall in spin, thrust, or tide as well as gravity; (agentive "drop" = one of two lujvo: {falcru} and {falri'a}). See also {lafti}, {cpare}, {klama}, {sfubu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is the direction of $x_{2}$ (object/event) from origin/in frame of reference $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ is towards $x_1$ from $x_3$ (= {selfa'a} for reordered places). See also {zunle}, {pritu}, {galtu}, {gapru}, {cnita}, {dizlo}, {berti}, {snanu}, {stuna}, {stici}, {purci}, {balvi}, {lidne}.

valsi.definition: $s_1=f_3$ non-agentively/inanimately points at/indicates the direction of $s_2=f_2$ to observer $s_3$ as being in the direction $f_1$.
valsi.notes: $f_3$ defaults to the $x_1$, in other words the direction (i.e. $x_4$) is relative to the $x_1$ place. Cf. {farja'o}, {degja'o}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ develops/evolves towards/into $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$ through stages $x_{4}$.
$s_1=f_1$ reflects Breton culture/language in aspect $s_2=f_2$.
$x_{1}$ (event) is an event that happens/occurs/takes place; $x_{1}$ is an incident/happening/occurrence.
valsi.notes: (cf. cmavo list fau, krefu, lifri, fatci, rapli; gasnu, zukte, if specifically agentive, banli)

valsi.definition: $v_1$ is a verb meaning $v_2$ in language $v_3$.

$g_1=f_1$ is the country of France.

$x_{1}$ (du'u) is a fact/reality/truth/actuality, in the absolute.
$f_1 = k_1$ [sequence] is able to be / capable of being reversed from / into sequence $f_2$ by event $k_2$ under conditions $k_3$ (event / state).
$x_{1}$ [sequence] is in reverse order from $x_{2}$ [sequence]; $x_{1}$ (object) is inverted from $x_{2}$ (object).
valsi.notes: Also opposite (one sense). See also cmavo list {fa'e}, {dukti}.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ implodes into pieces/energy/fragments $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ is distributed/allotted/allocated/shared among $x_{2}$ with shares/portions $x_{3}$; ($x_{2}$/$x_{3}$ fa'u).
valsi.notes: Also spread, shared out, apportioned; agentive distribution (= {fairgau}, {fairzu'e}). See also cmavo list {fa'u}, {fendi}, {preja}, {katna}, {tcana}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ (me'o) is the p-adic representation of number $x_2$ in base $x_3$.
valsi.notes: can be infinitely long to the left but not the right; for repeating p-adics ({krefu} fatysaclu) use {ra'e} before {pi}

valsi.definition: fasnu modal, 1st place (non-causal) in the event of ...
$f_1$ is an event that has time/temporal duration $t_1$ ranging from starting time/event $t_2$ to ending time/event $t_3$.
$g_1$ develops $f_1$ into $f_2$ from $f_3$ through stages $f_4$.
$f_1=m_1$ is homologous to $f_1=m_2$ in property/aspect $m_3$
$t_1$ is a developmental / evolutionary stage / state of $t_2 = f_1$ in its development towards / into $f_2$ from $f_3$ through stages $f_4$.
valsi.notes: First place is intended for things like software version numbers. See also {favytcinymupli} (which is how you talk about actual things that have a version associated with them). Made from {farvi} + {tcini}.

valsi.definition: $m_1$ is an example/instance of developmental/evolutionary stage/state $m_2=t_1$ of developing thing $t_2=f_1$ in its development towards/into $f_2$ from $f_3$ through stages $f_4=m_3$.
valsi.notes: Someone causing the development is neither implied nor denied; hence this word can be used both for Darwinian evolution and software development. Made from {favytcini} + {mupli}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ [person/agent] annoys, by doing $f_1$ [event], $f_2$ [person].
valsi.notes: The annoyance must not neccessarily be intentional. Cf. {fanza} (for an annoying event), {gasnu}.

valsi.definition: $t_1$ chatters/gossips to $t_2=f_2$ about subject $t_3$ in language $t_4$.
sumti place tag: tag 2nd sumti place.
binary mathematical operator: nth root of; inverse power [a to the 1/b power].
mark space interval distributive aspects; labels interval tense modifiers as location-oriented.

location event contour tense: superfective in space; continuing too far beyond ...

vocative: over and out (end discussion).
elidable terminator: end nonce conversion of selbri to modal; usually elidable.
$c_1=f_1$ growls/snarls/roars c2 [non-linguistic utterence] in anger at $f_2$ for $f_3$ (action/state/property).
$g_1$ (person/agent) boils $x_2=f_1$ at temperature $x_3=f_2$ and pressure $x_4=f_3$.
valsi.notes: Note that this means simply to evaporate a liquid; to cook something by boiling is {febjukpa}. Also c.f. {jukpa}, {djacu}, {ladru}, {cidja}, {patxu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=ju_1$ simmers/cooks/prepares food-for-eating $x_2=j_2$ by sitting it in simmering liquid $x_3=ji_1=f_1$ at temperature $x_4=f_2$ and pressure $x_5=f_3$.
valsi.notes: See also: boil (={febjukpa}), poach (={febmlijukpa}), blanche (={juprblanca}), court bouillon (={likrkorbojo}/{febmliseljukpa}).

valsi.definition: $x_1=j_1$ cooks/prepares food-for-eating $x_2=j_2$ by sitting it in boiling liquid $x_3=f_1$ at temperature $x_4=f_2$ and pressure $x_5=f_3$
$x_1=ju_1$ is poaching/cooks/prepares food-for-eating $x_2=j_2$ by sitting it in poaching liquid/court bouillon $x_3=m_1=f_1$ at temperature $x_4=f_2$ and pressure $x_5=f_3$.
$x_{1}$ boils/evaporates at temperature $x_{2}$ and pressure $x_{3}$.
$b_1=f_1$ roars/snarls/growls angrily atterance $b_2$ at $f_2$ because of $f_3$ (action/state/property).
$m_1=f_1$ is irritated/[mildly angry] at $f_2$ for $f_3$ (action/state/property).
$m_1=f_1=b_1$ grumbles with sound $b_2$ at $f_2$ because of $f_3$ (action/state/property).
valsi.notes: jvajvo definition; Gismu deep structure is "milxe le ka fengu kei gi'e bacru"

valsi.definition: $r_1$ (event) angers $f_1$.
$f_1=c_1$ is without anger/mild/meek regarding $f_2$ for $f_3$ (action/state/property).
digit/number: hex digit B (decimal 11) [eleven].
$x_1$ is November/eleventh month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
valsi.notes: Note: Based on experimental rafsi for {fei} (fel). Use with caution. Alternative: {pavypavma'i}

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is $10^{-15}$ of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_{1}$ (agent) divides/partitions/separates $x_{2}$ into sections/parts/ind. $x_{3}$ by method/partition $x_{4}$.
$m_1$ is a sewing pattern of forms $m_2$ according to structure $m_3$.
$x_1$ FFFFFFFUUUUUUUUUUUU at $x_2$; $x_1$ expresses extreme rage at $x_2$ by beginning to say 'fuck'.
$x_{1}$ is angry/mad at $x_{2}$ for $x_{3}$ (action/state/property).
$x_{1}$ (action/event) is crazy/insane/mad/frantic/in a frenzy (one sense) by standard $x_{2}$.
$z_1$ sits in tailor style position/agura/sukhasana on surface $z_2$.
valsi.notes: Sits with the lower legs folded towards the body, crossing each other at the ankle or calf, with both ankles on the floor, sometimes with the feet tucked under the knees or thighs. The position is known in several European languages as tailor style.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a crack/fissure/pass/cleft/ravine/chasm/[defect/flaw] [shape/form] in $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ sews/stitches/sutures materials $x_{2}$ (ind./set) together with tool(s) $x_{3}$, using filament $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: ($x_2$ if a set must be a complete specification); See also {cilta}, {jivbu}, {jorne}, {nivji}, {pijne}, {lasna}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is measured in kopeck/cent money-subunits as $x_{2}$ [quantity], in monetary system $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also pfennig, paisa, sen, fen, dinar, etc.; $x_1$ is generally a price/cost/value. (additional secondary, tertiary, etc. subunit places may be added as $x_4$, $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {sicni}, {jdini}, {jdima}, {vecnu}, {rupnu}, {dekpu}, {gutci}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a/the lung [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: breathing/respiratory apparatus/bellows].
$fi_1$ is a lungfish/salamanderfish (subclass Dipnoi) of species $fi_2$.
$s_1$ is a cent coin issued by $s_2$ in monetary system $f_3$.
$x_{1}$ is fertile/conducive for supporting the growth/development of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is fruitful/prolific.
valsi.notes: Also fecund (note that the Lojban covers both potential and actual/realized fertility). See also {vanbi}, {sidju}, {rorci}, {farvi}, {banro}, {cange}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is Virgo [constellation/astrological sign].
valsi.notes: From {ferti}. The Greeks and Romans associated Virgo with their goddess of wheat, Demeter-Ceres who is the mother of Proserpina-Persephone. For this reason the constellation became associated with fertility (in both Babylonia, Greece and Rome). Alternatively, she was sometimes identified as the virgin goddess Iustitia or Astraea, holding the scales of justice in her hand as the constellation Libra. Since ferti in lojban covers both potential and actual/realized fertility, the original meaning of the constellation have been chosen, but you could probably still interpret the name in both senses (as a deity of fecundity or as a fertile virgin).

valsi.definition: $x_1=f_2=c_1$ abandons / forsakes / leaves behind $x_2=f_1=c_2$

$x_{1}$ takes a fika [social institution]/coffee break together with $x_{2}$ consuming food/beverage $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: From the swedish word "fika". Both "fika" and "fi'ikca" are also derived from the word for coffee in respectively language (kaffi respectively {ckafi}). fi'ikca describes the event where you socialize with others, perhaps over a cup of coffee. In a swedish context x2 might often be friends or fellow workers, and x3 usually is coffee/squash/(tea) together with a cinnamon roll, cookie, cake, a sandwich etc. But fi'ikca could also be used in a more universal, cultural neutral sense. See also coffeehouse/coffee bar (={kafybarja}), making coffee (={kafpra}).

valsi.notes: $x_2$ is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description (($x_1$ with $x_2$) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu. 'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] See also {valsi}, {cmavo}.

Numbers can be made to lujvo with this to create pseudo-words meaning "to give no fucks" (= "no zei gleua"). Of course, this word can be used positively (= "gleua li so'e") to mean something like "I care a great deal!"

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is a county/district/province (second-level administrative division) of country $s_2=g_1$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {gugde}, {pagbu}, {selci}. A province can also be a first-level administrative division; for this use {gugypau}, or optionally {vipygu'e} if it is in a country with a federal government.

valsi.definition: $g_1=c_1$ is sandy abrasive material.

$x_{1}$ [person] labors/works on/at $x_{2}$ [activity] with goal/objective $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is a worker/laborer. (cf. {sazri}, {gasnu}, {se} {jibri}; {zukte} - which need not be labor; physics term 'work' = {ni} {muvyselbai}, {briju}, {jibri}, {lazni}, {selfu})

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a mass/team/aggregate/whole, together composed of components $x_{2}$, considered jointly.
valsi.notes: A description in $x_1$ indicates of mass property(ies) displayed by the mass; masses may reveal properties not found in the individual set members that are massified, which themselves are not necessarily relevant to the mass property implicit in this bridi. See also {bende}, {girzu}, {pagbu}, cmavo list {loi}, {lei}, {lai}, {ciste}, {cmima}, {kansa}, {tinci}, {mulgunma}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=z_1=r_1=g_1$ procrastinates/avoids doing work $x_2=r_2=g_2$ (ka), instead doing $x_3=r_3$ (ka).
valsi.notes: I figured I'd FINALLY get around to defining this, only for it to be in order to delay doing homework. cf. {zukte}, {rivbi}, {gunka}, {dimna}, {funca}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ rolls/trundles on/against surface $x_{2}$ rotating on axis/axle $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a roller.

(additional subunit places may be added as $x_5$, $x_6$, ...); See also {mitre}, {clani}, {ganra}, {condi}, {rotsu}, {rupnu}, {fepni}, {dekpu}, {minli}, {merli}, {bunda}, {kramu}.

convert tense/modal (tagged) place to 1st place; 1st place moves to extra FA place (fai).
grammatically converts LAhE to SE; semantically the result tags the $x_1$ of the selbri as being LAhE the supplied $x_1$. Can be converted to other than $x_1$ with SE.
valsi.notes: Cf. {jai} in the TAG sense. Note that {jai} in the non-TAG sense is the same as jai'a tu'a. Example usage: lo tadni cu jai'a lu'o sruri lo dinju gi'e krixa <-> loi tadni cu sruri lo dinju gi'e jai'a lu'a krixa <-> loi tadni cu sruri lo dinju .ije lu'a lo go'i cu krixa

valsi.definition: convert time tense (tagged) place to 1st place; 1st place moves to extra place (fai).

makes $x_{1}$ the agent of a bridi; old 1st place moves to extra place (fai).

convert location tense (tagged) place to 1st place; 1st place moves to extra place (fai).

valsi.notes: With French pronunciation /ʒa.kɔb/, where /ɔ/ is changed to its Lojban approximation /o/

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (action/event/state) is a result/outcome/conclusion of antecedent $x_{2}$ (event/state/process).
valsi.notes: Also: $x_2$ gives rise to $x_1$ (= selja'e for reordered places); total (general meaning, but also = mekyja'e, pi'irja'e, sujyja'e). See also se {mukti}, te {zukte}, se {rinka}, se {krinu}, se {nibli}, {mulno}, {sumji}, {pilji}, {mekso}, cmavo list {ja'e}, {ciksi}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of starch from source $x_{2}$ of composition including $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a cockroach/orthopteran/termite of order/species/breed $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also grasshopper (= {pipyjalra}); cricket (= {sagjalra}); locust, termite (= {mantyjalra} or {mudyctijalra}). (Orthoptera includes grasshoppers, crickets, etc; termites are a closely-related non-Orthoptera, more akin to cockroaches than to e.g. ants); See also {cinki}, {civla}, {manti}.

valsi.definition: $cr_1=cl_1=j_2$ is a tube top of material $cr_2$.
valsi.notes: A shoulderless, sleeveless "tube" that wraps the torso, generally very tight over the breasts in order to prevent the garment from falling. "halterneck" ({nebdadycreka}) is its subtype. Suggested shortest fu'ivla form: ancrka. Cf. {creka}.

$x_{1}$ collides with/crashes/bumps/runs into $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: (also collide = {simjanli} for a collision between two moving objects); See also {darxi}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a diplomat/consul representing polity $x_{2}$ in/at negotiation $x_{3}$ for function/purpose $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: (for) $x_3$ polity, (use tu'a); also ambassador (= {raljansu}, {trujansu}). See also {jecta}, {krati}.

valsi.notes: [reveal (= {tolmipygau}, {mipyja'o}, {sivja'o}); also: $x_1$ shows that $x_2$, $x_1$ shows off $x_2$; showing an object is generally expressed with a {tu'a} $x_2$, since the properties of the shown object (other than its presence) intended for observation are seldom specified (simple presence could be expressed by {lo}{ka} Object. {cu} {zvati})]; See also {tigni}, {cipra}, {zgana}, {jvinu}, {lanli}, {mipri}, {simlu}.

digit/number: hex digit D (decimal 13) [thirteen].
$x_1$ is Aquarius [astronomical constellation/astrological sign].
valsi.notes: From {djacu}, {barfle}, {gasnu}. Aquarius is identified as "The Great One" in the Babylonian star catalogues and represents the god Ea himself, who is commonly depicted holding an overflowing vase. In the Greek tradition, the constellation became represented as simply a single vase from which a stream poured down.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is February of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$m_1$ is a hydrocycle carrying $m_2$, propelled by force $m_4$ transmitted via pedal(s) $c_1=v_1$.
$x_1$ is Wednesday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$v_1$ is a pipe carrying $v_2=f_2$ to $f_3$ from $f_4$
valsi.notes: fluid may be liquid or gas; see {datnyfle} for the computer metaphor

valsi.definition: $m_1$ is a steam engine driving $m_2$.

valsi.notes: This is the first defined lujvo using -jax-, the proposed rafsi for {jai}. See also {pluka}.

$x_{1}$ is a berry (fruit/plant) of plant/species $x_{2}$.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (agent) borrows/temporarily takes/assumes $x_{2}$ (object) from source $x_{3}$ for interval $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Credit (= {jernu'e}); borrow/assume a property or quality as a chameleon does (= {zaskai}, {zasysmitra}, {zasysmitai}). See also {dejni}, {janta}, {zivle}.

valsi.notes: $x_2$ (a complete set, generally ordered) defines the bounds/limits/range for $x_1$. See also se {vasru}, {nenri}, {zvati}, {cpana}, {snuji}, {senta}, {bitmu}, {jimte}, {kuspe}, {jibni}, {lamji}, {sruri}, {vanbi}, {midju}, {cmima}, {setca}.

valsi.definition: $p_1$ puts $p_2=j_1$ close to $p_3=j_2$.

$c_1$ is a Lojbanic community.
$f_1=c_3$ translates non-Lojban name $c_1$=$f_2$ (text) from language $f_4$ to (lojbanic) cmevla / lojbanized name $f_5$=$l_1$ (text).
$x1$ is an expert in Lojban language.
$l_1$ is Jbofihe.
valsi.notes: A computer program that parses Lojban text. Cf. {lojbo}, {finpe}, {genturfa'i}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ is Lojban grammar for structure/text $g_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a Lojbanic group/organization with role/purpose/function $x_{2}$.

$x_1$ is a boa of species $x_2$.

$x_1$ is a bonobo of species/breed $x_2$.

$j_1$ is the bishop/archbishop of $j_2$ of religion $l_1$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {lijda}, {jitro}, {catnrpepiskopo}, {jdaja'a}, {jdaca'i}. For 'archbishop' one can use 'lo banli jdatro'.

valsi.definition: $z_1$ is a sin/blasphemy according to religion $z_2=j_1$.
$x_1$ is a warning message to intended audience $x_2$ about danger $x_3$ from author $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ (person) decides/makes decision $x_{2}$ (du'u) about matter $x_{3}$ (event/state).
$jd_1=jm_1$ assemble/meet/gather/[form a caucus] to make decision(s) $jd_2$ (du'u) about matter $jd_3$ (event/state) at location $jm_2$.
$x_{1}$ (experiencer) decreases/contracts/is reduced/diminished in property/quantity $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.
$g_1$ reduces $j_1$ in property/quantity $j_2$ by amount $j_3$.
$j_1$ is a dwarf planet revolving around $j_2$ with characteristics $j_3$, orbital parameters $j_4$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {jdika}, {plini}, {pluton}, {eris}, {cmaplini}, {plinycma}. In 2006, the International Astronomical Union (IAU)reduced the status of Pluto and Eris from 'planets' to a new category: 'dwarf planets'.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ [amount] is the price of $x_{2}$ to purchaser/consumer $x_{3}$ set by vendor $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posydi'a}, {posyseldi'a} for unambiguous semantics); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer ({friti}), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is {vecnu} or {canja}; neither is the same as "value" or {vamji}; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace). See also {canja}, {friti}, {janta}, {jdini}, {kargu}, {pleji}, {dapma}, {vamji} for 'value', ve {vecnu} for 'cost', {canja}, {fepni}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {prali}, {rupnu}, {sfasa}, {vamji}.

valsi.definition: $jdik_1=jdim_1$ is a discount/sales allowance/abatement/price reduced by amount $jdik_3$, of $jdim_2$ (service/goods) to purchaser/consumer $jdim_3$, discount set by vendor $jdim_4$.
$x_{1}$ is money/currency issued by $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is financial/monetary/pecuniary/fiscal.
valsi.notes: 'currency' sometimes is restricted to paper money (= {pledi'i}). See also {fepni}, {jdima}, {rupnu}, {sicni}, {canja}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=m_1=j_1$ is unwavering/determined/resolute in making decision $x_2=j_2$ (du'u) about $x_3=j_3$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of jelly/semisolid [texture] of material/composition including $x_{2}$.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought and.
scalar affirmer; denies scalar negation: Indeed!.
negation sumti qualifier: that which indeed is.
NAhE question.
vocative: roger (ack) - negative acknowledge; used to acknowledge offers and thanks.
vocative: roger (ack) - negative acknowledge; I didn't hear you.
$ji_1=je_3$ is a fountain expelling fluid $ji_2=je_2$ at location $ji_3$.
$c_1=j_3$ is a volcano projecting from land mass $c_2$.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought conn question.
shift letterals to Hebrew alphabet.
discursive: truth - falsity.
discursive: truth - falsity.
$ja_1$ (agent) proves that $je_1$ (du'u) is true by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $je_2$ to audience $ja_3$
$x_1$ is political/pertains to the politics of territory/domain $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a polity/state governing territory/domain $x_{2}$; [government/territory relationship].
$x_1$ is the $x_3$ pole of $x_2$
$l_1$ is a meridian on celestial body/sphere $j_2$ (default Earth)
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ weeks in duration (default is 1 week) by standard $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Re. $x_3$, a week may be more or less than seven days, classically being tied to the time between trips to the marketplace; this week (= {cabjeftu}); next week (= {bavlamjeftu}); last week (= {prulamjeftu}). See also {detri}, {djedi}, {masti}, {nanca}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=di_1=dj_1$ is a regularly-occurring period of days off work [weekend] lasting $x_2=dj_2$ days, recurring every $x_3=j_2=di_3$ weeks (default 1), for worker $x_4=g_1$, at job $x_5=g_2$
valsi.notes: cf. {nalgundei}, {jeftu}, {dikni}, {gunka}, {djedi}, {di'i}, {na'e}; "Weekend" (the last two days in a week, presumed to be a rest from work) is a culture-specific concept. It was felt more appropriate to make a word meaning "work holiday" and leave the days/week[s] to be specified by the person.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is the weekend of week $x_2$
$x_{1}$ pertains to the common Judeo-Christian-Moslem (Abrahamic) culture/religion/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
The Judeo-Christian-Muslim God.
abstractor: truth-value abstractor; $x_{1}$ is truth value of [bridi] under epistemology $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ burns/[ignites/is flammable/inflammable] at temperature $x_{2}$ in atmosphere $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Default $x_2$/$x_3$ to normal temperatures in air; ignite (= {jelcfa}), flammable/inflammable (usually = {jelka'e} or {jelfrili}). See also {fagri}, {kijno}, {sigja}, {livla}, {sacki}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ burns $j_1$.
$n_1=j_1$ is toasted bread made from grain(s) $n_2$.

valsi.notes: Also jewel (= {jmeja'i}); gemstone (= $x_2$, $x_3$, or {jmero'i}, {jmekunra}); pearl (= {selcakyjme} - a gem found inside a shell, {tercakyjme} - a gem made of shell material, {boijme} - any ball-shaped gem), mother-of-pearl (= {cakyjme}). See also {kunra}, {rokci}, {jadni}, {dirba}, {kargu}, {krili}, {pulji}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is an army corps, a subdivision of army unit $x_2$ which serves country/nation/group $x_3$.

logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought x but not y.
$x_{1}$ (event) shocks/stuns $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an axle/spindle [tool] on which $x_{2}$ rotates, of material/properties $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is an army serving group/community $x_{2}$ (mass) in function $x_{3}$ (activity).

$x1=j2=t1$ is horrified of $x2=j1=t2$

valsi.notes: Also $x_2$ earnings, reward (= {zanseljerna} or {nemjerna}), punishment/comeuppance (= {sfaseljerna}, {malseljerna}); $x_3$ behavior; job (= {terjerna}); $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posyjerna}, {posyseljerna} for unambiguous semantics). See also {jibri}, {pleji}, {vecnu}, {cnemu}, {canja}, {jdima}, {jinga}, {prali}, {sfasa}, {janta}, {kargu}, {vamji}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ chases/pursues/(physically) follows after $x_{2}$; volition is not implied for $x_{1}$ or $x_{2}$.

$x_{1}$ is a needle [pointed shape/form, not tool] of material $x_{2}$.

valsi.definition: $p_1$ judges the veracity of $p_2=j_1$ by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $x_3=j_2$.

valsi.notes: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is angular; $x_2$ corner; (segment $x_3$ can be defined by interval). See also {kojna}, {linji}, {konju}, {mokca}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ grasps/holds/clutches/seizes/grips/[hugs] $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ (part of $x_{1}$) at locus $x_{4}$ (part of $x_{2}$).
valsi.notes: Hug (= {birjai}, {pamjai}); handshake (= {xanjaisi'u}); hold with hands (= {xanjai}); handle (= {jaitci}). See also {ralte}, {pencu}, {darxi}, {batke}, {rinju}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a knot/tangle in/between $x_{2}$ (object/jo'u-objects).
valsi.notes: Knot (verb = {jgegau}, {jgezu'e}, {jgeri'a}, {jgela'a}), knot: fastening between two or more cords (= {jgeterjo'e}). See also {pluja}, {julne}, {lasna}, {skori}.

valsi.definition: $j_1=j_2=n_1$ is a pretzel made from grains $n_2$.

See also {cinmo}, {cumla}, {sevzi}, {sinma}, {snada}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is guitar/violin/fiddle/harp [stringed musical instrument] with actuator/plectrum/bow $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also lute, viola, cello. See also {zgike}.

rounded up (appended after string of digits indicating a rounded value).

valsi.notes: Working for another (= {selplijibri}). See also {briju}, {gunka}, {te} {jerna} which is employment specifically for pay and not specifically for another, {te} {pilno} which is employment not necessarily for pay and not necessarily regular or lasting but for another, {se} {gasnu} and {se} {zukte} for incidental activities.

$x_1$ does their job / works (activity done regularly for pay).
valsi.notes: Since {gunka} doesn't require working in the sense of a job, this word is necessary. It differs from {jibgu'a} in that one could perform their job without satisfying {gunka}.

valsi.definition: $p_1=j_2$ strikes (stops working), complaining about $p_2=j_1$ to audience $p_3$ with action $p_4$.
$x_{1}$ (object, or event: force) stirs/mixes/[roils/agitates] fluid (gas/liquid) $x_{2}$.

valsi.notes: $x_2$ is founded on basis $x_1$ (= {selcmu} for reordered places); (adjective:) $x_1$ is basic/basal/fundamental); (generally events and properties will be bases for events and states, while objects may be bases/bottoms for objects). See also cmavo list {ji'u}, {jamfu}, {zbepi}, {genja}, {krasi}.
