$x_{1}$ (person) intuits $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$; [epistemology].
valsi.notes: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also {djuno}, {facki}, {jimpe}, {jinvi}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {sidbo}, {smadi}.

valsi.definition: $jin_1=jij_1$ has intuition-based opinion (suspicion) $jin_2=jij_2$ (du'u) on subject $jin_3=jij_3$
valsi.notes: Cf. {jinvi}, {jijnu}. This word coined when looking for a suitable word for "to suspect", or "suspicion". Intended to be neutral, however, rather than matching the negative connotation in English.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ interacts/behaves socially with $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ socializes with/is sociable towards $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ consists of the economic system (production and distribution and consumption) of sector components $x_2$; $x_1$ is economic.
valsi.notes: x2 may be a country or other area, the labor, capital and land resources, and the economic agents that socially participate in the production, exchange, distribution, and consumption of goods and services of that area; they may be joined with JOI. {pavmomseljikni} for "primary sector", {relmomseljikni} for "secondary sector", {cibmomseljikni} for "tertiary sector", and {vonmomseljikni} for "quaternary sector"; {gubyseljikni} for "public/state sector", {sivyseljikni} for "private sector", and {jikseljikni} for "social/voluntary sector". Cf. {venci'e}, {selpraci'e}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of liquor/spirits distilled from $x_{2}$.
$c_1$ is a quantity of liqueur coffee/coffee drink with a shot of liqueur/spirit $j_1$.
valsi.notes: See also: coffee making (={kafpra}), Gaelic/Highland/Irish Coffee (={kotyjikryckafi}), Bailey's Coffee (={kafrbeili}), Monk's Coffee (={kafrbenediktine}), Whisky Coffee (={ckafruiski}), Russian Coffee (={kafrvo'otka}), Karsk (={kafrkarska}).

valsi.definition: $s_1=j_1$ is aloof/alone/solitary/a hermit, separated from $s_2=j_1$.
$s_1$ commits faux pas (social error) $s_2$, which is wrong under conditions $s_3$ according to standard $s_4$.
$t_1$ is an institution governing social/cooperative human behaviour $t_2$.
valsi.notes: Use x2 tu'a for e.g. education. Cf. {turni}

valsi.definition: $d_1=s_1$ (individual, mass) social dances with $s_2$ to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$.
$jd_1=ji_1$ is tactful in making decision $jd_2$ in matter $jd_3$ (event/state) in social interaction with $ji_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of alkali/base of composition including $x_{2}$.
$s_1$ is an alkaline battery in containment $s_3$.
$x_{1}$ (person) is jealous of/envies $x_{2}$ (person) about/for $x_{3}$ (property - ka).
$j_1$=$b_1$ is a prosthetic bone made of metal, performing function $b_2$ in body $b_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a branch/bough/limb of $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ forks into branches $x_{1}$; [preferred over metaphorical birka].
$z_1$ is an anvil for striking metal $d_2=j_2$ with instrument $d_3$.
$s_1$ is a zing/clang produced by metal $j_1=d_2=s_2$ being hit.
$x_1$ is Friday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ understands/comprehends fact/truth $x_{2}$ (du'u) about subject $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ understands (fi) $x_{3}$.
$j_1=s_1$ is a wire/cable of metal $j_2=s_2$
valsi.notes: This may be a single or multiple strand, but must be metallic.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a limit/extreme/bound/border/[confinement] of $x_{2}$ in property/domain $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Restrain/constrain within limits (= {jitri'u}, {jitygau}, {jityzu'e}). See also cmavo list {ji'e}, {traji}, {korbi}, {kuspe}, {rinju}, {bapli}, {curmi}, {fanta}, {jbini}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is an alloy including metals $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is a pair of shears/scissors for cutting $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (person/team) wins/gains prize $x_{2}$ from/over $x_{3}$ [competitors/losers] in competition $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is a victor; $x_2$ reward; $x_3$ competitors here are opponents and in many situations, defeated/losers, vs. the set of those competing for a goal; $x_2$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {posyji'a}, {posyselji'a} for unambiguous semantics). See also {cirko}, {jivna}, {talsa}, {cnemu}, {prali}, {pleji}, {sfasa}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {bradi}, {kargu}, {kelci}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a vaccine/immune-system stimulant protecting $x_{2}$ against disease $x_{3}$ introduced by method $x_{4}$.
$t_1$=$j_1$ is an immune-system deficiency of $j_2$.
valsi.notes: From {jinku}, {toldu'e}. t2, t3, j3, j4 based on relative uselessness (you could use tanru to get what type-of immune deficiency you're referring at).

valsi.definition: $x1=d1=m1$ is a crown of material $x2=d2=m2$
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of made of metal of composition including $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is beryllium.
$x_1$ is niobium.
$x_1$ is platinum.
$x_1$ is titanium (metal).
$x_1$ is thulium.
$x_1$ is hafnium.
$x_1$ is a washer of material $x_2$, inside diameter $x_3$, outer diameter $x_4$, and thickness $x_5$
$x_{1}$ (object/person) is immersed/submerged/bathes in liquid $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (object) is clean/pure of material/contaminant/dirt $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
$n_1$ is a quantity of doughnut.
$x_{1}$ is a well/spring of fluid $x_{2}$ at location $x_{3}$.
$k_1=j_1$ is a well in $k_2$ containing fluid $j_2$ at location $j_3$.
$x_{1}$ thinks/opines $x_{2}$ [opinion] (du'u) is true about subject/issue $x_{3}$ on grounds $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also cmavo list {pe'i}, {djuno}, {krici}, {ciksi}, {jijnu}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {senpi}, {sidbo}, {birti}, {pinka}.

valsi.definition: $n_1$ is a bagel.
$x_{1}$ (property - ka) is an innate/inherent/intrinsic/natural property/quality/aspect of $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a chicken/[hen/cock/rooster]/small fowl [a type of bird] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x1=f1$ is a hen of species $x2=j2$
$x_1$ is a vertex of polytope $x_2$ at locus $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a tip/point/vertex/extremity/end [0-dimension shape/form] on object $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$g_1$ is a diving/dive/scuba mask covering the face of $g_2=f_2=j_1$, for use in liquid $j_2$.
$x_1$=$g_1$ immerses $x_2$=$j_1$ in liquid $x_3$=$j_2$
$l_1$ (agent) bathes $l_2=j_1$ in liquid $j_2=l_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the horn [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: pointed extremity].
$t_{1}$=$j_{1}$ is a/the horn [brass-wind/lip-reed musical instrument; default
valsi.notes: jirnytabra refers generally to the common horn (brass instrument). "..the instrument is often informally known as the French horn. However, this is technically incorrect since the instrument is not French in origin, but German. Therefore, the International Horn Society has recommended since 1971 that the instrument be simply called the horn." (wikipedia). Also natural horn (=sampu jirnytabra), vienna horn (=vin zei jirnytabra or {tabrviena}), mellophone (={tabrmelofono}), wagner tuba ({tabrvagnri}). See also {jirna} and {tabra}.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ dives [manner of controlled falling] to $s_2$ from $s_3$ into liquid $j_2$.
valsi.notes: Different styles of diving: head first (=nitfarstedu jirsu'u), "cannonball" (=boitse jirsu'u), etc. See also {zajyjirsu'u}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=v_1=c_1$ is preserved food/feed/nutriment pickled/immersed in $x_2=j_2$.
valsi.notes: $x_2=j_2$ is salt (= {silna}), vinegar (= {slami}), alcohol (= {xalka}), sugar (= {sakta}), honey (= {bicysakta}), soy sauce (= {sobysanso}), bean paste (= {furso'epesxu}), mold paste (= {mledi} {pesxu}) and so on. {jinru} {vitno} {cidja}. See also {slamystogau}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of juice/nectar from-source/of-type $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Water-based extract from a (generally) biological source. See also {pinxe}, {djacu}, {grute}, {stagi}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a quantitiy of pineapple juice made from pineapple/pineapples $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a do with clean $x_{2}$ with material cleaned away $x_{3}$ with cleanness standard $x_{4}$.
$x1=t1$ is an apron of $x2=j1=s1$, keeping them clean from contaminant $x3=j2$
$x_{1}$ (du'u) is false/is an untruth by standard/epistemology/metaphysics $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also {fatci}, {stace}, {jetnu}, {cfika}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ has control over/harnesses/manages/directs/conducts $x_{2}$ in $x_{3}$ (activity/event/performance).
valsi.notes: $x_2$ are aspects/individuals controlled within activity/event $x_3$; manage (= {selzuktro}, {selzukfu'e}, {gu'etro}, {gunfu'e}, {xaktro}, {xakfu'e}) (as distinct from manager/boss = {gunterbe'e}, {gunja'a}, {gunmi'e}, {gunca'i}). (cf. cmavo list {ji'o}, {bapli}, te {bende}, {gidva} - which does not necessarily control or command, {jatna}, {macnu}, {minde}, {ponse}, {ralju}, {rinka}, {sazri}, {turni}, {vlipa}, {xance}, {xlura})

valsi.definition: $b_1=j_1$ comes to the conclusion that $j_2$ [opinion] (du'u) is true about subject/issue $j_3$ on grounds $j_4$, under conditions $b_3$.
$x_{1}$ weaves $x_{2}$ from material/[yarn] $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ competes/vies with opponent $x_{2}$ in contest/competition $x_{3}$ (event) for gain $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ rivals $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_2$ opponent(s), competitor(s), rival(s); $x_3$ competition, race; $x_4$ prize, reward, recognition (gain may be internal or external). See also {cnemu}, {jinga}, {talsa}, {bradi}, {fapro}, {kelci}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ (mass/set) do orienteering in competition of type $x_2$ [property of the event] with (other) rule(s) $x_3$ [property of each participant].
valsi.notes: The x2 is the major type of the orienteering event, be it Score-O, point-to-point, or other types such as MountainBike-O, etc. The x3 is a property of the individual participants, including things like "not allowed to go beyond point X" or "beating up other participants is allowed" etc. The tanru "jivnrfarzu'e se gunma" is sufficient to say "I do orienteering".

valsi.definition: $x_1=f_1=j_1$ is unlike $x_2=f_2=j_1$ in their opinion of $x_3=j_3$.
$p_2=j_1$ is the temperament (innate personality) of $p_1=j_2$.
$c_1$ is an ankle of $j_2=c_3$
$j_1=d_1$ is a toe of $j_2=d_2$.
$c_1$ is a toenail of toe $c_2=d_1$ of body $d_3$.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ foot/feet (length unit).
$x_{1}$ (mass/jo'u) gathers/collects at location $x_{2}$ from locations $x_{3}$ (mass/jo'u).
$j_1$ is a sole (part of foot) of $j_2$.
$c_1$ is the big toe nail of body $t_3=j_2$.
$t_1$ is the big toe of $t_3=j_2$.
$t_1$ is a heel of $j_2$.
$v_1$ is a pedal with function $v_2$, fulcrum $x_3$, and lever arm $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a shoal [shallow hazard]/reef of material $x_{2}$ in body of water $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ adds/combines $x_{2}$ to/with $x_{3}$, with result $x_{4}$; $x_{1}$ augments $x_{2}$ by amount $x_{3}$.
$x_1=f_2=j_1$ easily understands fact(s) $x_2=j_2$ about $x_3=j_3$ under conditions of ease $x_4=f_3$.
$s_1=j_1$ misunderstands fact/truth $j_2$ (du'u) about subject $j_3$, an error under conditions $s_3$ by standard $s_4$.
$x_{1}$ lives/is alive by standard $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is an organism/living thing.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought biconditional/iff/if-and-only-if.
discursive: metalinguistic affirmer.
non-logical connective: union of sets.
join mathematical expression (mex) operands into an array.
shift letterals to Arabic alphabet.
non-logical connective: in common with; along with (unmixed).
non-logical connective: mixed conjunction; "and" meaning "mixed together", forming a mass.
letteral: ampersand character; especially used in standing for a mixed connective.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought exclusive or; Latin 'aut'.
$g_1$ causes $j_1$ to be joined to/connected to/united with $j_2$ at common locus $j_3$.
$p_1$ [ordered set] is a train/procession/caravan/string sequenced/ordered/listed by comparison/rules $p_2$ on unordered set $p_3=j_1=j_2$.
$x_1$ are joined at/by $x_2$.
$g_1$ [person/agent] join $s_1$ together.
$x_1$ is the union of sets $x_2$ and $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Jordanian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is joined to/connects to/is united with $x_{2}$ at common locus $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ and $x_{2}$ are a union.
valsi.notes: Also joined/fastened/attached by joint $x_3$/by means of $x_3$/with fastener $x_3$; fastener (= {jo'etci}, {jonvelyla'a}); train, sequence of joined objects (= {jonpoi}; {porjo'e} for a single object joined into a sequence). See also {lasna}, {fenso}, {kansa}, {pencu}, {penmi}.

valsi.definition: $r_1$ is measured in jordanian dinar (دينارJOD) as $r_2$ (quantity), in the Algerian monetary system $r_3$.
logical connective: tanru-internal afterthought whether-or-not.
evidential: I state - (default) elliptical/non-specific basis.
evidential: although, even though, while, whilst
vague non-logical connective: analogous to plain ".i".
Tight scope bridi separator; analogous to {.i} without ending the abstractor or relative clause.
valsi.notes: "nu broda ju'ei brode" is equivalent to "nu ju'e gi broda gi brode". Similarly "ko'a noi broda ju'ei brode" is equivalent to "ko'a noi ju'e gi broda gi brode".

valsi.definition: vocative: attention - at ease - ignore me.
vocative: attention - at ease - ignore me.
vocative: attention - at ease - ignore me.
attitudinal modifier: certainty - uncertainty - impossibility.
attitudinal modifier: intense certainty.
attitudinal modifier: certainty - uncertainty - impossibility.
attitudinal modifier: certainty - uncertainty - impossibility.
attitudinal: certainty question.
binary mathematical operator: number base; [a interpreted in the base b].
$x_{1}$ is a table/flat solid upper surface of material $x_{2}$, supported by legs/base/pedestal $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ makes $x_2$ pay attention to $x_3$; $x_1$ directs $x_2$'s attention to $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is an address of/are coordinates of $x_{2}$ in system $x_{3}$.
$j_1=s_1$ is a hyperlink/URL of resource/web page $j_2=s_2$ for browser $s_3$.
$x_1$ is a paragraph about $x_2$ including sentence(s) $x_3$.
$p_1$ is a phrase of sentence $p_2=j_1$ about $j_2$ in language $j_3$.
$x_{1}$ (text) is a sentence/statement about $x_{2}$ [topic/subject/predicate/focus] in language $x_{3}$.
$s_1$ is a fragment of sentence $s_2=j_1$ about $j_2$ in language $j_3$.
$t_1=m_1$ is the intonation of sentence $j_1=m_2$ with characteristics $t_2=m_3$.
$j_1=b_1$ is the Chinese-Mandarin language, used by $b_2$ to communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote)
$x_1$ is a Chinese character in writing system $x_2$ (traditional/simplified/bopomofo/etc.) meaning $x_3$.
$r_1$ is measured in renminbi yuan (¥; RMB) as $r_2$ (quantity), in the Chinese monetary system $r_3$.
$j_1=g_1$ is China.
$sm_1=j_1$ is/are Chinese style soup spoon(s) (中式湯匙) [item of cutlery] for eating $sm_2$ made of material $s_3$.
valsi.notes: A type of spoon used in Chinese cuisine with a short, thick handle extending directly from a deep, flat bowl. It is used for eating soups, stews, or loose solids such as rice, and is commonly made using porcelains and ceramics.

valsi.definition: $r_1=j_1$ is a China rose (Rosa chinensis) of species/strain $r_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a spider/arachnid/crustacean/crab/lobster/non-insect arthropod of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ cooks/prepares food-for-eating $x_{2}$ by recipe/method $x_{3}$ (process).
valsi.notes: Cook with heat (= {glajukpa}, {glaterjukpa}), bake (= {tokyjukpa}); fry (= {rasyjukpa}). See also {cupra}, {bredi}.

valsi.definition: Spiderman
$x_{1}$ is a net/filter allowing passage of $x_{2}$, prohibiting passage of $x_{3}$, netting properties $x_{4}$.
$x_1$ is $x_2$ degrees in angular measure (default is 1)
valsi.notes: Cf. {junla}, {radno}, {cacryra'o}, {plinyxabykoi}, {jedjipli'i}. {pi'e} used in x2 indicates a base of 60.

valsi.definition: $s_1$=$j_1$ (mass of facts) is microbiology studying microorganisms x2 based on methodology x3.
$x_{1}$ is attentive towards/attends/tends/pays attention to object/affair $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ tells/makes known to $x_2$ fact(s) $x_3$ (du'u) about subject $x_4$ by epistemology $x_5$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Chinese [Mandarin, Cantonese, Wu, etc.] culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a rush of species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is clock/watch/timer measuring time units $x_{2}$ to precision $x_{3}$ with timing mechanism/method $x_{4}$.
$l_1$ [rules/methods] is an epistemic logic for deducing/concluding/inferring/reasoning to/about $l_2$ (du'u).
$x_1$ is a juniper/cedar of species/variety $x_2$.
valsi.notes: some trees called "cedar" are actually juniper; see {ricrcedro}, {ckunu}

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (person) is serious/earnest/has gravity about $x_{2}$ (event/state/activity).
$s_1$ is an epistemology of/about ideas of knowledge $j_1=s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
$x_{1}$ is the weight of object $x_{2}$ in [gravitational or other force] field $x_{3}$.
$m_1$ (agent) weighs object $j_2$ as $m_3$ units on scale $m_4$ (si'o) in field $j_3$.
$k_1$ is a cuisine pertaining to culture/geographical region/ethos/religion $k_2$ with dishes $j_2$ cooked/prepared by recipe(s)/method(s) $j_3$ (process).
$x_1=k_1$ is a kitchen, in which $x_2=j_1$ cooks $x_3=j_2$, in home/building/structure $x_4=k_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $x_5=k_3$ (mass/jo'u).

$x_1$ blanches/cooks/prepares food-for-eating $x_2$ by sitting it in boiling liquid $x_3$ for a short time-duration/interval $x_4$ and then plunged into/placed under running liquid $x_5$, blanched at boiling temperature $x_6$ and pressure $x_7$.
valsi.notes: See also: boil (={febjukpa}), simmer (={febjbijukpa}), poach (={febmlijukpa}), court bouillon (={likrkorbojo}/{febmliseljukpa}). Not to be confused with other definitions of blanching, like parboiling (={nalmulfebjukpa}).

valsi.definition: $x_1$ cooks/prepares Thai food $x_2$ by recipe/method $x_3$ (process)
$t_1$ is a frying pan/wok used by cook $j_1$ for cooking/frying/sautéing $j_2=t_1$, made of material $t_3$
$x_1$ is a plantain (banana) of species $x_2$.
$p_1$ is a pot used by $j_1$ for cooking/boiling/steaming $j_2=p_2$ with recipe $j_3$; pot made of material $p_3$
$p_1=j_2$ is a baked good/cake/mochi/doughnut/pizza dough/pie/macaroon/[cooked paste] made from $p_2$ prepared by $j_1$ according to method/recipe $j_3$
valsi.notes: Cf. {jukpa}, {pesxu}, {titnanba}, {rutytisna}. Originally coined by .lis.nunyn. on IRC.

valsi.definition: $b_1$ is a dumpling made from material $x_2$ filled with material $x_3$
$x_{1}$ is a bacterium/germ/microbe/protozoan/amoeba [1-celled life] of species/defining property $x_{2}$.
$j_1=p_1$ considers / reflects on $j_2=p_2$.
$x_{1}$ (event/action/state) is severe/harsh to $x_{2}$ [victim/experiencer].
$x_{1}$ = $c_{1}$ reproach/criticizes/harshly says $c_{2}$ = $c_{2}$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) to $x_{3}$ = $c_{3}$ = $j_{2}$ via expressive medium $x_{4}$ = $c_{4}$.
valsi.notes: See {jursa}, {cusku}. Equivalent to "lo nu ko'a cusku ko'e ko'i ko'o kei jursa ko'i".

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a species of genus $x_{2}$, family $x_{3}$, etc.; [open-ended tree-structure categorization].
valsi.notes: Also subspecies, order, phylum; (places do not correspond to specific levels in the hierarchy; rather, $x_1$ is at a "lower" or "bushier" part of the tree than $x_2$, $x_2$ is "lower" than $x_3$, etc.; skipping a place thus means that there is one or more known-and-unspecified levels of hierarchy between the two); not limited to Linnean animal/plant taxonomy. See also {klesi}, {lanzu}.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is (biological) taxonomy based on methodology $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ (action) is clumsy/awkward by standard $x_{2}$.
Goofy
$l_1$ is a regular/predictable lujvo (compound predicate word) with meaning $l_2$ and arguments $l_3$ built from phrase $l_4$ and having an argument structure according to rule $j_1$.
valsi.notes: A Lojban-specific term. The approach of jvajvo is intended to at least constrain what the $x_2$, $x_3$, $x_4$... etc. of a lujvo may be, and also to draw the semantic values of those places from the semantic values of the places of the component brivla. The rationale is that the place structure of an unknown {lujvo} should not require memorization. This was previously known as ``{dikyjvo}''; a mistranslation of ``regular lujvo'', as it used the wrong sense of ``regular'' (see {dikni}).

valsi.definition: $c_1=j_1$ wages a contest $c_2=j_3$ on $c_3=j_2$ for gain $j_4$.
$x1=j3=p1$ is a course/[competition route] to $x2=p2$ from $x3=p3$ via points $x4=p4$
$x_{1}$ is the view/scene/panorama/sight/prospect of $x_{2}$ (object/location) from point-of-view $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_1$ is on display to $x_2$/$x_3$. See also {catlu}, {kanla}, {viska}, {canko}, {jarco}.

valsi.definition: $xi_1$ is a racehorse of breed $xi_2$ competing in race $j_3$.
$k_1$ separates affix compound $k_2$ into its constituent affixes $k_3$; $k_1$ does morphological analysis.
letteral for j.
James Cooke Brown.
abstractor: property/quality abstractor (-ness); $x_{1}$ is quality/property exhibited by [bridi].
klama modal, 1st place gone to by ...
kansa modal, 1 place; with .../with a companion ...
$m_1$ is an axe for cutting $k_2$ with blade $m_3=k_1$ propelled by $m_4$.
$b_1=k_1$ bites through $b_2=k_2$ (object) on/at specific locus $b_3$ with $b_4$ to pieces $k_3$.
$d_1$ is an incisor of $d_2$.
$x1=k1=v1$ cuts off $x2=k3=v2$ from $x3=k2=v3$, leaving $x4=k3=v4$
modal aspect: innate capability; possibly unrealized.
krati modal, 1st place represented by ...
$s_1$ is the concept of representative democracy (default: political representative democracy) as it applies to the governance of $t_2$ based on the works of thinker(s) $s_3$
digit/number: imaginary i; square root of -1.
$s_1=k_1$ is sickly/appears healthy to observer $s_3$ by standard $k_2$.
$x_1$ is a carrot of species/variety/cultivar $x_2$
evidential: I know by cultural means (myth or custom).
$x_1$ scores/gains a point against $x_2$ in competition/game/contest $x_3$.
$k_1$ is a quark with flavor $k_2$.
valsi.notes: Proposal of name of “flavors”: up (=le {gapru}), down (=le {cnita}), strange (=le {cizra}), charm (=le {melbi}), top (=le {galtu}), bottom (=le {dizlo}). Antiquark (={to'e zei ka'urkuarka}). Virtual (or sea) quark (={zastce zei ka'urkuarka}).

valsi.definition: $k_1$ is a lepton [elementary particle] with flavour $k_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a cup/glass/tumbler/mug/vessel/[bowl] containing contents $x_{2}$, and of material $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: A kabri is normally eaten from by lifting it; a palta is not. See also {palta}, {citka}, {blaci}, {tansi}.

valsi.definition: $d_1$ is $d_2$ cupful(s).
$k_1$ is $k_2$ (quantifier, default: one) cupfuls in quantity.
$x_{1}$ is a camera/photographic equipment recording illumination type $x_{2}$ images to medium $x_{3}$.
$p_3$ takes a photo/picture $p_1$ depicting/representing/showing $p_2$.
$p_1$ is a photograph of $p_2$ taken by photographer $p_3$ in medium $p_4$=$k_3$.
$p_1$ is a sequence of numbers in ascending order.
$x_{1}$ reflects Canadian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$k_1=f_1=b_1$ is the Canadian French language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$k_1=g_1=b_1$ is the Canadian English language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$k_1=g_1$ is Canada
$r_1$ is measured in canadian dollar (CAD) as $r_2$ (quantity), in the Canadian monetary system $r_3$.
$x_1$ is a wild onion/Canada onion/wild garlic/meadow garlic/Canadian garlic (Allium canadense) of species/breed $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ coughs/farts/burps up/out $x_{2}$ [predominantly gaseous] from orifice $x_{3}$.
$j_1=p_1$ is a coffee paper filter allowing passage of coffee [liquid] $j_2=c_1$, prohibiting passage of coffee solids $j_3$, filter/paper properties $j_4=p_2$.
$cu_1$ makes coffee/produces a quantity of coffee drink/product $cu_2=ck_1$ by process $cu_3$.
valsi.notes: Examples of x2: black coffee (={xekckafi}), coffee beverage with dairy product (={ladyckafi}), liqueur coffee (={jikryckafi}), decaffeinated coffee (={nalkafxumckafi}). See also coffeemaker (={kafpraca'a}), barista (={crekafpra}), fika/coffee break (={fi'ikca}).

valsi.definition: $ca_1$ is a coffeemaker/is an apparatus/device for producing coffee $ca_2=cu_2=ck_1$ controlled/[triggered] by $ca_3$ (agent).
valsi.notes: See also: making coffee (={kafpra}), (electric) drip coffeemaker (={digyfalkafpraca'a}), french press (={da'erju'ebo'i}), moka pot (={botrmuka}), percolator (={botrperkolato}), espresso machine (={cabrspreso}), vending machine (={venzmi}), coffee (paper) filter (={kafpleju'e}).

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a quantity of Bailey's coffee of composition $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a quantity of Monk's Coffee of composition $x_2$ (including Bénédictine).
$c_1$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of Kentucky coffee from source/bean/grain $c_2$.
valsi.notes: The seed from the Kentucky coffeetree (={ricrgimnocladu}) may be roasted and used as a substitute for coffee beans; however, unroasted pods and seeds are toxic.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a quantity of cappuccino [coffee beverage] of composition/type/standard $x_2$.
valsi.notes: For non-cultural specific usage: coffee with hot milk (={glaladyckafi}).

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a quantity of karsk/kaffekask/kaffegök/kaffedoktor [liqueur coffee] of composition $x_2$ (including moonshine/vodka).
valsi.notes: Scandinavian cocktail. See also: liqueur coffee (={jikryckafi}), Russian coffee (={kafrvo'otka}).

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a quantity of latte/caffè latte/caffelatte/grand crème/milchkaffee of composition/type/standard $x_2$.
valsi.notes: See also: latte drinker (={pixrlate}). For non-cultural specific usage: coffee with hot milk (={glaladyckafi}).

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a quantity of café con leche [coffee beverage] of composition/type $x_2$.
valsi.notes: For non-cultural specific usage: coffee with hot milk (={glaladyckafi}).

valsi.definition: $x_1=c_1$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of espresso [coffee beverage] from beans $x_2=c_2$ with crema $x_3$ (the foam with a creamy texture that forms as a result of the pressure).
valsi.notes: See also: black coffee (={xekckafi}), espresso machine (={cabrspreso}), barista (={crekafpra}), café au lait/latte/cappuccino [coffee drink with heated dairy product] (={glaladyckafi}).

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a quantity of flat white [coffee beverage] of composition/type $x_2$.
valsi.notes: For non-cultural specific usage: coffee with hot milk (={glaladyckafi}).

valsi.definition: $c_1$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of dandelion coffee from source/bean/grain $c_2$.
$x_1$ is a quantity of Russian coffee of composition $x_2$ (including vodka).
$s_1$ is/are coffee spoon(s) [item of cutlery] suitable for stirring and sipping the contents of a cup of coffee, made of material $s_3$.
valsi.notes: The coffee spoon is a smaller variant of the teaspoon. See also: coffee measuring (measuring unit={kafdekpu})/coffee measuring cup/instrument (={kafdekpyvau}).

valsi.definition: $t_1$ is/are (a) coffee bean(s) of coffee plant $t_2$.
$x_1$ is caffeine with chemical purity $x_2$
$v_1$ decaffeinates/removes caffeine $v_2=x_1=c_1$ from $v_3$ with/leaving result/remnant/remainder $v_4$.
valsi.notes: Third place could be coffee beans, cocoa, tea leaves and other caffeine-containing materials.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a coffeehouse/coffee bar/café serving $x_2$ to audience/patrons $x_3$.
valsi.notes: See also barista (={crekafpra}), fika (={kafybarja}), making coffee (={kafpra}).

valsi.definition: $p_1$ is a barista/works at coffehouse/coffee bar $b_1$ serving $b_2$ to audience/patrons $b_3$.
$d_1$ is $d_2$ (default 1) coffee measuring cup(s), standard $d_3$ (default: 1 volume unit=1 cup of drinkable coffee), $d_4$ subunits.
valsi.notes: Coffee measure is a unit of volume that is not, strictly speaking, is a unit of measurement , but rather a name for a measuring cup with slightly different size, but usually 15 to 20 ml. The measure is designed to measure the adequacy 1-1.25 cups drinkable coffee .

valsi.definition: $j_1$ is the president/[chairperson of the board] of $j_2=k_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a company/corporation/firm/partnership chartered by authority $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
$f_1$ is a corporate officer.
$p_1$ is a business park managed by community/polity/company $p_2$ for businesses/firms/corporations of type $k_3$..
$t_2 $ is a/the private computer network that includes nodes/computers $t_1=s_1$ whose function/purpose is $s_2$, installed across organization $k_1$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {kagni}, {skami}, {tcana}, {mujysamseltcana}, {internet}, {intranet}. May or may not be an intranet.

valsi.definition: $d_2 $ is/are the indebtedness/liabilities of company/corporation/firm $d_1=k_1$ to creditor(s) $d_3$ for the provision of goods /services/loans $d_4$.
$p_2$ is/are an/the asset(s) of company/corporation/firm/partnership $p_1=k_1$ according to law $p_3$.
ckaji modal, 1st place characterizing ...
$x_1$ wants to be/do $x_2$ (ka) for purpose $x_3$
valsi.notes: This is the ka-version of djica.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (event/experience) warns/cautions $x_{2}$ (person) of/about danger $x_{3}$ (event/state/property).
valsi.notes: Agentive warning (= {jdegau}, {jdezu'e}); an attempt to warn which may not succeed (= {jdetoi}, {jdegautoi}, {jdezuktoi}). See also {ckape}, {nupre}, {snura}, {tcica}, {xlura}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a shelf/counter/bar in/on/attached to supporting object $x_{2}$, for purpose $x_{3}$.
$t_1=k_2$ is a cupboard for storing $t_2$, made of $t_3$, with shelves $k_1$.
$x_{1}$ is able to do/be/capable of doing/being $x_{2}$ (event/state) under conditions $x_{3}$ (event/state).
valsi.notes: Also: has talent; know how to; know how to use (= {plika'e}). (cf. {stati}, {certu}, {gasnu} (in the time-free potential sense), {cmavo} list {ka'e}, cmavo list {nu'o}, cmavo list {pu'i}, {djuno}, {zifre})

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (agent) digs $x_{2}$ [material] up/out of $x_{3}$ [source/hole] with limbs/tool(s) $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_1$ cuts into $x_3$ (with material removal). See also {katna}, {plixa}, {sraku}, {canpa}, {sraku}.

$v_1=k_2$ defecates/shits/poos.
$g_1$ is an eyelid of eye $k_1=g_2$.
$ke_1$ is an eyelash (body part) of $ke_2=ka_2$.

$x_1=v_2$ is a tear/tear fluid of $x_2=v_1$.

valsi.notes: Also verb: to fish (= {fipkalte}). See also {jersi}, {kavbu}, {sisku}, {rivbi}.

valsi.definition: $v_1=k_2$ weeps/lacrimates tear(s) $v_2$ from $v_3$ via means/route $v_4$.
$k_1$ is the greatness/majesty/splendour/magnificence/grandeur of $b_1$ according to standard $b_3$.
$k_1$ is a security condition of $b_1$ protecting $b_2$ from threat $b_3$.
valsi.notes: When used as "security", x3 is a planned threat. "security" is comparable to "safety" ({kamnu'a}), "reliability" ({kamylacri}), and "continuity" ({kamra'i}).

valsi.definition: $k_1$ is quality/property exhibited by $b_1$ of being foolish/silly/stupid in event/action /property (ka) $b_2$.
$x_1$ is the identity function/equality relation
valsi.notes: brivla form of ka ce'u du ma kau.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of camphor (chemical compound)

valsi.notes: The x2 through x4 places are = m2.

valsi.definition: $k_1=b_1$ is a vertebra of $b_3$ ; $b_3$ is a vertebrate.
$x_1$ is a leek of variety $x_2$.
$kam_1$ is the health of $kan_1$ by standard $kan_2$.
$x_{1}$ (mass) is a committee with task/purpose $x_{2}$ of body $x_{3}$.

valsi.notes: Only fully universal sense applies; $x_1$ must be found in all members of $x_2$. For the non-universal sense see {fadni} and {zilfadni}. See also {cafne}, {rirci}, {fadni}, {cnano}, {tcaci}, {lakne}, {cmima}, {simxu}.

valsi.definition: $k_1$ is the relation of $s_1$ to $s_2$.
$x_1$ reflects Welsh language/culture in aspect $x_2$.
$k_1$ is the speed of $s_1$ doing/being/bringing about $s_2$.
$k_1$ is the fatigue of $t_1$ in being/doing $t_2$ (event).
$k_1$ is the strength of $t_1$ in property/quality $t_2$ (ka).
$c_1$ is the childhood (state of being a child) of $v_1$.
$k_1$ is the power of $v_1$ in aspect $v_2$ under conditions $v_3$.
$x_1$ is a fellow man/compatriot/mate/comrade of $x_2$, being united in $x_3$ (ka)
valsi.notes: Differs from {pendo} in being impersonal, united because of x3. Differs from {kansa} in being affectionate and empathic.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is the quality of whom/what is free to do/be $x_2=z_2$; $x_1$ is freedom/liberty of $x_2=z_2$

valsi.notes: From goat (={kanba}). Capricornus is Latin for "horned male goat" or "goat horn". Anyway, both male and female of the genus Capra have horns.

valsi.definition: $c_1$ is a quantity of Chèvre/goat cheese of variety/from goat $c_2=k_1$.
$ku_1$ is a goatherd/takes-care-of/attends to//is caretaker for animals $ku_2=ka_1$.
$x_1$ is January of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.

$x_{1}$ is dim/dull/pale/non-intense in property $x_{2}$ (ka) as received/measured by observer $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: In colors, indicates unsaturated, pastel, pale (though blabi can also indicate a kind of paleness). See also {blabi}, {carmi}, {klina}, {linto}, {manku}, {murse}, {ruble}, {skari}, {milxe}, {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xekri}, {xunre}, {zirpu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a candirú of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a kangaroo of species/breed $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ calculates/reckons/computes $x_{2}$ [value (ni)/state] from data $x_{3}$ by process $x_{4}$.
$j_1=k_1$ is a watch (portable timepiece) measuring time units $j_2$ to precision $j_3$ with timing mechanism $j_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the eye [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: sensory apparatus]; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is ocular.
$x_1$ expects/looks for the occurence of $x_2$ (event), expected likelihood $x_3$ (0-1, default {li} {so'a} i.e. near 1); $x_1$ subjectively evaluates the likelihood of $x_2$ (event) to be $x_3$.
valsi.notes: The value of $x_3$ is a subjective estimate of likeliness according to $x_1$, and is the basic determinant of whether kanpe means something like "hope" or "wish" or "expect", although kanpe never carries the connotation of desire; for that connotation see {pacna}. kanpe with $x_3$ not very close to 1 has no simple equivalent in English, but for objects/states with negligible expectation it is something like "wishing"; if the state is plausibly likely, it is something like "hoping". In both cases, though, the English implication of emotional desire is not present. The value will usually be expressed using inexact numbers ("{li} {piso'u}" to "{li} {piro}"); not-necessarily desirous wish, not-necessarily-desirous hope. See also {djica}, {pacna}, {lakne}, {cunso}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is healthy/fit/well/in good health by standard $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is with/accompanies/is a companion of $x_{2}$, in state/condition/enterprise $x_{3}$ (event/state).
valsi.notes: $x_1$ is together with/along with $x_2$. See also {kagni}, {jorne}, {gunma}, {girzu}, {lasna}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ do $x_2$ together.

$x_1=p_1$ is a tattoo/body art/brand/[image on the body] depicting $x_2=p_2$ on animal/body part $x_3=s_2$ made by artist $x_4=p_3$
$x_{1}$ [observer] compares $x_{2}$ with $x_{3}$ in property $x_{4}$ (ka), determining comparison $x_{5}$ (state).
$x_{1}$ is a car/automobile/truck/van [a wheeled motor vehicle] for carrying $x_{2}$, propelled by $x_{3}$
$c_1$ is a sandal for protecting feet $c_2$, and of material $c_3$.
$x_1=c_1=k_2$ is a self-propelled artillery gun for use against $x_2$ by $x_3$, launching projectile $c_2$ propelled by $c_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a card [small nearly-2-dimensional shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, shape $x_{3}$.

$x_{1}$ (object/commodity/property/event) is costly/expensive/dear to $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: $x_1$ may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= {poskargu} for unambiguous semantics). See also {vamji}, {dirba}, {vajni}, {jdima}, {pleji}, {canja}, {jerna}, {jinga}, {jemna}, {sfasa}, {vecnu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is hibiscus of species/variety $x_2$.
$k_1$ is a wolverine of variety $k_2$.

$x_1$ is a carnival devoted to $x_2$

valsi.notes: $x_2$ may be a subject, but not all journals have a single subject; all have some sort of principle defining what is included, so this need not be a list. See also {papri}, {pelji}, {tcidu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is the $x_3$'rd issue/number of journal/periodical/magazine/publication $x_2$ with content $x_4$ published by $x_5$ for audience $x_6$ .

valsi.notes: {kalri}+{porpi}+{jbena} This is based on the lujvo {karpo'i}, glossed as "something breaks open". It is not obvious to me whether any of $k_2$ (portal destination), $p_2$ (pieces of broken thing), $j_3$ (birthdate), or $j_4$ (birthplace) are appropriate to include in this lujvo.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is a vowel sound.

$x_{1}$ (tool/blade/force) cuts [through]/splits/divides $x_{2}$ (object) into pieces $x_{3}$.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a cathode/negative electrode.

$x_{1}$ captures/catches/apprehends/seizes/nabs $x_{2}$ with trap/restraint $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Catch something thrown (= {rerkavbu}). See also {jersi}, {kalte}, {pinfu}, {sisku}, se {rinju}.

valsi.definition: start grouping of tanru, etc; ... type of ... ; overrides normal tanru left grouping.
pro-sumti: relativized sumti (object of relative clause).
elidable terminator: end of tanru left grouping override (usually elidable).
open interval bracket marker; modifies intervals in non-logical connectives; exclude boundaries.
vocative: please repeat.
discursive: repeating - continuing.
discursive: repeating - continuing.
$x_1$ repeats $x_2$ (sedu'u/text) to audience $x_3$ via expressive medium $x_4$ for the $x_5$th time.

elidable terminator: end abstraction bridi (often elidable).
$x_1=d_1=k_1$ wants to play with plaything $x_2=d_2=k_2$ for purpose $x_3=d_3$.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ degree(s) Kelvin [metric unit] in temperature (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ degrees Fahrenheit in temperature by standard $x_{3}$.

$x_1$ is Cornish in aspect $x_2$
$x_1$ is a kernel/nucleus/'nut' of $x_2$; $x_1$ is central
$n_1=b_1$ is an eardrum (tympanic membrane) of $n_2=k_2$.
valsi.notes: The tympanic membrane separates the external ear from the middle ear. Cf. {kerlo}, {tirna}, {sance}.

valsi.definition: $b_1=s_1$ is a temporal bone (os temporale) performing function $b_2$ in body of $b_3$.
$x_1$ is an earphone/headphone

$x_1$ is astronomy based on methodology $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ reflects South American culture/nationality/geography in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ has a body mass index of $x_2$ by standard $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a cavity/hole/hollow/cavern in $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is concave within $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is hollow at locus $x_{1}$.
valsi.notes: Also pit, depression, concavity; hollow (= {selke'a}). See also {fenra}, {kunti}, {canlu}, {canko}, {galxe}, {tubnu}.

valsi.definition: $ci_1=cu_1$ is a woodpecker/wryneck/piculet/sapsucker of species $ci_2$

$k_1=z_1$ is a cave for housing $x_2=z_2$, located in $x_3=k_2$.
tense/modal: set/use tense default; establishes new open scope space/time/modal reference base.
attitudinal question: confusion about something said.
Converts following cmevla or zoi-quote into a nonce interjection/attitudinal.
non-question: understanding of something said.
$z_1=k_1$ applauds/acclaims/praises loudly action $z_2$ (object/event) with sound $k_2$.
$c_1=k_1$ shouts/cries out $c_2=k_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) to audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$
vocative: thanks - no thanks to you.
vocative: thanks - no thanks to you.
ckini modal, 1st place (related to) relatively; as a relation of ...
digit/number: number comma; thousands.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ kilograms in mass by standard $g_3$.
$x_1$ is $x_2$ kilometres long in direction $x_3$ by standard $x_4$.
krinu modal, 1st place (justified by) justifiably; because of reason ...
sumti question asking for a rational explanation/justification; why?.
krinu modal, 1st place despite reason ...
$d_1$ uploads $d_2$ to $d_3=k_1$.
$x_1$ sends spam (e-)mail $x_2$ to recipient [address] $x_3$ from mailbox address $x_4$ by network/system $x_5$
$x_1$ pertains to the internet/cyberspace in aspect $x_2$.
valsi.notes: Proposed by xorxes. Short rafsi -kib-. Cf. {mujysamseltcana}.

valsi.definition: $c_1$ is a web browser for retrieving/presenting/traversing information $k_1$.
$c_1$ downloads $c_2$ from $c_3=k_1$.
$ki_1=ka_1$ is an internet-journal/web-article/blog (web-log) with content $ka_2$ published by $ka_3$ for audience $ka_4$
$p_1$ is a web page of site $p_2=k_1$.
$x_{1}$ cushions $x_{2}$ with material $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a cushion/pillow/pad [for $x_{2}$] of padding material $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of oxygen (O); [metaphor: supporting life/combustion].
$c_1$ lacks oxygen $k_1$; $c_1$ is anaerobic.
$s_3$ [recipient] is insufficiently/deficiently supplied with oxygen from $s_1$ [source], insufficiently by standard $d_3$.

$x_1=xa_1=g_1=k_1$ is a lance/spear/javelin/pointed-rod weapon for use against $x_2=xa_2$ by $x_3=xa_3$ of material $x_4=g_2$.
valsi.notes: {kinli} {grana} {xarci}; this lujvo structure is from {noralujv}. The author of this definition is uncertain that {jesxa'i} would not be a better lujvo for the purpose.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a thousand [1000; $10^3$] of $x_{2}$ in dimension/aspect $x_{3}$ (default is units).
$x_1$ is kinda like $x_2$ in property $x_3$
valsi.notes: This is a joke word. Its main use is in the tanru {kinda} {sorta}

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a kinkajou (Potos flavus) of species/subspecies $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is sharp/keen at locus $x_{2}$.

valsi.notes: The $x_2$ place always describes an episode, but can therefore be used transitively to describe the series $x_5$. This is not necessarily a television series and can refer to an episodic film series as well.

valsi.definition: $p_1=s_3=s_4$ thinks about subject $p_2=s_2$ by imagining $s_1$ which is like an imaginary movie about that subject.
$x_1=s_1$ is a frame from motion picture $x_2=k_1$ about $x_3=k_2$ [plot/theme/subject/activity]
valsi.notes: (skina x3, x4 omitted for lack of usefulness). See also {skina} for some useful lujvo you can tanru-ize this with -- e.g. "selxraci'a skina" -> 'frame of drawn animation', {selci}

valsi.definition: $x_1=z_1$ watches movie/film/audio-video $x_2=z_2=s_1$ about subject $x_3=s_2$ by filmmaker $x_4=s_3$ intended for audience $x_5=s_4$ by sensory means $x_6=z_3$ under conditions $x_7=z_4$
valsi.notes: {velskina} is less appropriate because it isn't true that the entire intended audience of a film will watch it, not to mention that it is possible to watch films of which one is not a part of the intended audience. See also {skina}, {zgana}.

valsi.definition: $r_1$ is measured in pakistani rupee (₨; PKR) as $r_2$ (quantity), in the Algerian monetary system $r_3$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Pakistani/Pashto culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.

$k_1=g_1$ is Pakistan.
valsi.notes: Cf. {kisto}, {gugde}, {gugdepuku}. The 'national' language of Pakistan is {xurbau}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is pottery made by $x_2$ of clay $x_3$.
$b_1$ is a clay-based building brick of composition $k_2$, surfaces/sides $s_4$.
$x_1$ is a potter who makes $x_2$ out of clay $x_3$.
$c_1$ calls/summons $c_3=k_1$ to location $k_2$ in manner/form $c_4$.
$x_1$ leads/guides $x_2$ to $x_3$ from $x_4$ via route $x_5$
$j_1=k_1$ follows $j_2$ to destination $k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$ by means $k_5$.
$x_{1}$ is a street/avenue/lane/drive/cul-de-sac/way/alley/[road] at $x_{2}$ accessing $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also corridor; not typically a route between points, but offers access to sites along it. See also {naxle}, {panka}, {pluta}, {dargu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ weeps/cries tears $x_{2}$ about/for reason $x_{3}$ (event/state).
$x_{1}$ comes/goes to destination $x_{2}$ from origin $x_{3}$ via route $x_{4}$ using means/vehicle $x_{5}$.
valsi.notes: Also travels, journeys, moves, leaves to ... from ...; $x_1$ is a traveller; ($x_4$ as a set includes points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly). See also {cadzu}, {bajra}, {marce}, {vofli}, {litru}, {muvdu}, {cpare}, cmavo list {ka'a}, {pluta}, {bevri}, {farlu}, {limna}, {vitke}.

valsi.definition: $m_1$ summons $m_2=k_1$ to $k_2$ from $k_3$ via route $k_4$.
$x_1=k_1=m_1$ arrives at $x_2=k_2$ from $x_3=k_3$ by route $x_4=k_4$ with transportation means $x_5=k_5$ by completion standard $x_6=m_3$
$x_{1}$ is a quantity quantified/measured/enumerated by $x_{2}$ (quantifier) on scale $x_{3}$ (si'o).
valsi.notes: Also count. See also cmavo list {la'u}, {namcu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ measures $x_2$ bels on scale $x_3$ (si'o).
valsi.notes: One bel is equal to 10 decibels. Cf. {klani}, {sance}, {cladu}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ is $g_2$ joule(s) of energy (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ farad(s) of capacitance (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ newton (s) of force (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ pascal(s) of pressure (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ tesla(s) of magnetic field B (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ volt(s) of electromotive force (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ henry/henries of inductance (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ hertz of frequency (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ ohm(s) of electrical impedance/resistance (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ watt(s) of power (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.
$g_1$ is $g_2$ siemens of electrical conductance (default is 1) by standard $g_3$.
$p_1$ is a track on $p_2$

valsi.notes: Used to specify agentive operation of the transportation vehicle, as opposed to simply being carried by it. See also {sazri}, {klama}, {ma'ekla}

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is blackseed/nigella of species/variety $x_2$
$x_{1}$ (mass/si'o) is a class/category/subgroup/subset within $x_{2}$ with defining property $x_{3}$ (ka).
valsi.notes: Also taxon, type, kind, classification, species, genus, family, order, phylum. See also cmavo list {le'a}, {cmima}, {jutsi}, {ciste}, {girzu}, {lanzu}, {vrici}.

valsi.definition: $k_1$ is a domain (biology) [taxonomic rank] within Tree of Life $k_2$ with defining property $k_3$ (ka)
$k_1$ is a kingdom (biology) [taxonomic rank] within domain $k_2$ with defining property $k_3$ (ka)

valsi.notes: See also {cinse}, {fetsi}, {nakni}, {nanla}, {nanmu}, {ninmu}, {nixli}. x4 could be gender identity, gender presentation, social role, legal sex, chromosomal sex, anatomical sex, etc.

valsi.definition: $k_1$ is a phylum (biology) [taxonomic rank] within kingdom $k_2$ with defining property $k_3$ (ka).
$k_1$ is a class (biology) [taxonomic rank] within phylum $k_2$ with defining property $k_3$ (ka)
$x_{1}$ (object/medium) is clear/transparent/without obstacle to in-the-clear $x_{2}$ [transmission].
valsi.notes: Also lucid; $x_2$ remains apparent/lucid/clear (figurative use for 'understandable' is discouraged, better expressed as = {filseljmi} or {filsmu}). (cf. {kandi}, {zunti} - {nalzu'i} is better for 'unhindered')

valsi.definition: $k_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of astatine (At).

$k_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of fluorine (Fl).

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of a clear/transparent carbonated beverage/soda of sweet flavor, of brand $x_2$.
valsi.notes: Not any carbonated beverage, but one which is transparent and with sweet flavor, like Sprite (=sprait), 7-up, Sockerdricka (=a soft drink that is consumed in Sweden) or similar. Another flavor may be added and expressed as a tanru, as long as the combination doesn't differ too much from the characteristics of klisodva.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of clay [moist, clammy dirt] of composition including $x_{2}$.

$s1$ pertains to culture of $s2=k2$
valsi.notes: Cultural gismu replacement lujvo for cultures: From gismu {kulnu} and {srana}

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is social anthropology.

pro-sumti: you (imperative); make it true for you, the listener.
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #1 (specified by goi).

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a coyote of subspecies/breed $x_2$.

valsi.definition: Coca-Cola.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is a crow/raven of species $s_2$.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is the duration of $x_2$.
$gas_1$ resets/changes $gal_1$ to its original value/content.
Chrysler

valsi.notes: Normative principles, variously construed as legal, social, or moral freedoms or entitlements. {rarkrali} for "natural rights and {flakrali} for "legal rights"; {xuskrali} for "claim rights" and {zifkrali} for "liberty rights"; {crukrali} for "positive rights" and {ri'urkrali} for "negative rights"; {sepkrali} for "individual rights" and {gumkrali} for "group rights"; {selcemkrali} for "civil rights" and {seljeckrali} for "political rights"; {jiknykrali} for "economic rights", {jikykrali} for "social rights", and {klukrali} for "cultural rights"; {remkrali} for "human rights" and {dalkrali} for "animal rights". Cf. {selfla}, {selzi'e}, {terzi'e}, {selzau}, {selpikta}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a starfruit/carambola of variety $x_2$.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (site/event) is a source/start/beginning/origin of $x_{2}$ (object/event/process).

valsi.definition: $b_1$ is wig/toupee/mirkin worn by $k_2$ on body location $k_3$.

$x_{1}$ (event/state) is a reason/justification/explanation for/causing/permitting $x_{2}$ (event/state).

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a clove bud/tree of species/variety $x_2$.

valsi.definition: elidable terminator: end description, modal, or negator sumti; often elidable.

valsi.definition: elidable terminator: end NOI relative clause; always elidable, but preferred in complex clauses.

valsi.notes: Across -> {pinta}, down -> {sraji}, crossword puzzle -> "kucyvla se {namkei}". Example: "12 across: what you like -> beautiful" is "zo melbi cu kucyvla lu da poi do nelci li'u li pare poi pinta". $x_1$ may be a non grammatical quotation.

valsi.notes: It is a frame worn in front of the eyes and bears or does not bear transparent/semi-transparent/non-transparent shields for visual correction, eye protection, fashion, or entertainment. The shields are not necessarily lenses. Cf. {le'otci} or {le'orlacni} for a corrective type, which may include {tidlacni} for reading glasses and {xrelacni} for bifocal and trifocal glasses; {badlacni} for a protective type, which may include {srulacni} for goggles and {solylacni} for sunglasses; {jadlacni} for fashion glasses, which may include {rekmeclacni} for rimless glasses and solylacni; {mincimdylacni} for 3D glasses.

valsi.definition: $c_{1}$ (quoted word(s)) is a street/road name/odonym of street/avenue/lane/drive/cul-de-sac/way/alley/[road] $c_{2}$=$l_{1}$ to/used-by namer/name-user $c_{3}$ (person).
valsi.notes: s2 and s3 are omitted. A street name or odonym is an identifying name given to a street. The street name usually forms part of the address (though addresses in some parts of the world make no reference to street names).See also {stucme}, {klaji}, {stuzi}, {cmene}.

description: marks description extracting the time tense place of the description bridi.

description: marks description extracting the location place of the description bridi.

klesi modal, 1st place (scalar set) in/of category ...
replace recent mistakenly uttered text
valsi.notes: The {lo'ai} ... {sa'ai} ... {le'ai} replacement construct asks the listener to replace the text after {lo'ai} with the text after {sa'ai}. The order {sa'ai} ... {lo'ai} ... {le'ai} is also allowed, and either or both parts can be omitted and thus left up to context. When both parts are omitted, the word {le'ai} on its own indicates that a mistake was made while leaving all the details up to context. It is also possible to attach SAI to a le'ai construct: le'ai {dai} (or le'ai {da'oi} ko'a) indicates that someone else made a mistake; le'ai {pei} asks whether someone else made a mistake; and {sai}, {ru'e} and {cu'i} can be used to indicate the importance of the substitution. Furthermore, le'ai {nai} can be used to explicitly deny mistakes instead of acknowledging them (compare "sic").

valsi.definition: $v_1$ is a loanword meaning $v_2$ in language $v_3$ based on foreign-language word $l_2$.
valsi.notes: Old, deprecated synonym for {fu'ivla}. Could be considered an {u'ivla}.

valsi.definition: $xr_1=l_1$ takes back $xr_2=l_2$ from $xr_4=l_3$.
non-veridical descriptor: the stereotype of those described as ...
non-veridical descriptor: the set of those described as ..., treated as a set.
$pi_1=pl_1$ employs $pi_2=pl_3$ for a payment/compensation/salary/wage/reward of $pl_2$ for the provision of goods/services $pi_3=pl_4$.
attitudinal modifier: aggressive - passive - defensive.
attitudinal modifier: aggressive - passive - defensive.
attitudinal modifier: aggressive - passive - defensive.
$t_1$ is a monocle/pair of (eye)glasses/spectacles for observational activity $t_2$.
end quote of questionable or out-of-context text; not elidable.
$x_{1}$ takes/gets/gains/obtains/seizes/[removes] $x_{2}$ (object/property) from $x_{3}$ (possessor).
valsi.notes: Also confiscate, appropriate. Acquire with volition such that $x_1$ gains possession; $x_3$ is possessor and not merely source, alienation is implied. (cf. {punji}, {cpacu} where volition or previous possession is not necessarily implied, {vimcu} for alienation where $x_1$ need not gain possession, {canci}, {cliva})

valsi.definition: $d_1$ is a/the wisdom tooth of $d_2$
$d_1=l_1$ is the afternoon of day $d_2$ at location $d_3$.
$g_1$ is a mushroom of species $g_2$.
possessive/associative descriptor: the one(s) described as, of yours.
non-veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) described as ...
$s_1$ is the taxonomy of $s_2=k_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
valsi.notes: x2 may be subjects of biology, semantics, economics, military science, safety science, etc. Cf. {jutske}, {klesi}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=p_1$ bribes $x_3=p_3$ with $x_2=p_2$ into doing $x_4=p_4$.
$c_1=x_1$ is a quantity of white/light/(regular) coffee with cold dairy [or similar] product/creamer/whitener $la_1=le_1$, addition cold by standard $le_2$.
valsi.notes: See also: coffee with milk (={ladyckafi}), cream (={ladykruji}), soy milk (={sobjau}).

valsi.definition: $m_1$ is a fridge/air conditioner for cooling $x_2=l_1$.
possessive/associative descriptor: the one(s) described as, of it-1's.
$x_1$ is an electron in quantum state $x_2$
$t_1=l_1$ is tundra at location $t_2$, cold by standard $l_2$
$x_1$ is a lily [Lilium] of species/strain $x_2$
possessive/associative descriptor: the one(s) described as, of mine.
$x_{1}$ is a lens/glass [focussing shape/form] focussing $x_{2}$ to focus/foci $x_{3}$ by means/material $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: (adjective:) $x_1$ is optical; focussing may be optical or otherwise, hence $x_2$ which may be light, sound, X-ray, etc., default is light/optical lens; ka is refraction. See also {kacma}, {minra}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is cold/cool by standard $x_{2}$.
specific event descriptor: contraction of {le nu} and identical in meaning.
valsi.notes: Added because beginners often search for {lenu} without realizing that it is the same as {le} {nu} and getting confused.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ makes a typo, typing/writing letter $l_1=b_1$ in place of $l_1=b_2$ in word $b_3$ by standard $s_4$
valsi.notes: The standard place covers cases of different spelling conventions in other languages and possibly other dialects of Lojban. For example, 'colour' is a typo is American English, but correct in British English.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (event) is late by standard $x_{2}$.
$ca_1$ is a keyboard for entering letters/symbols $l_1=cu_2$.
$x_{1}$ (la'e zo BY/word-bu) is a letter/digit/symbol in alphabet/character-set $x_{2}$ representing $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also $x_1$ glyph, rune, character (also me'o BY/word-bu), $x_2$ symbol set; (adjective:) $x_1$ is alphabetic/symbolic; "letteral" used by analogy with "numeral"; sinxa is the more generic symbol. See also {mifra}, {namcu}, {sinxa}, {pandi}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a jamo in syllable $x_2$ in writing system $x_3$ (default Hangul)
$l_1$ (quoted letteral) is the first letter of the word $v_1$.
valsi.notes: Only a single letter(al) is allowed for $l_1$. Both the letteral and the word must be quoted. See also: {lerfu}, {pa}, {moi}, {valsi}, {leryrolmoivla}.

valsi.definition: $s_1=p_1$ is a line in the text $s_2$.
$t_2$ is a text in medium $t_3$ with character set $l_2$.
$m_3$ is a character encoding for bytes $m_2$ with symbols/font $m_1$.
$l_1$ (quoted letteral) is the last letter of the word $v_1$.
valsi.notes: Only a single letter(al) is allowed for $l_1$. Both the letteral and the word must be quoted. See also: {lerfu}, {ro}, {moi}, {valsi}, {lerpavmoivla}.

valsi.definition: possessive/associative descriptor: nearby demonstrative possessive; cannot use for 'THAT ...'.
possessive/associative descriptor: immediate demonstrative possessive; cannot use for 'THIS ...'.
possessive/associative descriptor: distant demonstrative possessive.
located descriptor: descriptive that-there (non-demonstrative).
located descriptor: descriptive this-here (non-demonstrative).
located descriptor: descriptive that-yonder (non-demonstrative).
the number/evaluated expression; convert number/operand/evaluated math expression to sumti.
discursive: clearly - obscurely.
unevaluated mekso as name.
valsi.notes: Where "la broda brode" is to "la'e lu broda brode" as "li'ai by cy" is to "la'e me'o by cy". See also {li}, {me'o}, {la}, {la'e}.

valsi.definition: discursive: clearly - obscurely.
$v_1$ is an exit out of $c_2$.
lidne modal, 1st place preceded by ...; non-time sequencing.
$li_1=la_1$ immediately precedes $li_2=la_2$ in sequence $li_3=la_3$.
abstractor: experience abstractor; $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$'s experience of [bridi] (participant or observer).
discursive: omitted text (quoted material).
$x_1$ is fluorine.
$s_1$ is a fluoride of $s_3$.
$t_1$ is a fluoride of $t_3$.
elidable terminator: end grammatical quotation; seldom elidable except at end of text.
$x_{1}$ reflects Libyan culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$r_1$ is measured in libyan dinar (دينارLYD) as $r_2$ (quantity), in the Libyan monetary system $r_3$.
$x_{1}$ precedes/leads $x_{2}$ in sequence $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is former/preceding/previous; $x_{2}$ is latter/following.
valsi.notes: Also $x_1$ before, forerunner; leading, as in 'leading indicators'; $x_2$ after, trailing (= {selyli'e} for reordered places). See also cmavo list {li'e}, {balvi}, {ralju}, {rebla}, {purci} for time sequence, {jersi}, {porsi}, {jatna}, {farna}.

valsi.definition: $t_1=v_1$ is a thunderstorm at place/region $t_2$
$s_1$ is thunderous to $s_2$.
Lithuania.

valsi.notes: Also has/have (of events/experiences); (adjective:) $x_1$ is empirical; suggests passive undergoing but does not exclude active (per zukte) intent; a deserved experience: reward or punishment (= {jernyfri}, {zanjernyfri}, {maljernyfri}). See also cmavo list {ri'i}, {jmive}, {fasnu}, {renvi}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=f_1=s_2$ sublimates/evaporates from the solid state at temperature $x_2=f_2=s_3$ with vapor pressure $x_3=f_3$.
valsi.notes: From {sligu} {febvi}; refers to a state change from solid to gas or vice versa, at the solid surface.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a religion of believers including $x_{2}$ sharing common beliefs/practices/tenets including $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also mythos, creed, traditional beliefs, $x_2$ people(s), adherents; (adjective:) $x_1$, $x_2$, $x_3$ are religious/ecclesiastic in nature; $x_2$ is a believer in/of $x_1$, an adherent/follower of $x_1$ (= {seljda} for reordered places); $x_2$ is a practitioner of $x_3$ (= {selterjda} for reordered places); $x_3$ is a tenet/belief/ritual/creed of $x_1$/$x_2$ (= {terjda} for reordered places); priest/clerical (= {jdaca'i}, {jdaka'i}, {jdaja'a}); organized church/religion (= {be'ejda}); congregation (= {jdabe'e}, {jdagri}). See also {budjo}, {censa}, {cevni}, {crida}, {dadjo}, {jegvo}, {krici}, {latna}, {malsi}, {marde}, {muslo}, {pruxi}, {ranmi}, {ritli}, {xriso}, {zekri}.

valsi.notes: Lines are 1D, so clani2 is derived. Cf. {lutnilcla}

valsi.definition: $x_1=p_1$ (agent) anoints/rubs/greases/pours onto/applies/lubricate/baptises $x_3=p_3$ with liquid/semi-liquid/oil/cream/ointment $x_2=p_2=l_1$.

Lindar Kelleigh Greenwood
valsi.notes: First name Lojbanised. A member of the Lojban central community.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ measures $x_2$ lindars in social context $x_3$.
valsi.notes: The lindar is a measure of social inappropriatenes. One Lindar roughly equals the average social inappropriateness of {lindar} (a Lojban central community member). One centiLindar = Mentally laughing at something childish / lavatoriously humorous. Five centiLindars = Chuckling out loud at something when it isn't appropriate (i.e. "I'll be working under you for the duration of this project."). One Lindar = Doing something completely socially inappropriate. One and a half lds. = Being offensive enough to get in trouble and / or get reprimanded. Two lds. = Sufficient to get punched in the face on the spot. Three lds. = Sufficient to get stabbed. Four lds. = Sufficient to be a target of assassination.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is lightning/electrical arc/thunderbolt striking at/extending to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is a nunchaku.
valsi.notes: A Japanese weapon consisting of two wooden sticks connected by a chain; also spelled ``nunchuku''

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a line/among lines [1-dimensional shape/form] defined by set of points $x_{2}$.

$x_{1}$ is a length of chain/links of material $x_{2}$ with link properties $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is light in mass/weight by standard $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: (cf. junta, tilju; se xalbo, kandi for metaphor)

valsi.definition: $g_1$ is Old English/pertains to Old English-speaking culture in aspect $g_2$, early by standard $x_3=c_2$.

$c_1=t_1$ is the earliest among set / range $t_4$.
$lr_1=xa_1$ is / are the earliest person(s) to dwell/live/reside/abide at/inhabit/be a resident of location/habitat/nest/home/abode $xa_2$ among set / range $lr_2$.
$n_1$ is in character (actions or speech to be interpreted as part of a story/role-playing game)
$n_1$ is a drafting by author $l_3=t_1$ of story $l_1=t_2$ using method $t_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a story/tale/yarn/narrative about plot/subject/moral $x_{2}$ by storyteller $x_{3}$ to audience $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also legend; a narrative need not be fictional; $x_2$ may be merely a convention rather than a subject; also $x_3$ tells/recounts story/tale $x_1$ about $x_2$ to $x_4$ (= {selterlisri} for place reordering); note that the storyteller need not be the author. See also {ranmi}, {cfika}, {skicu}, {prosa}, {pemci}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (physical object) is a list/catalog/register of sequence/set $x_{2}$ in order $x_{3}$ in medium $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also roll, log. ($x_2$ is completely specified); (cf. {porsi}, {girzu}, {cmima} for mental objects wherein order is of varying importance; some manifested order is intrinsic to a physical list, but the specific order may be incidental and not intentional/purposeful)

valsi.definition: $x_1=p_1$ is a comic strip about plot/subject/moral $x_2=l_2$ illustrated by $x_3=p_3$ with story written by $x_4=l_3$.
$b_1$ is out of character (actions or speech not to be interpreted as part of a story/role-playing game)

$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ liter(s) [metric unit] in volume (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$cr_1$ is a dress shirt of material $cr_2$, potentially formal by standard $cl_3$.
valsi.notes: A shirt with a collar, a full-length opening at the front from the collar to the hem, and sleeves with cuffs; normally made from woven cloth, and are often accompanied by a jacket and tie, for example with a suit or formalwear, but can be worn also more casually without. Cf. {creka}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is liquid/fluid, of composition/material including $x_{2}$, under conditions $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Conditions include temperature and pressure. See also {cilmo}, {djacu}, {lumci}, {runta}, {pambe}, {sudga}, {gapci}, {sligu}, {flecu}, {jduli}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ travels/journeys/goes/moves via route $x_{2}$ using means/vehicle $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a traveller.
valsi.notes: ($x_2$ as a set includes points at least sufficient to constrain the route relevantly); See also {bajra}, {cadzu}, {cpare}, {tcana}, {klama}, {cliva}, {pluta}, {limna}, {muvdu}.

valsi.definition: $xe_1=c_1$ is gracious to $xe_2$ in matter $xe_3=c_2$.

$x_1$ is a lynx (Felis lynx)
$b_1$ expels $c_1$ from $c_2$; $b_1$ throws $c_1$ out of $c_2$.

valsi.definition: shift letterals to Lojban (Roman) alphabet.
start quote of recent mistakenly uttered text to be replaced

veridical descriptor: the set of those that really are ..., treated as a set.

$x_{1}$ [rules/methods] is a logic for deducing/concluding/inferring/reasoning to/about $x_{2}$ (du'u).
$x_1$ pertains to Loglan language/culture in aspect $x_2$
Loglan-worker.
veridical descriptor: the mass of individual(s) that is(are) ...
$b_1$ is a broom for purpose $b_2$ (event) with bristles $b_3$.
$l_1=s_1$ undergoes an earthquake/an event of the ground shaking of magnitude $x_2$.
valsi.notes: not necessarily earthquake, could be due to bomb explosion etc. too.

valsi.definition: Bob LeChevalier.
valsi.notes: Bob LeChevalier is one of the Original Lojbanists.

valsi.definition: Lojban.
$b_1$ is the loglan/Loglan/logic language used by community $b_2$ to express ideas $b_3$.
$x_{1}$ reflects [Loglandic]/Lojbanic language/culture/nationality/community in aspect $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Pre-Lojban forms of Loglan (= {dzejbo}). See also {bangu}, {logji}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ infers/concludes/draws conclusion $x_2$ from premise $x_3$ based on logic/reasoning $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ is a floor/bottom/ground of $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Floor/level/story of a building/edifice (= {setloi}, {dijysenta}). See also {bitmu}, {drudi}, {dertu}, {dizlo}, {cnita}, {zbepi}, {sarji}, {serti}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ is floor covering/flooring/carpet/rug for covering floor $g_2=l_1$ of $x_3=l_2$.

event descriptor: contraction of {lo nu} and identical in meaning.
valsi.notes: Added because beginners often search for {lonu} without realizing that it is the same as {lo} {nu} and getting confused.

Los Angeles
start grammatical quotation; quoted text should be grammatical on its own.
the members of the set/components of the mass; converts another description type to individuals.
Bridi to text conversion
valsi.notes: Essentially equivalent to {se} in the context of a {se} {du'u}. Inverse of {du'au}; however note that this is not single-valued, while {du'au} (provided context) is single-valued. Hence "lu'au du'au" is a useful idiom for constructing a text which has the same basic meaning as another text but is not necessarily the same text.

valsi.definition: the symbol for (indirect discourse); uses the symbol/word(s) for a sumti as the desired sumti.
the set with members; converts another description type to a set of the members.
the mass composed of; converts another description type to a mass composed of the members.
$r_1$ is measured in lebanese pound (L£; LBP) as $r_2$ (quantity), in the Lebanese monetary system $r_3$.

$x_1$ is a Lebanon cedar/Cedar of Lebanon (Cedrus libani subsp. libani) of strain $x_2$ with cones $x_3$.
elidable terminator: end of sumti qualifiers; usually elidable except before a sumti.
$x_{1}$ reflects Lebanese culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a complex number.
$x_1=c_1$ (person) justifies/expresses justification $x_2=k_2$ for $x_3=p_1$'s complicated-ness in aspect $x_4=p_2$ to audience $x_5=c_3$ via expressive medium $x_6=c_4$.
$x_{1}$ (text) is a compound predicate word with meaning $x_{2}$ and arguments $x_{3}$ built from metaphor $x_{4}$.
$x_1=k_1$ (abstract) justifies $x_2=p_1$'s complicated-ness in aspect $x_3=p_2$.
$x_1$ is an earthworm of species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) washes/cleanses $x_{2}$ of soil/contaminant $x_{3}$ in/with cleaning material(s) $x_{4}$.
$x_1=k_1$ is a bathroom, in which $x_2=l_1$ washes $x_3=l_2$ (self/other(s)/body part), in home/building/structure $x_4=k_2$ surrounded by partitions/walls/ceiling/floor $x_5=k_3$ (mass/jo'u)
valsi.notes: A room with a sink technically qualifies, but this is more like a room with a bath or shower as well. What most Americans call a "bathroom". For a room specifically for urination or defecation, see {vimku'a}.

valsi.definition: $p_1$ is a wash tub/bath tub, for $l_1$ to wash $p_2=l_2$, made of material $p_3$.
$t_1$ is a sink, for $l_1$ to wash $t_2=l_2$, made of material $t_3$
$x_{1}$ is bare/naked/nude; $x_{1}$ is without cover/clothes/[protection].
$x_1$ is Aries [astronomical constellation/astrological sign].
valsi.notes: From lanme (=sheep/[lamb/ewe/ram];lojban) and lu (=sheep;sumerogram). This constellation has been known as the ram/sheep since babylonian times, and later become the leading sign of the zodiac (7th century BCE). In Hellenistic astrology, the constellation of Aries is associated with the golden ram of Greek mythology that rescued Phrixos.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is Earth's moon (default); $x_{1}$ is a major natural satellite/moon of planet $x_{2}$.

valsi.notes: Paths are 1D, so clani2 is derived. Cf. {lijnilcla}

valsi.definition: $c_1=b_1=k_1$ is a jumper of material $c_2$.

London

marji modal, 1st place material in object/substance ...
