valsi.definition: $t_2$ is the angle/arctangent of tangent $t_1$.
$x_{1}$ is pregnant with embryo $x_{2}$ from father $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is the modifying part of binary metaphor $x_2$ with modified part/modificand $x_3$ giving meaning $x_4$ in usage/instance $x_5$
valsi.notes: In both English and Lojban, the word {seltau} is the usual way to refer to the left word in a tanru, whereas {tertau} refers to the right word in the tanru.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ boxes $t_2$ inside $t_1$.
$t_2$ is a network/transport/communication/distribution system with nodes/stations including $t_1$.
$x_1=t_2$ is the purpose of tool/utensil/resource/instrument/implement $x_2=t_1$.
$x_{1}$ is needed by $x_{2}$ for purpose $x_{3}$.
$t_2$ (event) frightens/scares/is feared by $t_1$.
$b_1=t_2$ is huge/enormous/tremendous in property $b_2$ and feared by $b_3=t_1$.
$x_1$ is/are the only one(s) with property $x_2$ among $x_3$.
$x_1$ locks/seals $x_2$ with lock/seal $x_3$ with locking mechanism $x_4$
$x_1$ is an $x_3$rd root of $x_2$.
$m_1=t_2$ is fearsome/terrifying/horrifying to t1
$x_1$ is a lujvo using ridiculous SE-string $x_2$, irritating $x_3$, authored by crazy (probably xorxo) lojbanist $x_4$
$f_1=s_2$ is a bill specifying $f_2$ (state/event) for community $f_3$ under conditions $f_4$, proposed/drafted by $s_1$.
$x_1$ is inaudible to $x_2$ against background/under conditions $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a program televised by $x_{2}$ via channel $x_{3}$ to television/receiver $x_{4}$.
$t_2$ (load/force/torque) twists/causes torsion in $t_1$.
$t_2$ (NU) is the conduct behaved by agent $t_1$ under condition $t_3$.
$x_{1}$ is sat on by $x_{2}$.
$x_2=v_1$ (object/event) is important/significant to $x_1=v_2$ (person/event) in aspect/for reason $x_3=v_3$ (nu/ka).
$x_{1}$ is a source fruit of wine $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is sold by $x_{2}$ to $x_{3}$ for price $x_{4}$.
$s_1$ is a/the sales inventory of goods $s_2=v_2$ sold by $v_1$ to $v_3$.
$x_{1}$ is seen by $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is invisible to $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a means of flight used by $x_{2}$.
$xa_2$ is a habitat/nest/home/abode with dweller/resident/inhabitant $xa_1$.
$x_1$ is a reed of/for wind instrument $x_2$.
$x_1=xr_2$ is injured/harmed/damaged by event $x_2=xr_1$ in property $x_3=xr_3$ (ka) with injury $x_4=xr_4$.
$x_2$ worries $x_1$ under condition $x_3$.
$xa_2$ imagines $xa_1$.
$k_1=x_2$ pretends $x_1$[concept]
$xa_2=p_1$ is the imagination of $p_2$.
$x_{1}$ [benefits from]/[is a beneficiary of] $x_{2}$ (object/event) according to standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is hated by $x_{2}$.
$x_1=g_1$ mixes ingredients/components $x_2=m_2$ into mixture/mix $x_3=m_1$.
$j_1$ (text) is a declarative sentence in which proposition $j_2=x_2$ (du'u) asserts/claims/declares to be true by $x_1$ in language $j_3$.
$l_2=k_1$ is trustworthy for $l_1$ to bring about/ensure/maintain $l_3$ under conditions $k_3$
$l_2$ is an alphabet/character set containing letter $l_1$ representing $l_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a standard of lateness for $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is left behind by $x_2$, that leaves by route $x_3$.
$l_2$ follows $l_1$ in sequence $l_3$.
$c_1=z_2$ is laudable to observer $z_1$.
$m_1=z_2$ is popular among mass $m_2=z_1$.
$x_1$ is amused with $x_2$ due to amusing property $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ produces/performs music $x_{2}$.
$z_2$ (event/state) is done freely by $z_1$ under conditions $z_3$.
$x_2$ is the longest direction of $x_1$.
valsi.notes: Does not however assert that the x1 is long in that direction.

valsi.definition: marji modal, 2nd place made of material/composition ...
manri modal, 2nd place (of reference) as a reference standard for observing ...
zmadu modal, 2nd place (relative!) more than ...; usually a sumti modifier.
zmadu modal, 2nd place (relative!) not more than ...; usually a sumti modifier.
mleca modal, 2nd place (relative!) less than ...; usually a sumti modifier.
mleca modal, 2nd place (relative!) not less than ...; usually a sumti modifier.
cmene modal, 2nd place (the named one) as a name for ...
$x_{1}$ reflects Semitic [metaphor: Middle-Eastern] language/culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Semitic includes Arabic, Hebrew, Aramaic, and Ethiopian, among others. See also {xrabo}.

valsi.definition: mukti modal, 2nd place motive therefore ...; motivating action ...
mukti modal, 2nd place motive nevertheless ...
mupli modal, 2nd place as an example of property ...
$x_{1}$ sneezes (intransitive verb).
nibli modal, 2nd place entails therefore ...
nibli modal, 2nd place entails nevertheless ...
$x_1=k_1$ justifies $x_2=s_1$'s doubt/skepticism toward $x_3=s_2$ (du'u).
$x_{1}$ doubts/is dubious/doubtful/skeptical/questions that $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_2$ is doubtful/dubious/questionable (= {selsenpi} for reordered places). See also {jinvi}, {krici}, {djuno}, {birti}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a layer/stratum [shape/form] of $x_{2}$ [material] within structure/continuum/composite $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ dreams about/that $x_{2}$ (fact/idea/event/state); $x_{2}$ is a dream/reverie of $x_{1}$.
panra modal, 2nd place similarly; similar to ...
pagbu modal, 2nd place (whole) partially; as a part of ...
$s_1$ is immediately next to $x_2$.
pilno modal, 2nd place (instrumental) tool/machine/apparatus/acting entity; using (tool) ...
$x_{1}$ is apart/separate from $x_{2}$, separated by partition/wall/gap/interval/separating medium $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also aloof (= {jiksei}); alone (= {rolsmisei} meaning apart or unlike all others of its kind; {pavysei}, {seirpavmei} meaning "only" or "one alone" - do not use when talking about, for example, two people who are alone); $x_3$ space. See also {bitmu}, {snuji}, {senta}, {fendi}, {curve}, {jinsa}, {bitmu}, {marbi}.

valsi.definition: porsi modal, 2nd place sequentially; sequenced by rules ...
pluka modal, 2nd place (for) pleasingly; pleasing ...; in order to please ...
pruce modal, 2nd place (inputs) processing from inputs ...
srana modal, 2nd place (pertaining to) relevantly; concerning ... (less specific).
krasi modal, 2nd place originally; as an origin/starting point of ...
traji modal, 2nd place (property) -est; most extremely; superlative in ...
rinka modal, 2nd place (phys./mental) causal therefore ...
rinka modal, 2nd place (phys./mental) causal nevertheless ...
lifri modal, 2nd place experiencing ...; undergoing ...
$s_1$ is a shark of species $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ are stairs/stairway/steps for climbing structure $x_{2}$ with steps $x_{3}$.
sarcu modal, 2nd place (process) necessarily; necessary for ...
sidju modal, 2nd place assisting ... (in doing/maintaining something).
tadji modal, 2nd place methodically; as a method for doing ...
tamsmi modal, 2nd place similarly; resembling ... (in ideal form).
valsi.notes: {tamsmi} is $x_1$ resembles $x_2$ sharing ideal form/shape $x_3$ in property $x_4$

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (agent) inserts/interposes/puts/deposits $x_{2}$ into interior $x_{3}$/into among/between members of $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Insertion need not imply a significant degree of 'filling'; inject (= {je'erse'a}); syringe/needle (= {se'arterje'e}, {je'erse'atci}, {jestu'u} or {tu'urjesni}); also pour, inflate, stuff, fill. See also {rinci}, {tisna}, {punji}, {jbini}, {nenri}, {jmina}, {culno}, {kunti}, {catlu}.

valsi.definition: stidi modal, 2nd place suggestively; suggesting (idea/action) ...
tcika modal, 2nd place (for letters) at the same time as ... ; label with event.
stuzi modal, 2nd place as a location of ...
zvati modal; 2nd place (with temporary location...)
vanbi modal, 2nd place (environment) as conditions/environment of/for ...
xamgu modal, 2nd place beneficiary case tag for the benefit of...; with beneficiary ...
$x_{1}$ is a self/ego/id/identity-image of $x_{2}$.
zanru modal, 2nd place approvingly; approving ...
$x_1$ is self-sufficient/independent for purpose $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$.
$x_1=s_2=g_2$ is autistic/Aspergian, unable to understand social behavior $x_2=g_3$.
$gas_1=s_1$ raises/elevates it/his/her self by in frame of reference $gal_2$ as compared with standard/baseline $gal_3$.
$g_1=s_2$ masturbates/has sex without partner(s).
valsi.notes: Does not include masturbating others. Cf. {xangle}, {xanse'agle}, {gletci}, {runpinji}, {desmi'i}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ washes his/her/em/itself of dirt/contaminant $x_2$.
$g_1=se_2$ pretends to have property(ies) $si_2$ to observer $si_3$ under conditions $si_4$
$r_1=s_2$ throws/launches/casts/hurls oneself to/at/in direction $r_3$.
$x_1=se_2=p_3=sp_1$ answers one's own question about subject $x_2=p_2$.
zukte modal, 2nd place purposefully; goalfully acting at ...
$x_1$ assures themselves / makes themselves certain that $x_2$ (du'u) is true about subject $x_3$
$x_1$ commits suicide / kills him/herself by method $x_2$.
$c_1$ is self-interested.
$c_1$ is the autobiography of $s_2=c_2=c_3$.
$f_1=s_2$ exercises/show self-restraint
$j_1=s_2$ is conceited by standard $d_3$
$x_1=sel_1=sev_2$ is selfish/self-serving/egotistical in regard to activity $x_2=sel_3$. $x_1=sel_1=sev_2$ is an egotist.
$n_1$ is an autobiography/resumé/home page of $n_2$=$n_3$, intended for $n_4$.
$s_1=c_1$ says $c_2$ to itself.
$j_1=s_2$ is out of control/temper of/with regard to $j_3$ (activity/event/performance).
$s_1=z_1$ improves itself/is self-improving/augmenting/increasing in property/quantity $z_2$ by amount $z_3$.
valsi.notes: From {sevzi} + {zenba}. Dropped s2 place, as is common for sevzi lujvo.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a file consisting of information $x_2$ with attributes/type/size $x_3$.
valsi.notes: The example “sfaile fi lo pixra” translates to “image file”. The example “sfaile lo lisri ty xy ty translates to “file of type ‘txt’” or “text file”.

valsi.definition: $n_1=s_1$ (agent) punishes $n_2=s_2$ [recipient] for atypical infraction $n_3=s_3$ (event/state/action) with punishment $n_4=s_4$.
valsi.notes: Notes: The main difference to {sfasa} is that the infraction must be atypical. See also {malne'u}, {cnemu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a fly [a small non-stinging flying insect] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) punishes $x_{2}$ for infraction $x_{3}$ (event/state/action) with punishment $x_{4}$ (event/state).
valsi.notes: Also chastise, castigate, chasten, discipline, correct (one sense); also $x_4$ penalty. See also {cnemu}, {pleji}, {venfu}, {zekri}, {canja}, {dunda}, {jdima}, {jerna}, {kargu}, {prali}, {dapma}, {cirko}, {jinga}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ reflects Swedish culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_2$
Sweden.
$x_{1}$ is a sofa/couch (noun).
$x_{1}$ dives/swoops [manner of controlled falling] to $x_{2}$ from $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is an ungulate of order/family/species $x_2$.
erase the last Lojban word, treating non-Lojban text as a single word.
discursive: similarly.
$sl_3$ is an ceremony/celebration for recognizing/honoring $si_2$ (object of esteem) with participants $sl_1=si_1$.
$x_1$ (event) hurts/damages the respect/high regard/esteem for $x_2=s_2$ held by by $s_1$ with result $x_4$ (state).
$st_1$ is a place of honor/[shrine/podium/wall area/trophy case] for person/thing/[event] $st_2=si_2$ venerated/honored by $si_1$
evidential: it seems that...
convert number to portion selbri; $x_{1}$ is an (n)th portion of mass/totality $x_{2}$; (cf. gunma).
$d_1$ is an igloo for purpose $d_2$.
$m_1$ is a snowmobile/snow scooter carrying $m_2$ on snow $m_3$, propelled by force $m_4$.
$t_1$=$s_1$ is a snowboard of material/property $t_2$.
trinary mathematical operator: [sigma summation of a using variable b over range c].
$s_1=c_1$ is a medal for $c_2$ given for atypical $c_3$ (event/property) by $c_4$.
valsi.notes: Careful! A medal is not a coin, since it is not used as a currency. This differs from {sicni}. As in {cnemu}, a positive/negative connotation is not implied. See also: {ve}.

valsi.definition: $p_1$ is seigniorage earned by $p_2=z_1$ in making coin $z_2=s_1$
abstractor: idea/concept abstractor; $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$'s concept of [bridi].
sidju modal, 1st place (aiding agent) aided by ...
$v_1$ is an idea-carrying virus / meme / self-propagating idea capable of infecting / currently infecting $v_3=s_3$ with idea / concept / belief / opinion $s_1$ about thing / topic / subject $s_2$.
valsi.notes: {vidru} place 2 is dropped due to redundancy with {sidbo}. Made of {sidbo} + {vidru}.

valsi.definition: $z_1=c_1$ is a West African lion [Panthera leo senegalensis] of breed $c_2$.
$s_1$ reflects Irish culture/nationality/language in aspect $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ [sound source] whistles/makes whistling sound/note/tone/melody $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a coin/token/is specie issued by $x_{2}$ having value $x_{3}$ of composition including $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ (idea abstract) is an idea/concept/thought about $x_{2}$ (object/abstract) by thinker $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also (adjective:) $x_1$ is ideal/ideational. See also {ciksi}, {jijnu}, {mucti}, {jinvi}, {nabmi}, {pensi}, {xanri}, cmavo list {si'o}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ helps/assists/aids object/person $x_{2}$ do/achieve/maintain event/activity $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is a figurative/metaphorical/non-literal meaning/interpretation of $x_2$ recognized/seen/accepted by $x_3$ .
$x_1$ is a flea of species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a cigar/cigarette/cigarillo made from tobacco/smokable substance $x_{2}$ by $x_{3}$.
$v_1$ is a cigarette/cigar smoker; $v_1$ smokes cigarettes/cigars.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of silk produced by $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a portion/quantity of salt from source $x_{2}$, of composition including $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ trades places with $x_2$ in circumstance $x_3$.
$x_1$ interchanges $x_2$ and $x_3$ in circumstance $x_4$.
$s_1=b_1$ (mass/set) integrate / unite with each other, displaying quality $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ fight [each other] over issue $x_{2}$ (abstract).
$x_1$ is symphony number $x_2$ key $x_3$ composed by $x_4$ performed by/at $x_5$ (event).
$p_1$ is a movement of symphony number $k_3$ in key $k_4$ composed by $k_5$.
$x_{1}$ seems/appears to have property(ies) $x_{2}$ to observer $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ seems like it has $x_2$ to $x_3$; suggest belief/observation (= {mlugau}, {mluti'i}); looks like/resembles (= {smimlu}, {mitmlu}). See also {catlu}, {viska}, {simsa}, {zgana}, {ganse}, {jarco}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ make up/peace with each other under condition $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ are friends [of each other].
$x_{1}$ is similar/parallel to $x_{2}$ in property/quantity $x_{3}$ (ka/ni); $x_{1}$ looks/appears like $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is a likeness/image of $x_2$; $x_1$ and $x_2$ are alike; similarity and parallel differ primarily in emphasis. See also {dunli}, {frica}, {mintu}, {panra}, {simlu}, {vrici}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is sesame of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1$ is the sum of all of $x_2$ added together.
$x_1$ rubs $x_2$ together.
$x_{1}$ (set) has members who mutually/reciprocally $x_{2}$ (event [$x_{1}$ should be reflexive in 1+ sumti]).
valsi.notes: Members of $x_1$ do to each other/one another $x_2$, and in return do $x_2$; $x_1$ (plural set) do the same thing $x_2$ to each other. See also {kampu}, {mintu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a snake/serpent of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a boa of species $x_2$
$x_1$ is an eel of species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ esteems/respects/venerates/highly regards $x_{2}$ [object of respect].
valsi.notes: Also: $x_2$ is respected/esteemed/celebrated (= {selsi'a} for reordered places). See also {banli}, {censa}, {misno}, {nelci}, {prami}, {salci}, {jgira}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is the trigonometric sine of angle/arcsine $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a sign/symbol/signal representing/referring/signifying/meaning $x_{2}$ to observer $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ signifies $x_2$; (adjective:) $x_1$ is significant/meaningful/of import; signal an action (= {sniti'i}), connotation (= se {sibyti'isni}, {sibyti'ismu}). See also {lerfu}, {tcita}, {barna}, {mifra}, {smuni}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is asleep (adjective); $x_{1}$ sleeps/is sleeping.
$sa_1$ sings lullaby $sa_2$ to $sa_3=si_1$.
$g_1=s_1$ snores.
$sa_2$ is a lullaby sung by $sa_1$ to $sa_3=si_1$.
$x_1$ is a dormouse of species $x_2$.
$t_1=s_1$ is sleepy; $t_1=s_1$ needs/wants sleep.
$x1=s1=n1$ is sleepy for reason $x2=n3$
$d_1=s_1$ is drowsy/sleepy.
$x1=g1$ is a blanket
$x1=s1=v1$ snores
$j_1=s_1$ is a straight angle (=180° or π radians) [2-dimensional shape/form] from vertex $j_2$ subtended by lateral [segment] $j_3$.
$x_{1}$ is straight/direct/line segment/interval between $x_{2}$ and $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is linear.
$x_1$ is is a quantity of/made from/consists of fur of animal/species/source $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Syrian culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ seeks/searches/looks for property $x_{2}$ among set $x_{3}$ (complete specification of set).
valsi.notes: If searching for an object or an event, use tu'a in $x_2$. See also {cirko}, {kalte}, {kavbu}, {kucli}, {rivbi}, {manci}, {facki}.

valsi.definition: $s_1=p_1$ finds $s_2=p_2$ at/in location $p_3$.
$x_{1}$ [agent] ceases/stops/halts/ends activity/process/state $x_{2}$ [not necessarily completing it].
$x_{1}$ cites/quotes/refers to/makes reference to source $x_{2}$ for information/statement $x_{3}$ (du'u).
$c_1=s_1$ cites/quotes $c_2=s_3$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) to audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$ from source $_s2$.
$x_{1}$ is private/personal/privy/[secret/confidential/confined] to $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is not-public/hidden.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is secret (one sense); $x_2$ is in the know/in touch with/privy to $x_1$ (= {selsivni} for reordered places); exclusion can be expressed by na'e(bo) in $x_2$: excluded/in the dark (= {nalselsivni}). See also {gubni}, {mipri}.

valsi.definition: $c_1$ is capitalism as practiced by $p_1=s_2$
$p_1$ is a Syrian pear (Pyrus syriaca) [fruit] of variety $p_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a skirt/kilt/dress of material $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is skirted [garment open at the bottom; not legged].
valsi.notes: A skirted garment may be full length ({pastu}), but must hang below the waist from support above or at the waist. See also {taxfu}, {palku}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is Basque in aspect $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is a computer for purpose $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a pelt/skin/hide/leather from $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is/appears to be of color/hue $x_{2}$ as perceived/seen by $x_{3}$ under conditions $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Conditions may include lighting, background, etc.. See also {blanu}, {bunre}, {cicna}, {cinta}, {crino}, {grusi}, {narju}, {nukni}, {pelxu}, {xunre}, {zirpu}, {carmi}, {kandi}, {xekri}, {blabi}.

valsi.definition: $c_1$ is science/technology-oriented science fiction about plot/theme/subject $c_2$ by author $c_3$, based on science $s_1$.
$p_1$ is a scientist pertaining to science $s_1$.
$z_1$ is an engineer in the branch of $s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$ with purpose/goal $z_3$
$x_{1}$ tells about/describes $x_{2}$ (object/event/state) to audience $x_{3}$ with description $x_{4}$ (property).
$x_{1}$ is a ski/skid/skate/runner for surface (of material) $x_{2}$ supporting skier/skater/sled/cargo $x_{3}$.
$x_1=p_1=s_1$ uses book $x_2=c_1$ about/containing $x_3=c_2$ by author $x_4=c_3$ for audience $x_5=c_4$ preserved in medium $x_6=c_5$ in order to explain $x_7=s_2$ to $x_8=s_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a cinema/movie/film about $x_{2}$ [plot/theme/subject/activity], filmmaker $x_{3}$, for audience $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Also motion picture; $x_2$ may be a convention rather than a subject; cartoon/animation (= selxraci'a {skina}); television/tv show (= {tivyskina}, regardless of length, factual content, etc.). See also {tivni}, {vidni}, {pixra}, {finti}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=c_1$ is a bow/crossbow/ballista for shooting ammunition $x_2=c_2$ [arrow/quarrel/crossbow bolt] by flexing and releasing bow/prod/lath $x_3=g_1$ of material $x_6=g_3$, to whose two ends are tied bow string $x_4=g_2=s_1$ of material $x_5=s_2$.
valsi.notes: To be clear, the launch mechanism is as follows: $x_4$ is pulled so as to bend $x_3$, while $x_2$ is placed on $x_4$, and $x_4$ is released, causing $x_3$ to snap back into its normal shape, launching $x_2$ as it does so.

valsi.definition: $m_1$ is an aerial tramway carrying $m_2$ in/on lift $m_3$, propelled by $m_4=s_1$.
$s_1$ is a mackerel of species $s_2$.
$x_1$ has scurvy with symptoms $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is cord/cable/rope/line/twine/cordage/woven strands of material $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a vine of genus/species/variety $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Gaelic/Scottish culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Irish (= {sicko'o}), Scottish (= {sunko'o}), Celtic (= {dzeko'o}), Welsh (= {nanko'o}), Breton (= {fasko'o}); since Scottish/Gaelic is only the northern branch of the Celtic tribes, many would prefer a fu'ivla for Celtic; nationalism might also demand a separate fu'ivla for Irish. See also {brito}, {glico}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is metalinguistic with respect to the expression by $x_2$ of text $x_3$ for audience $x_4$ via medium $x_5$ .
$d_1$ means/intends to say $c_2$ to $c_3$ via medium $c_4$.
$m_1=c_1$ expresses/states an order to $m_2=c_3$ for $m_3$ (event/state) to happen.
$x_{1}$ is a groove/trench/furrow [shape/form] in object/surface $x_{2}$.
$x_1=c_1=s_1$ responds to $x_2=s_2$ by expressing/saying $x_3=c_2$ to $x_4=c_3$ via expressive medium $x_5=c_4$.
$t_1$ is a manner of expression of $c_1$, saying $c_2$ to $c_3$ via medium $c_4$ under conditions $t_3$.
$x_{1}$ is old/familiar/well-known to observer $x_{2}$ in feature $x_{3}$ (ka) by standard $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: This can cover both meanings of old. Old in years, i.e. age, can be conveyed through $x_2$ = the world, life, existence (= loi nu {zasti}); in usage this has been a common default for ellipsis. However slabu is not the opposite of 'young' (= {nalci'o}, {tolci'o}), but the opposite of 'new' (= {tolni'o}); also ancient (= {tcesau}), age (= {nilsau}); $x_2$ is used to $x_1$ (= selsau for reordered places); historic/historical (= {cirsau}, {cirselcedra}; also {vaipru}). (cf. {clani}, {citno}, {cnino}, se {djuno}; not the opposite of {citno}, {djuno})

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a syllable in language $x_{2}$.
letteral: Lojban "," character.
$p_1$ is a mora [linguistics]/component of syllable $p_2=s_1$ in language $s_2$.
valsi.notes: A syllable containing one mora is said to be monomoraic (={pavyslakypau}); a syllable with two morae is said to be bimoraic (={relslakypau}). Also, in rarer cases, a syllable with three morae is said to be trimoraic (={cibyslakypau}).

valsi.definition: $m_1$ is trimoraic/is the mass of three morae formed from set of mora $m_2$ whose n member(s) are $m_3=p_1$.
$m_1$ is monomoraic/is the mass of one morae formed from set of morae $m_2$ whose n member(s) are $m_3=p_1$.
$m_1$ is dimoraic/is the mass of two morae formed from set of morae $m_2$ whose n member(s) are $m_3=p_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of acid of composition $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is acidic.
valsi.notes: $x_2$: composition including $x_2$, which need not be complete specification. See also {slari}, {nimre}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of myristic acid.
$g_1$ pickles $st_1$ with acid $sl_1$
$x_{1}$ is a cylinder [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a tower for purpose $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is sour/tart to observer $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains plastic/polymer of type/component unit(s) $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is a nucleus of cell $x_2$ [default biological].
$s_1$=$c_1$ is a cradle made of $c_2$, holding $c_3$, rocking at speed $s_2$ through positions $s_3$.
$g_1$ swings $s_1$.
$x_{1}$ is solid, of composition/material including $x_{2}$, under conditions $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Conditions include temperature and pressure. See also {runta}, {litki}, {gapci}, {jdari}, {dunja}, {pulce}, {jduli}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ oscillates at rate/frequency $x_{2}$ through set/sequence-of-states $x_{3}$ (complete specification).
valsi.notes: Also (expressible either with desku or slilu): side to side, to and fro, back and forth, reciprocal (motion), rotates, revolves. See also {dikni}, {rilti}, {morna}, {desku}, {janbe}, {boxna}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of sulfur/brimstone (S); [metaphor: foul odor, volcanic].
$sla_1=sli_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of sulphuric acid (H2SO4).
$x_1$ is golden/gold-colored when viewed by $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$.
Slovakia.
$x_1$ is Slovenian/Slovene in aspect $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Slavic language/culture/ethos in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the muscle [body-part] controlling $x_{2}$, of body $x_{3}$; [metaphor: tools of physical power].
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains onions/scallions of type/cultivar $x_{2}$.
$s_1$ is a Jepson's onion (Allium jepsonii) of variety/strain $s_2$.
valsi.notes: Jepson's onion, honoring renowned California botanist Willis Linn Jepson.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is a Kurrat/Egyptian leek (Allium ampeloprasum) of variety/strain $s_2$.
$sp_1$ is an onion plant (genus Allium) of species/strain $sp_2$ with onions/scallions $sl_1$.
Mouse
$c_1$ is calm about $x_2=c_3$.
$x_1$ is a guinea pig of species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a mouse of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ guesses/conjectures/surmises $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true about subject $x_{3}$; [epistemology].
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ has a hunch that $x_2$ is true; $x_1$ imagines $x_2$ is true; words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also {djuno}, {facki}, {jijnu}, {sruma}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (source) is quiet/silent/[still] at observation point $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ feels the taste $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is a monkey/ape/simian/baboon/chimpanzee of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is an Allen's swamp monkey (genus Allenopithecus) of species/breed $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a bonobo ape (Pan paniscus) of breed $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a gracile capuchin monkey (genus Cebus) of species/strain $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a gorilla ape (genus Gorilla) of species/breed $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a mandrill/drill (genus Mandrillus) of species/strain $x_2$.
$x_1$ is an orangutang (genus Pongo) of species/strain $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a baboon (genus Papio) of species/strain $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a squirrel monkey (genus Saimiri) of species/strain $x_2$.
valsi.notes: The name of the genus Saimiri is of Tupi origin (sai-mirim or gai-mbirin < sai 'monkey' and mirim 'small').

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a robust capuchin monkey (genus Sapuja) of species/breed $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a chimpanzee (Pan troglodytes) of breed $x_2$.
$v_1$=$jt_1$=$s_1$ is SIV [Simian immunodeficiency virus] of $jt_2$.
valsi.notes: From {smani}, {jinkytoldu'e}, {vidru}. s2, v2 and v3 subsumed.

valsi.definition: $c_1$ whispers $c_2=s_1$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) to audience $c_3$ via expressive medium $c_4$, quietly by standard $s_3$
$x_1$ is a plum/peach/cherry/apricot/almond/sloe [fruit] (genus Prunus) of species/variety $x_2$
valsi.notes: {zirsmela} for plum, {xunsmela} for cherry, {najysmela} for peach, {pelsmela} for apricot, {ri'orsmela} for almond, {blasmela} for sloe. Cf. {rutrprunu}, {ricrprunu}, {flaume}, {persika}, {rutrceraso}, {birkoku}, {frambesi}, {fragari}, {plise}, {perli}, {rozgu}

valsi.definition: $siml_1=sims_1$ resembles/looks like/appears to be similar/parallel to $sims_2$ in property/quantity $sims_3$ to observer $siml_3$ under conditions $siml_4$
The members of $x_1=simx_1$ (set) resemble one another in property $x_2=simx_2$.
valsi.notes: {simsa}1 and simsa2 are merged into {simxu}1, by virtue of simxu's ability to take any 2-way relationship and make it into an n-way relationship (lujvopap.txt); cf. {simsa}, {simxu}, {dunli}, {mintu}, {panra}, ma'oste {du}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=t_1=s_1$ acts like/similarly to $x_2=t_2=s_2$ in property $x_3=s_3$ under conditions $x_4=t_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a sock/stocking [flexible foot and lower leg garment] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a spoon/scoop (tool) for use $x_{2}$, made of material $x_{3}$.
$d_1$ and $d_2=s_2$ antonyms of each other.
$g_1$ refers to $s_1$ with expression $s_2$ recognized by $s_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a meaning/interpretation of $x_{2}$ recognized/seen/accepted by $x_{3}$.
$sa_1$ is semantics with methodology $sa_3$.
$v_1$ is the context of meaning $v_2=s_1$ of event/action/object $s_2$ recognized by $s_3$.
$v_1=s_2$ is polysemous/ambiguous/vague, having many meanings including $s_1$ to observer $s_3$.
valsi.notes: Does not necessarily imply that $x_3$ has trouble interpreting $x_1$. Cf. {pavysmu}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ [agent] succeeds in/achieves/completes/accomplishes $x_{2}$ as a result of effort/attempt/try $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ reaches $x_2$; (adjective:) $x_1$ is successful; $x_2$ (event/state/achievement). See also {fliba}, {troci}, {jgira}.

valsi.definition: $d_1$ knocks on/hits door/object $d_2$ with instrument [or body-part] $d_3$ making sound $s_1$
$x_{1}$ is to the south/southern side of $x_{2}$ according to frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is mustard of species/breed $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a sound/acoustic signal, produced/emitted by $x_2$ and meaning $x_3$ to $x_4$ (listener).
$v_1$ is a sound recording of $v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $v_3$ on recording medium $v_4$.
$t_1$ is a microphone for recording sound $s_1$ produced/emitted by $s_2$.
$x_1$ is a dreamcatcher, passing dreams $x_2$, stopping dreams $x_3$, with netting properties $x_4$.
$x_1$ is a variable taking value $x_2$ under conditions $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a jellyfish/jelly/sea jelly/member of phylum Cnidaria of species/breed $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ seconds in duration (default is 1 second) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ assigns symbol/variable $x_2$ to value/referent $x_3$ for observer $x_4$.
$x_1$ is an ideogram/symbol in writing system $x_2$ meaning $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity/expanse of snow.
$x_{1}$ adheres/sticks to $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is sticky/gummy/adhesive.
valsi.notes: Note that $x_1$ is the adhering surface being claimed; $x_2$ need not be sticky. See also {tarla}, {viknu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is the sigma summation of expression $x_2$ with variable $x_3$ over domain $x_4$.
$c_1$ fades from location $c_2$
$m_1$ is a sloth of genus/species $m_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a sandwich/layering [not restricted to food] of $x_{2}$ sandwiched between $x_{3}$.
$k_1$ is a [shared journal]/blog about topic/subject $k_2=c_2$ published/administered by $k_3$ for participants/audience $k_4=c_1$.
$x_{1}$ is secure/safe from threat $x_{2}$ (event).
$s_1$ is a forum for $c_1$ to discuss/talk about topic/subject $c_2$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state) is an accident/unintentional on the part of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is an accident.
digit/number: 9 (digit) [nine].
digit/number: almost all (digit/number).
digit/number: most.
tense interval modifier: usually; objectively quantified tense; defaults as time tense.
digit/number: many.
quantified selbri: convert many to cardinal; $x_{1}$ is a set with many members $x_{2}$ of total set $x_{3}$.
tense interval modifier: many times; objective tense; defaults as time tense.
digit/number: several.
digit/number: few.
tense interval modifier: a few times; objective tense; defaults as time tense.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of soya [grain/bean] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$s_1=g_1$ is a quantity of soybean oil from soybeans of species/variety $s_2=g_2$.
$s_1=d_1$ is made of/contains/is a quantity/expanse of soy milk/soya milk/soybean milk/soy juice/soy drink from soybeans of species/variety $s_2$.
valsi.notes: Soy "milk" is produced by soaking dry soybeans and grinding them with water.

valsi.definition: $s_1=l_1$ is a quantity of soy protein of type/soy species $s_2=l_2$ .
$s_1$ is a quantity of tempeh from soybeans of species/strain $s_2$.
$s_1$ is a quantity of tofu/bean curd from soybeans of species/strain $s_2$.
$sa_1$ is soy sauce for use with $sa_2$, containing ingredients including $sa_3$.
$s_1=x_1$ is a quantity of ink of color/pigment $x_2$ used by writing device $x_3$ from soybeans of species/variety $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of alkali metal of type $x_{2}$ [default sodium].
valsi.notes: Also potassium, lithium, cesium. Soda. See also {jilka}, {jinme}.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of rubidium (Rb).
$s_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of cesium (Cs).
$s_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of francium (Fr).
$s_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of Kalium (Li).
valsi.notes: Potassium is a chemical element with symbol K (from Neo-Latin kalium).

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of lithium (Li).
valsi.notes: Berzelius gave the alkaline material the name "lithion/lithina", from the Greek word "lithos", meaning "stone").

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of a carbonated beverage/soda of flavor/brand $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also: soft drink (though this sometimes includes tea and coffee as distinct from alcoholic beverages which are "hard drinks"). See also {jilka}, {jinme}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ reflects Russian empire/USSR/ex-USSR (Soviet]/CIS culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_1=b_1=s_1$ is a Soviet cow/cattle/kine/ox/[bull/steer/calf] [beef-producer/bovine] of species/breed $x_2=b_2$ and reflecting USSR/ex-USSR [Soviet] culture/nationality in aspect $x_3=s_2$.
valsi.notes: Why not give a definition to this word :) See {softo} {bakni}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is USSR (Soviet Union)
discursive: reciprocal sumti marker; indicates a reciprocal relationship between sumti.
$sa_1$ is a field ration consisting of dishes including $sa_2$, for $so_1$ of army $so_2$.
$p_1$ expects $p_2$ (event); $p_1$ expects $p_2$ to happen.
valsi.notes: $p_2$ is likely. It has high probability. Cf. {pacna}, {sorpa'a}, {sotpa'a}.

valsi.definition: number/quantity: 9,000 expressed with comma.
Soul
$x_{1}$ is a light with lit $x_{2}$. (omit, $x_{3}$ = gusni3 (light source) = solri1 (solar)).
$x_1$ is a solar panel / device for producing electricity from sunlight by process $x_2$ (ka).
valsi.notes: The x2 is a property of the light illuminating the apparatus. Although the word "panel" appears in the definition, other shapes are encompassed by this word.

valsi.definition: $x1=l1$ is a sunbeam/sunray/[line of sunlight] illuminating $x2=g2$
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of gold (Au); [metaphor: valuable, heavy, non-reactive].
$x_1$ is $x_2$ (default 1) Astronomical Unit(s) (AU)
$x_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of helium (He).
$x_1$ is a sunset at location $x_2$ as observed by $x_3$
$x_1$ is a sunrise at location $x_2$ as observed by $x_3$
$x_{1}$ is the sun of home planet $x_{2}$ (default Earth) of race $x_{3}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is solar.
valsi.notes: 'home planet' refers to a planet which is "home" to a race, but not necessarily the original "home" of a species if that species inhabits many worlds. See also {gusni}, {lunra}, {mluni}, {plini}, {santa}, {terdi}, {tarci}.

valsi.definition: the Sun (the star in the middle of Earth's solar system).
$sp_1$ is a sunflower (genus Helianthus) of species/strain/cultivar $sp_2$.
$g_1$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains sunflower oil from sunflower $sp_1=g_2$.
$sp_1=sa_1$ is a quantity of sunroot/sunchoke/earth apple/topinambour [edible starchy root of genus Helianthus ] of species/strain $sp_2=sa_2$.
$t_1$ is/are (a) sunflower seed(s) of sunflower $sp_1=t_2$.
$g_2=su_1=t_1$ is a sun-dried tomato of species/strain/variety $t_2$, dried by sun $g_1=so_1$ [default: sun of home planet Earth].
$x_1$ is a sunflower of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ sows/plants $x_{2}$ [crop/plants] at/in $x_{3}$.
quantified selbri: convert 9 to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is ninth among $x_{2}$ ordered by rule $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a soldier/warrior/fighter of army $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is an army battalion, a subdivision of army unit $x_2$ which serves country/nation/group $x_3$.
$x_1$ is an army company, a subdivision of army unit $x_2$ which serves country/nation/group $x_3$.
$x_1$ is an army platoon, a subdivision of army unit $x_2$ which serves country/nation/group $x_3$.
$k_1$ is an armoured personnel carrier propelled by $k_3$.
number/quantity: 90 [ninety].
number/quantity: 900 [nine hundred].
$n_1$ is liked by most people.
$z_1=n_2$ is pop music produced/performed at/by $z_2$ (event).
$c_1$ is a polyglot, proficient in languages $c_2=b_1$.

$x_1=c_1=p_1$ is sexually polyamorous/sexually loves many people/more than one person including, but not limited to, set $x_2=p_2$ in situation/activity/state $x_3=c_2$, exhibiting sexuality/gender/sexual orientation (ka) $x_4=c_3$ by standard $x_5=c_4$.
valsi.notes: Leaving in all the places of {cinse} doesn't do much, but it probably doesn't hurt. See also {cinse}, {prami}, {so'i}, {sorpa'i}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a store/deposit/supply/reserve of materials/energy $x_{2}$ in containment $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: $x_3$ need not be a container, but could merely be a site/location restriction; e.g. a heap. The sumti indicates how the supply is identified and distinguished from other occurrences of the stored $x_2$ that are not part of the store. (cf. {panka}; {vreji} for information storage; {sabji} for a store or reserve that is not necessarily tied to a site, {banxa}, {panka})

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of sorghum of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$j_1$ is an empire govening over $g_1$ provinces with $j_2=g_3$ territories.
$k_1$ is a multiple rocket launcher propelled by $k_3$.
$t_1$ is a web-shape, manifested by $t_2$.
$x_1$ is knowledgable about subject $x_2$ by epistomology $x_3$
$n_1$ is an international group of peoples $n_2$.
$p_1$ hopes for $p_2$ (event); $p_1$ hopes that $p_2$ happens.
valsi.notes: $p_2$ is possible and has medium probability. Cf. {pacna}, {sotpa'a}, {sojypa'a}.

valsi.definition: $x_1=p_1$ is polyamorous/loves many people (romantic love implied), including, but not limited to, set $x_2=p_2$.
valsi.notes: Romantic love, is, I suppose, not absolutely necessary, but seems likely. See also {prami}, {so'i}, {sorcinpa'i}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a bus/coach for carrying passengers $x_2$, propelled by $x_3$
valsi.notes: This is a zi'evla of the word {sorprekarce}.

valsi.definition: $k_1$ is a bus/coach for carrying passengers $p_1=k_2$, propelled by $k_3$.
$t_1$ is a bus terminal/station/depot in transport system $t_2$ for buses for carrying $p_1=k_2$
$c_2$ believes in many gods/deities $c_1$ with dominion over $c_3$; c2 is a polytheist.
$x_1$ has many meanings/is polysemous to interpreter $x_2$
$d_1$ is a dormitory (building/place) where people $x_2$ (complete mass) sleep.
valsi.notes: $x_1$ is from {dinju} and $x_2$ is invented but related to {sipna}$_1$. $x_2$ should be used for all the people; e.g. "mi se sorsipydi'u" incorrect speaking for yourself.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ sorta is/does $x_2$ (nu/ka) under conditions $x_3$
valsi.notes: This is a joke word. Its main use is in the tanru {kinda} {sorta}

valsi.definition: $x_1$ happens many times in interval $x_2$.
$r_1$ is a many-flowered/multiflora/baby/Japanese/seven-sisters/Eijitsu roserose (Rosa multiflora) of species/strain $r_2$.
number/quantity: 99% (number).
$t_1$ is a constellation of stars
$x_1$ is a hamlet/settlement with inhabitants $x_2$
$p_1$ wishes for $p_2$ (event); $p_1$ wishes that $p_2$ happened.
valsi.notes: $p_2$ is unlikely. It has low probability. Cf. {pacna}, {sorpa'a}, {sojypa'a}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ happens seldom/infrequently/is rare in interval $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is an egg/ovum/sperm/pollen/gamete of/from organism [mother/father] $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: (poorly metaphorical only due to gender- and species- being unspecified): ovoid, oblate (= {pevyso'aseltai}, but better: {claboi}); egg, specifically female (= {fetso'a}), of a bird (= {cpifetso'a}, {cpiso'a}), of a chicken (= {jipcyfetso'a}, {jipcyso'a}. (but note that Lojban does not require specificity, just as English doesn't for either milk or eggs; "sovda" is fine for most contexts); If fertilized, then {tsiju} or {tarbi}. (cf. {ganti}, {gutra}, {mamta}, {patfu}, {rorci}, {tsiju}, {lanbi}, {tarbi}; also {djine}, {konju} for shape, {tarbi})

valsi.definition: Soviet
$k_1$ is made of/contains a quantity of custard.
number/quantity: 97.5.
September.
$j_1$ has the rank of General/Admiral/Air Chief Marshal (equivalent of NATO OF-9) in military unit /organization $j_2$.
valsi.notes: Cf. {so}, {moi}, {jatna}, {jemja'a}, {vairsoi}, {pavnonmoija'a}, {bivmoija'a}. Based on STANAG 2116: NATO Codes for Grades of Military Personnel.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is September/the ninth month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$b_1$ is a hedge separating $b_2$ and $b_3$ in $b_4$ made of plants of species $s_2$.
$x_1$ is an aphid of genus/species $x_2$.
$c_1$ is a herbivore eating plants $s_1=c_2$.
valsi.notes: See also vegetarian (sense: vegetable-eater ={stagycti}). Herbivores may eat parts of the plant that is not edible for humans.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ - is spaghetti made out of/containing $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ (event/action abstract) surprises/startles/is unexpected [and generally sudden] to $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is rooibos of species $x_2$
$x_{1}$ (agent) polishes object/surface $x_{2}$ with polish $x_{3}$, applied using tool $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Spanish-speaking culture/nationality/language in aspect $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Metaphorical restriction to Spain by contrast with xispo (comparable to the distinction between glico and merko/sralo/brito/kadno); Spain (= {sangu'e}); Spanish dialects spoken in Spain, especially Castillian (= {sansanbau}). See also {xispo}, {ketco}, {mexno}, {gento}.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is a peanut plant/plant from genus Arachis, of species/strain/cultivar $s_2$.
$s_1$ is a plant of the genus Acis of species/strain/cultivar $s_2$.
$s_1$ is a plant of genus Ada of species/strain/cultivar $s_2$.
$x_1$ is a quantity of asparagus of species/strain $x_2$
$x_1$ is a calamus/sweet flag (genus Acorus) of species/strain $x_2$.
$s_1$ is a colicroot/colicweed/crow corn/unicorn root (genus Aletris) of species/strain/cultivar $s_2$.
$x_1$ is a water-plantain (genus Alisma) of species/strain $x_2$.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ marries $x_2$ according to marriage traditions/custom/law $x_3$.

$x_1$ is a smelt of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ pertains to Esperanto language/culture in aspect $x_2$
$si_{1}$ is/are married couple(s) under law/custom/tradition/system/convention $sp_{3}$.
$x1$=$sp1$=$st1$ is divorced from $x2$=$sp2$ by law/convention $x3$=$sp3$
$x_{1}$ [object/substance] is a piece/portion/lump/chunk/particle of $x_{2}$ [substance].
$x_{1}$ is a hospital treating patient(s) $x_{2}$ for condition/injuries/disease/illness $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Hospice (a place where $x_2$ of spita is lenu {mrobi'o} = {mrospita}). See also {bilma}, {mikce}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a parrot of species/breed $x_2$.
$x_1$ splashes/produces a splash
$x_{1}$ is broken/inoperable/broken down/non-utile/not usable for function $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Agentive break, cause to become inoperable (= {pofygau}, {pofyzu'e}); accidentally break, as a result of an event, non-agentive (= {pofyja'e}, {nutpo'uja'e}). See also {daspo}, {katna}, {porpi}, {se} {xrani}, {cikre}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ destroys, using/through event $d_1$, object/person $d_2$.
$x_{1}$ bursts/explodes/violently breaks up/decomposes/combusts into pieces/energy/fragments $x_{2}$.
$sp_1=st_1$ crushes/destroys by stomping $sp_2=st_2$ using limbs $st_3$.
$x_1$ reflects Esperanto language/culture/community in aspect $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ answers/replies to/responds to person/object/event/situation/stimulus $x_{2}$ with response $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: $x_3$ also answer/reply. If $x_2$ is a person/object, it will usually require "tu'a" indicating that the reply/response is to that person/object doing something. "tu'a" may not be needed if the person/object itself is the stimulus, rather than something it is doing. See also {cusku}, {preti}, {nabmi}, {danfu}, {frati}, {cpedu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ gives reply/answer/responds with $x_2$ (sedu'u/text/lu'e concept) to $x_3$ via expressive medium $x_4$, about subject $x_5$.
$x_{1}$ spits/expectorates $x_{2}$ [predominantly liquid] from $x_{3}$ to/onto $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is vertical/upright/erect/plumb/oriented straight up and down in reference frame/gravity $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [abrasive/cutting/scratching object/implement] scratches/[carves]/erodes/cuts [into] $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: (cf. {guska}, {katna}, {mosra}, {plixa}, {kakpa} (unlike kakpa, sraku does not imply material is removed), {spali})

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ reflects Australian culture/nationality/geography/dialect in aspect $x_{2}$.
$s_1=b_1$ is the Australian English language used by $b_2$ to express/communicate $b_3$ (si'o/du'u, not quote).
$s_1=g_1$ is Australia
$s_1=t_1$ is Australia/Oceania/Australasia
$x_{1}$ pertains to/is germane/relevant to/concerns/is related/associated with/is about $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is a question of/treats of $x_2$; can be symmetric, although $x_1$ is conventionally more specific or constrained in scope than $x_2$. See also cmavo list {ra'a}, {ckini}, {ponse}, {steci}.

valsi.definition: $d_2=s_2$ is a pro/pro-argument (P) supporting thesis statement/another argument $s_2$ against contra-argument $d_3$, by arguer $d_1$.

$d_1=b_1$ is a stripe on surface $b_2$ of material $d_2=b_3$
valsi.notes: This could also be a striped pattern although {srimo'a} might be more suited to that.

valsi.definition: $v_4=m_1$ is a magnetic tape/cassette storing $v_2$ (data/facts/du'u) about $v_3$ (object/event) in file(s) $v_1$.
$x_{1}$ reflects Sanskrit language/Sanskritic/Vedic culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$s_1=b_1$ is a rib of $s_2=b_2$.
valsi.notes: During the development of mammalian embryos, fused-on remnants of ribs can be traced in neck vertebrae (cervical ribs) and sacral vertebrae. In reptiles, ribs sometimes occur in all vertebrae from the neck to the sacrum. Cf. {bongu}, {cutne}.

valsi.definition: $k_1=s_1$ comes/goes to $k_2$ from $k_2$ around $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ assumes/supposes that $x_{2}$ (du'u) is true about subject $x_{3}$; [epistemology].
valsi.notes: Words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place. See also {smadi}, {birti}.

valsi.definition: $m_1$ is an iris/diaphragm covering $m_2$, made of $m_3$.
$m_1=s_1$ orbits $s_2$ in direction $s_3$ using orbit $m_4$.
$c_1$ x1 (mass) is a peripheral nervous system interrelated by structure $c_2$ among neurons/components $n_1=c_3$ (set) of body $n_2$, displaying $c_4$ (ka).
$p_1$ puts/places $p_2$ around $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ encircles/encloses/is surrounding $x_{2}$ in direction(s)/dimension(s)/plane $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: ({jinsru} =) $x_1$ is a ring/belt/band/girdle around/circling/ringing $x_2$ near total containment in some dimension(s). See also {karli}, {senta}, {snuji}, {vanbi}, se {nenri}, se {jbini}, {bartu}, {djine}.

valsi.definition: $t_1=s_1$ is a scarf worn on body part $t_2=s_2$.
valsi.notes: Includes "neckscarf" ({nebysruta'u}), "headscarf" ({sedysruta'u}), and "waistscarf" ({befsruta'u}). Worn for warmth, cleanliness, fashion, or religious reasons. Cf. {dasri}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is honest/open/truthfully revealing to/candid/frank with $x_{2}$ about matter/fact $x_{3}$.
$g_1$ parks/moors/berths/anchors vehicle $s_1$ at $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ is the edible $x_{2}$ portion of plant $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ is a vegetable.
valsi.notes: Note that fruits and nuts are also vegetables; generally this word will be used for either the general category of edible plants, or for non-fruit vegetables (= {nalrutstagi}). See also {grute}, {kobli}, {narge}, {sluni}, {spati}, {sunga}, {tamca}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a radish (root/bulb) of variety $x_2$

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a water chestnut (corm) of variety $x_2$.

Stockholm
$x_1$ is a quantity of porcelain of composition $x_2$ in form $x_3$
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of ceramic made by $x_{2}$, of composition $x_{3}$, in form/shape $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Made of baked clay or other non-metallic solid; $x_3$: composition including $x_3$, which need not be complete specification. See also {kliti}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ remains/stays at/abides/lasts with $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the stalk/stem/trunk [body-part] of plant/species $x_{2}$; [metaphor: main support].

valsi.notes: The young stems of C. oleraceum are edible, and cultivated for food in Japan and India. Certain species of Cirsium have been traditionally used as food in rural areas of Southern Europe.

valsi.definition: $c_1=s_1$ is a/the sprout/shoot of plant/species $s_2$ by standard/norm $c_3$.
$x_1$ is a quantity of rhubarb of species/strain $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ steps/treads on/in surface $x_{2}$ using limbs $x_{3}$.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a quantity of soup/stew/olla/olio [food] of ingredients including $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ is in $x_1$, an ingredient/part/component of $x_1$. See also {sanmi}, {mixre}, {salta}, {sanso}.

valsi.definition: $sm_1=b_1$ is/are soup spoon(s) [item of cutlery] suitable for eating soup $sm_2=st_1$, made of material $s_3$.
valsi.notes: See also: Chinese (soup) spoon (={jugysmuci}), British soup spoon (={ritstasysmuci}).

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ has a talent/aptitude/innate skill for doing/being $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ feels frustration about $x_{2}$ (abstraction).
$x_{1}$ (ka) is specific/particular/specialized/[special]/a defining property of $x_{2}$ among $x_{3}$ (set).
valsi.notes: [$x_2$ are members/individuals of a subset of $x_3$; object whose association is specific/defining of a subset or individuals (= {tecra'a}, also cf. cmavo list {po'e}, [$x_2$ is also special to $x_1$]); also: especially/strongly/specifically associated]; ($x_3$ is completely specified set)]; See also {srana}, se {ponse}, {ckini}, {tcila}, {tutra}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a/the head [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: uppermost portion].

$x_1$ is Stepmania
valsi.notes: Stepmania, the "Dance Dance Revolution"-style game for Windows/Mac/Linux.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is $x_{2}$ steradian(s) [metric unit] in solid angle (default is 1) by standard $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is to the west/western side of $x_{2}$ according to frame of reference $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) suggests/proposes idea/action $x_{2}$ to audience $x_{3}$; $x_{1}$ (event) inspires $x_{2}$ in/among $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Event which inspires/suggests/is suggestive (= {faurti'i}, {sidyfau}). See also cmavo list {ti'i}, {tcica}, {xlura}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ (event) adjusts/regulates/changes $x_{2}$ (ka/ni) in amount/degree $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Non-resultative, causal change; agentive adjust (= {tikygau}, {tikyzu'e}). See also {cenba} which need not be causal, {galfi} which is causal and resultative, {binxo} which need not be causal but is resultative, {zasni}, {stodi}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a cause with cease $x_{2}$ with causation conditions $x_{3}$.

$x_1$ is Austrian in aspect $x_2$
$x_1$ is an ostrich of subspecies $x_2$.

valsi.notes: s2 is omitted. See also {stuzi}, {cmene}, {stucmevla} and {stucmeske}.

valsi.notes: ($x_2$, if a set, is completely specified); See also {ganzu}, {morna}, {ciste}, {lujvo}, {greku}, {gerna}.

valsi.definition: $p_2=s_1$ is a piece of real estate possessed by $p_1$ in condition $p_3$.
$x_{1}$ is an inherent/inalienable site/place/position/situation/spot/location of $x_{2}$ (object/event).
valsi.notes: Generally used for normally stationary objects/events, to give their 'permanent' location. See also cmavo list {tu'i}, {jmive}, {diklo}, {zvati}, {tcini}, {xabju}, {jibni}, {judri}, {lamji}, {mokca}, {stali}.

valsi.definition: erase to start of discourse or text; drop subject or start over.
evidential: I generalize - I particularize; discursive: abstractly - concretely.
evidential: I generalize - I particularize; discursive: abstractly - concretely.
digit/number: at most (all); no more than.
n-ary mathematical operator: plus; addition operator; [(((a + b) + c) + ...)].
digit/number: at least (some); no less than.
Suomi Finland
quantified selbri: convert at least 2 to cardinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is a set with plural membership $x_{2}$.
quantified selbri: convert at least 2 to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is at-least-2nd among $x_{2}$ by rule $x_{3}$.
abstractor: generalized abstractor (how); $x_{1}$ is [bridi] as a non-specific abstraction of type $x_{2}$.
$x_1=k_1$ estimates numerical value $x_2=k_3=s_1$ about $x_3=s_2$
$x_{1}$ (si'o) is abstracted/generalized/idealized from $x_{2}$ [something concrete] by rules $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is dry of liquid $x_{2}$; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is arid.
$g_1$ dries/dehydrates $s_1$, removing liquid $s_2$
valsi.notes: The implied g2 is the lo nu s1 sudga s2.

valsi.definition: $x1=j1$ bakes/[cooks by dry heating] $x2=s1=g1=j2$
$x_1=r_{1jai}$ (concrete) dries $x_2=s_1$ of liquid $x_3=s_2$ with event $x_4=r_{fai}$.
$t_1$ is a dry suit for wearing by $t_2=j_1=s_1$ in liquid $j_2$.
$z_1=s_1$ is drier than $z_2$ by amount $z_4$ of liquid $s_2$.
$s_1=n_1$ is a crouton of bread $b_1$, made from grains $b_2$.
$t_1=s_1$ is the driest among set/range $t_4$ of liquid $s_2$.
$j_1=v_2=s_1$ is a raisin/sultana/currant processed from a grape of species $j_2$.
$c_1$ is the dry season of year/years $c_3$.
$x_1$ is hay of species $x_2$
$t_1=s_1$ is a desert with land location $t_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the hoof [body-part] of $x_{2}$.
$c_1$ [value] is a/the arithmetic mean in property/amount $c_2$ among $c_3$ (set)(s) by standard $c_4$.
$x_1$ add up to $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ (event/state) is sudden/sharply changes at stage/point $x_{2}$ in process/property/function $x_{3}$.
$x1=d1$ jolts from force $x2=s1=d2$
$x1=v1$ gasps air $x2=v2$
$x_1$ is a sumti qualifier labelling sumti $x_2$ with semantics $x_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a mathematical sum/result/total of $x_{2}$ plus/increased by $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ is a pro-sumti/pronoun representing $x_2$ as argument of predicate/function $x_3$ filling place $x_4$.
$x_{1}$ (experiencer) smells/scents (transitive verb) $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ smells/has odor/scent to observer $x_{1}$.
$x_1$ is a termset/set of arguments of predicate/function $x_2$ filling places $x_3$.
$x_1$ is a term (syntactic unit).
$x_1$ is a sumti tag/[preposition] showing information x2
$x_{1}$ is a/the argument of predicate/function $x_{2}$ filling place $x_{3}$ (kind/number).
$z_1=c_1$ is an East African/Masai lion [Panthera leo nubica] of breed $c_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of garlic [bulb] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$s_1$ reflects Scottish culture/nationality/language in aspect $s_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/made from/consists of wool [tight curly hair] from animal/species/source $x_{2}$.
$j_1$ is the longitude/right ascension of $j_2$ in system $j_3$
$x_1$ is Orthodox Christian in aspect $x_2$.
Finland.
Finland.
$x_1$ is Finnish in aspect $x_2$
$x1=s1=b1=v1$ sighs in relief from activity $x2=s2$
$x_1$ is the Sabbath, the day on which $x_2$ rests.
$x_1=g_1$ relaxes $x_2=s_1$ by doing $x_3=g_2=s_2$
$x_{1}$ relaxes/rests/is at ease in/by doing/being $x_{2}$ (activity).
$c_1=s_1$ is fast/swift/quick/hastes/rapid at learning $c_2$ (du'u) about subject $c_3$ from source $c_4$ (obj./event) by method $c_5$ (event/process).
$s_1=k_1$ quickly comes/goes to destination $k_2$ from origin $k_3$ via route $k_4$ using means/vehicle $k_5$.
$l_1=s_1$ dashes/speeds/swiftly travels via route $l_2$ using means/vehicle $l_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a more with exceeded $x_{2}$ with done fast $x_{3}$ with moreness margin $x_{4}$.
$x_{1}$ is fast/swift/quick/hastes/rapid at doing/being/bringing about $x_{2}$ (event/state).
$x_1$ is a roadrunner of species $x_2$.
$d_1$ is eager/impatient for $d_2=s_2$ to happen.
$g_1$ hurries/rushes/speeds $s_1$ to do/be/bring about $s_2$.
$x1=s1=j1$ grabs $x2=j2$ with $x3=j3$ at locus $x4=j4$
$x_1=sr_1=t_1=su_1$ makes mistake $x_2=sr_2$ under the conditions of speaking quickly to $x_3=t_2$ about subject $x_4=t_3$ in language $x_5=t_4$ by standard $x_6=sr_4$
$x_{1}$ is a contest with compete $x_{2}$ with rival $x_{3}$ with prize $x_{4}$.
$z_1=s_1$ accelerates/[speeds up] at doing/being/bringing about $s_2$ (event/state) by amount $z_3$.
$d_1=k_1$ is a myriad/at least ten thousands (10000) of $d_2=k_2$ in dimension/aspect $d_3=k_3$ (default is units).
valsi.notes: 'Myriades' in classical Greek is similar to the use of 萬 or 万 in East Asian languages, it can also be used generically to denote any "numberless", "countless", or "infinite" large quantity.

valsi.definition: $j_1$ is a union or loose federation of sovereign states.
valsi.notes: Cf. {su'o}, {gugde}, {jecta}, {balgu'e}. Examples: United Nations (UN), European Union (EU), Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN).

valsi.definition: $x_1$ happens sometimes in interval $x_2$.
Susan.
$x_1=k_3$ is the relationship between $x_2=k_1$, $x_3=k_2$, $x_3$...; $x_1$ is a property of $x_2$.
valsi.notes: From {su'o} {te} {ckini}. Any number of places may be used. This word was invented by xorxes and is intended as an alternative to quantified selbri with {bu'a}; it allows the relations to be specified as sumti.

valsi.definition: letteral for s.
pro-sumti: that there; nearby demonstrative it; indicated thing/place near listener.
vocative: interruption.
$s_1$ (set) discuss subject $t_2$ in language $t_4$.
tense interval modifier: habitually; subjective tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
tense interval modifier: non-habitually; subjective tense/modal; defaults as time tense.
tadji modal, 1st place (in manner 3) methodically; by method ...
sumti question asking for a method; how?.
$x1=t1=c1$ trudges on surface $x2=c2$ using limbs $x3=c3$, tired by situation $x4=t2$
$v_1=t_1$ yawns, expressing fatigue due to effort/situation $t_2$ (event)
discursive: by the way - returning to main point.
discursive: by the way - returning to main point.
$x_1$ is a tablet computer for purpose $x_2$
discursive: expanding the tanru - making a tanru.
discursive: making a tanru - expanding the tanru.
$x_1$ is a diamond (gem) from source $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of carbon/graphite/[diamond]/charcoal; $x_{1}$ is organic.
$x_{1}$ is a horn/trumpet/trombone/bugle [brass-wind/lip-reed musical instrument].
$x_1$ is a trumpet.
$t_1$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of silicon carbide/carborundum.
$j_{1}$=$t_{1}$ is a/the horn [primitive type/predecessor of brass-wind/lip-reed musical instrument] cut from $j_{2}$.
valsi.notes: tabryjirna is foremost a horn {jirna} rather than a brass instrument {tabra}, although it is used as a simple musical instrument. Don't to be mistaken for horn (brass instrument;={jirnytabra}). x2 may be species or a specific animal. Swedish horn were usually made from cow or goat. The israelic shoar were usually made from sheep.

valsi.definition: $b_1=t_1$ is charred/carbonized under conditions $b_3$.
$k_1$ is crystalline carbon (default diamond) in form/arrangement $k_3$
$p_1$ is a pencil.
valsi.notes: A specialized form of {pinsi} that uses graphite (see {tabno}) as its lead.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is organic/carbon-based.
valsi.notes: organic applies to chemicals; carbon-based to life forms. The distinction between tabyselcmu and {mivyselkra} is that e.g. calcium phosphate in bones is mivyselkra but not tabyselcmu, while polyethylene is tabyselcmu but not mivyselkra.

valsi.definition: $x_1=p_1$ (agent) touches eir tongue to/licks $x_2=p_2=t_2$ at $x_3=p_4$ [a locus on x2].
valsi.notes: $t_1$ and $p_3$ are implicitly the tongue of agent $x_1$. See also {pencu}, {tance}.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ is a study group/class studying $t_2$.
$x_{1}$ [process] is a method/technique/approach/means for doing $x_{2}$ (event) under conditions $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also practice/way/mode; style/manner/conduct (= {tratadji}); pattern (= {montadji}, {tadjymo'a}, or {platadji}, {tadjypla}). See also {ciste}, {pruce}, {zukte}, {pluta}, cmavo list {ta'i}.

valsi.definition: $c_1$ adopts $c_2=t_1$ (method) for purpose $t_2$.
$x_{1}$ studies/is a student of $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ is a scholar; (adjective:) $x_{1}$ is scholarly.
$c_1$ is a washing machine.
$x_1$ is a chemise/shift/smock of material $x_2$.
valsi.notes: Usually women's undergarments and dresses. {cmeize} for type 4. Cf. {taxfu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a jersey of material $x_2$.
valsi.notes: Knitted clothing, traditionally in wool or cotton, with sleeves, worn as a pullover, as it does not open at the front, unlike a cardigan ({tafrkardiga}). Cf. {taxfu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a cardigan of material $x_2$.
valsi.notes: A type of sweater ({nivycreka}) or jumper ({luzbarcreka}) that fastens up the front with buttons or a zipper, usually machine- or hand-knitted from wool. {kardiga} for type 4. Cf. {creka}.

valsi.definition: $tc_1$ is a clothing custom/fashion of $tc_2=ta_1$ under conditions $tc_3$ (era/region/occasion).
$f_1$ is a hole in garment $x_2=t_1$ for wearing by $x_3=t_2$ (gender/species/body part).
$x_{1}$ is snug/tight on $x_{2}$ in dimension/direction $x_{3}$ at locus $x_{4}$.
$g_1$ tucks $t_1$ onto/into $t_2$.
tamsmi modal, 1st place (like)/(in manner 2) resembling ...; sharing ideal form ...
valsi.notes: {tamsmi} is $x_1$ resembles $x_2$ sharing ideal form/shape $x_3$ in property $x_4$

valsi.definition: Converts following cmevla or zoi-quote into phenomime.
valsi.notes: Broader term than {ci'oi} and {sa'ei}. See also {tai}, {tamsmi}, {ki'ai}. Examples in some languages. jpn: しーん (shiin): soundlessly. kor: 슬슬 (seul-seul): gently. nep: हत्तपत्त (hattapatta): immediately.

valsi.definition: Taiwan
Taipei
$b_1=c_1$ is a typhoon/hurricane/cyclone moving from direction $b_2$ at speed $b_3$ rotating around centre /eye $c_2$ with rotational direction $c_3$.
$m_1$=$t_2$ is a $t_1$ form of $m_3$
$v_1=t_1$ pants because of tiring effort/situation $t_2$ (event).
$x_1$ is the morphology of $x_2$ according to methodology $x_3$.
$g_1$ is a thimble.
$x_1$ is a taxi
$x_1$ is a badger of species $x_2$
$x_{1}$ (person) challenges $x_{2}$ at/in property $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a tomato [fruit/vegetable/plant] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$t_1$ is a beefsteak tomato of strain $t_2$.
$t_1$ is a Campari tomato/tomato-on-the-vine (TOV) of variety/strain $t_2$.
valsi.notes: Camparis are deep red and larger than a cherry tomato, but smaller and rounder than a plum tomato.

valsi.definition: $t_1$ is a quantity of tomato purée of tomato variety/cultivar $t_2$.
valsi.notes: See also tomato sauce (={tamcysanso}), crushed tomato (={selmaxtamca}), tomato paste (={tamcypesxu}), ketchup (={sansrketcu}).

valsi.definition: $p_1$ is a tomato paste of composition $p_2$.
valsi.notes: See also tomato sauce (={tamcysanso}), crushed tomato (={selmaxtamca}), tomato purée(={tamcrpasata}), ketchup (={sansrketcu}).

valsi.definition: $s_1$ a tomato sauce for use with $s_2$, containing ingredient(s) including $s_3$ [tomato as main ingredient].
valsi.notes: Tomato sauce is any of a very large number of sauces made primarily from tomatoes. See also tomato soup (={tamcystasu}).

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is a tomato soup of ingredients including $s_2$ [tomato as main ingredient].
$d_1$ is/are geometrically similar/has the same shape as $d_2$.
valsi.notes: Objects that have the same shape or one has the same shape as the other's mirror image are called geometrically similar. See also congruent (={brajvetaidu'i}). CLL 18.7.

valsi.definition: $g_1$ defines $t_2$ into form $t_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the thumb/big toe [body-part] on limb $x_{2}$ of $x_{3}$; [metaphor based on relative shape].
valsi.notes: Thumb (specifically the hand = {xantamji}), big toe (= {jmatamji}). See also {degji}, {tance}, {xance}, {jamfu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a colobus of species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is cousin to $x_{2}$ by bond/tie $x_{3}$; [non-immediate family member, default same generation].
valsi.notes: Probably preferred for metaphorical siblings (over bruna). See also {dzena}, {famti}, {mensi}, {bruna}, {tunba}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ has form $x_2$, similar in form to $x_3$ in property/quality $x_4$.
$p_1=ti_1$ is a model/mannequin serving fashion/artistic/commercial concept $ti_2=ta_1$.
$m_1=t_2$ is a quantity of macaroni/penne/fusilli/shaped pasta in shape $t_1$ made from grains $m_2$.
$b_1$ is a rainbow at location $b_2=t_2$, made of water droplets $b_3$.
$x_{1}$ is a board/plank [3-dimensional long flat rectangle] of material $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/the tongue [body-part] of $x_{2}$; (metaphor: similar to nazbi, tamji, degji).
$x_{1}$ is the trigonometric tangent of angle/arctangent $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of tobacco [leaf] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x1=k1$ is the horizon at location $x2=t2$
$xu_1$ is nicotine with chemical purity $xu_2$.
$x_1$ is $x_2$ (default 1) parsec(s)
$x_{1}$ is a binary metaphor formed with $x_{2}$ modifying $x_{3}$, giving meaning $x_{4}$ in usage/instance $x_{5}$.
valsi.notes: ($x_2$ and $x_3$ are both text or both si'o concept) See also {gismu}, {smuni}.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is a pan/basin/tub/sink, a shallow container for contents $x_{2}$, of material/properties $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also bowl. See also {baktu}, {palne}, {palta}, {patxu}, {kabri} for a bowl that is normally lifted for use, {botpi}.

valsi.definition: $t_1$=$t_1$ is a skysurfingboard of material/property $t_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a box/carton/trunk/crate for contents $x_{2}$, and made of material $x_{3}$.
$x_1$ stumbles/trips over $x_2$ and falls/drops to/onto $x_3$
$x_{1}$ is a tile/cake [shape/form] of material $x_{2}$, shape $x_{3}$, thickness $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: A tile is a 3-dimensional object, relatively uniform and significant in the 3rd dimension, but thin enough that its shape in the the other two dimensions is a significant feature; 'city block' is conceptually a tile; polygon (= {taplytai} or {kardytai} - shaped like an approximately-2-dimensional block, {lijyclupa} - a loop composed of lines). (cf. {bliku}, {kubli}, {matci}; {karda}, for which the 3rd dimension is insignificant, {bliku}, {kurfa}, {matci}, {plita}, {tarmi})

valsi.definition: $si_1$ is a track of $st_1$ treading on surface $st_2$ using limb $st_3$
$g_1$ is $g_2$ pace/paces (length unit).
$x_{1}$ is an embryo/zygote/fetus/fertilized egg with mother $x_{2}$, and father $x_{3}$.
$a_1$ is a/the fetal position of body $a_2$ characterized by property/(set of) properties $a_3$ (ka).
$b_1$ is a globular cluster consisting of stars with properties $t_2$.
$x_1$ is an asterisk (* character)
$x_1$ is Gemini [astronomical constellation/astrological sign].
valsi.notes: From twin/triplet/quadruplet (={tarbykansa}). In Babylonian astronomy these stars are known as the Great Twins and are in greece associated with the myth of Castor and Pollux.

valsi.definition: $s_1$ is the/a umbilical cord connecting $t_1=x_2$ to mother $t_2=x_3$.
$s_1=t_1$ is a zygote with mother $t_2$, and father $t_3$.
$v_1$ is pregnant with embryo/zygote/fetus/fertilized egg $v_2=t_1$ with mother $t_2$ (default x1), and father $t_3$.
valsi.notes: The child-bearer x1 isn't necessarily the same as the egg donator x3.

valsi.definition: $v_1$ performs abortion/induces delivery of embryo/zygote/fetus/fertilized egg $t_1=v_2$ on $t_2=v_3$. (The survival/death of $t_1=v_2$ is not implied.)
$x_{1}$ is a star/sun with stellar properties $x_{2}$.
$c_1$ is a solar system based on star(s) $t_1$ (default is the Solar System) with stellar properties $t_2$ with components $c_3$ displaying $c_4$ (ka)
$x_1$ is stellar astronomy based on methodology $x_2$.
$x_1$ is dandelion of species $x_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of/contains/is made of tar/asphalt from source $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ [ideal] is the conceptual shape/form of object/abstraction/manifestation $x_{2}$ (object/abstract).
valsi.notes: Also pattern; $x_1$ is the mathematical or theoretical ideal form, while $x_2$ is an object/event manifesting that form; e.g. circular/circle-shaped (= {cukseltai}) vs. circle (={cuktai}, while {cukla} alone is ambiguous); model (= {ci'ersaptai}, {saptai}, {ci'ersmitai}, {smitai}). See alse {nejni}, te {marji} for physical shape, {tapla}, {bliku}, {kubli}, {kurfa}, {cukla}, {mapti}, {morna}, {sarlu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a tarsier of species $x_2$.
$s_1$ is astronomy based on methodology $s_3$.
$s_1$ is a/the galaxy (default is the Milky Way)
$tarm_1$ tartai $tarc_2$.
Tartarus
valsi.notes: In classic mythology Tartarus is a deep, gloomy place, a pit, or an abyss used as a dungeon of torment and suffering that resides beneath the underworld. See also Hades (={xades}), Hel (={xel}).

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ behaves/conducts oneself as/in-manner $x_{2}$ (event/property) under conditions $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ thirsts for $x_{2}$; $x_{1}$ needs/wants drink/fluid/lubrication $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is the way or manner in which activity/event $x_2$ is done/happens
valsi.notes: Lojban has always been lacking a gismu for "x1 is the manner of event x2" or similar. Later, {tai} started to be used for it, and then, since a BAI needs a brivla (usually a gismu) to be based on, they invented tamsmi. So {tasmi} is a true brivla for {tai}, the BAI of {tasmi}. Cf. {tai}, {tamsmi}

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a taste of $x_2$
$x_{1}$ is tired/fatigued by effort/situation $x_{2}$ (event); $x_{1}$ needs/wants rest.
$x_{1}$ is a/the breast/mammary/teat [body-part] of $x_{2}$; [metaphor: projection providing liquid].
$x_1=d_2$ is a mastodon of species $x_2$
valsi.notes: The mastodon's English name (and former genus name) comes from "breast-tooth" due to the unusual shape of its molars. They are not in the same family as elephants or mammoths {xantrmamutu}.

valsi.definition: $t_1=j_1$ a nipple/teat (mammary papilla) of $t_2$.
$tax_1$ is a bra with purpose $tax_2$.
2-word letteral/shift: change case for next letteral only.
$x_{1}$ talks/speaks to $x_{2}$ about subject $x_{3}$ in language $x_{4}$.
valsi.notes: Not limited to vocal speech, but this is implied by the $x_4$ without context of some other medium of conversation (use {cusku}, {casnu}, {skicu}, {ciksi} for weaker implication of vocal communication); converse/discuss/chat (= {simta'a}, {simsku}, {vricysimta'a} for a conversation not clearly delimited by subject). See also {bacru}, {cusku} for actual expression, {casnu}, {darlu}, {skicu}, {ciksi}, {bangu}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ talk to each other about $x_2$ in language $x_3$
$x_1$ is a bikin/two piece skimpy woman's garment of material $x_2$ consisting of top $x_3$ and bottom $x_4$
valsi.notes: Can be used in the sense of swimwear, or coordinated underwear, or even skimpy outerwear. The key aspects are two piece, for women, and covering little more than the breasts and crotch.

valsi.definition: $x_{1}$ is dress/a garment/clothing for wearing by $x_{2}$ (gender/species/body part) serving purpose $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_2$ can wear/is wearing $x_1$; refers to something intended for use as a garment, not merely something that happens to be worn at some time (which need not be true for dasni). See also {creka}, {cutci}, {daski}, {dasni}, {gluta}, {kosta}, {mapku}, {palku}, {pastu}, {skaci}, {smoka}, {lunbe}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a jackfruit (Artocarpus heterophyllus) of breed $x_2$
$b_1$ is the city/town hall of city/town $t_1$
$x_{1}$ is a custom/habit/[ritual/rut] of $x_{2}$ under conditions $x_{3}$.
valsi.notes: Also: $x_1$ is customary/usual/the practice. See also {fadni}, {kampu}, {lakne}, {jinzi}, {ckaji}, {cnano}, {tarti}, {ritli}, {javni}, {zekri}.

valsi.definition: $c_1$ is a pigeon of subspecies $c_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a town/city of metropolitan area $x_{2}$, in political unit $x_{3}$, serving hinterland/region $x_{4}$.
$x_1$ is a gull/sea-gull (genus Larus) oof species/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is a jackal of species/breed $x_2$.
$x_{1}$=$k_{1}$ (mass/jo'u) is the city council/town board of $x_{2}$=$t_{1}$.
$x_{1}$ is a station/node of/in/on transport/communication/distribution system/network $x_{2}$.
valsi.notes: $x_2$ may be represented by massed vehicles of system. See also {dargu}, {litru}, {pluta}, {trene}, {ciste}, ve {mrilu}, {tivni}, {cradi}, ve {benji}, {fonxa}, {dikca}, {fatri}.

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is sandalwood of species/variety $x_2$.
$x_1=p_1$ is a network route/path to node $x_2=p_2=t_1$ from node $x_3=p_3=t_1$ via points/nodes $x_4=p_4$ within transport/communication/distribution system/network $x_5=t_2$.
valsi.notes: Unusual in that $t_1$ appears more than once. $x_4$ is also really a set of $t_1$s. See also {tcana}, {pluta}

valsi.definition: $x_1$ is a chaparral (a region of shrubs, typically dry in the summer and rainy in the winter).
Charlie
$x_{1}$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of tea brewed from leaves $x_{2}$.
$t_1$ is made of/contains/is a quantity of tea brewed from honeybush leaves $t_2$.

See also {stace}, {xlura}, {stidi}, {kajde}.
